Charge your phone, drink your beer, and have an epic burrito.. What more could you really want? We didn't get them but the server told us how amazing the waffles are, definitely on our list for the next time we come back.





Two visits a row = very disappointing

Twice now the eggs over medium are runny - I guess when you ask for the whites to be cooked through it doesn't matter; toast not toasted?? What's up Matt??

I don't want you to "take care of my breakfast" I simply want to enjoy a good breakfast before my flight, and I'm happy to take care of the bill.





Matt's Big Breakfast is now my favorite airport breakfast spot! The friendliest staff, fast service and good food! Throw in the crispy bacon for the win! Add Tabasco instead of Tapatio, and you're a 5 star winner!





Worst service I've ever had. Matt was there and he didn't even talk to people, he seems like he doesn't care. I am all for supporting local businesses because they show they care but he didn't. Food is overrated, I heard it was the best but it's comparable to Denny's.





Ok you are in a hurry so you don't have time to sit down and eat. But hey there is a takeaway section yay!  But wait if you think it is faster be warned the woman working at this counter is super slow. No urgency at all and complaining about how busy it is. Coffee that is mad goes to the waitresses slowing things down further.  I love Matt's big breakfast and if you do too. Get to the airport early and skip the takeaway. A





One of the better airport food places I've been to.  Thick slices of bacon that you almost need two hands to eat, (exaggeration) and they were delicious.  I also had sausage, 3 eggs, bacon, potatoes and a large pancake for $13.  Liked every bit of my breakfast and can't wait to come back.





I've been looking forward to trying Matt's for a while, and finally had an excuse to grab a Sonrisa Burrito on a quick layover in Phoenix.

Oh well.

Service was somewhat slow - it was after 8pm and one person was working the register and running orders, as far as I could tell, so she would disappear for a few minutes at a time.

The burrito? Big soft flour tortilla. I got sausage, and the sausage was okay, nothing special. The eggs were dry and scant, and the potatoes needed to be in smaller chunks. Flavor was just missing, and the salsa was unimpressive. Overall, I'm glad I tried it, because now I know not to bother. It's probably better if you get a plate with bacon or something baked, judging by the crowds - I just hope that the disappointing burrito was not representative as I like their farm-to-table concept.





Monday late afternoon...50% full tables...fast service...tasty Reuben...nice waiter. Will come again.





I could tell the beef was good quality but they could've still added just a little salt and pepper.





My fianc and I stopped into here because there wasn't much to choose from at the Phoenix airport. We arrived around 7:30-8am and it was packed. We were seated fairly quickly though. 

We were originally seated at the one of the tall tables and after sitting on a plane for over 5 hours, those chairs are so uncomfortable. A booth became available and we asked to be seated there and they let us. So I was thankful for that. 

The food was pretty good. Just your regular breakfast options. We ordered Matt's big breakfast with an extra egg and toast to split. It comes with sausage, bacon, two eggs, home fries and a pancake. I enjoyed everything except the sausage, but my fianc liked it all. Home fries were flavored very well. Eggs were cooked perfectly. I also ordered a side of Mac Salad, which isn't normally available until 11:30, but they had it ready so they let me.

For the amount of people that were there and only 3 guys cooking, the food and time that it came out in was impressive. Our server was very friendly and she was very accommodating. We had a good experience here.





Excellent service here. Large portions- great value. Strawberry compote served with the toast is great - and different.  Unexpected pleasure for breakfast.





I never do one star reviews, I leave that to other  folks however I have to keep it on the realz. Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever experienced not once but twice.

Had to drop my kiddo off at the airport super duper early today. I always wait at the gate with her. I grabbed my usual coffee from the Refuge and they are always awesome! Decided to grab a sandwich to go from this place and walked up to the "to go" counter and the waitress who was prepping said and I quote "I have to check to see if we are open" and walked away. The gentlemen who was in line with me said they open @ 5:30 (it was 5:30) so they are open. There were 6 people working, bartender, host, cook, mgr and a couple other people. Why comeeeee the waitress never came back, no one acknowledged the growing line of folks waiting to order. I walked over to the bartender who was actually taking food orders for the folks who sat at the bar and politely asked if someone was going to take our orders and she said without one glance that the waitress will be over in a min. Mind you we had been standing there for 7 mins, every single person that worked there looked over at the ever growing to go line. I/we watched the waitress go get water for a table, coffee then slowly walk to get a coke! Reallyyyy folks... really! After almost 10 mins I was like let's bounce. As I walked by the waitress was taking the food order of the one table she had. Everyone else was sitting at the bar! Still not one person working there went over to the "to go" line. 

How very very rude. This  place needs to get it the heck together and revisit their customer service etiquette. The shift manager was there too! Wow just wow.  

Done and done....never again!





Really happy to find this place the morning of my flight home from Phoenix.

The servers are super cool - fun & cheery which is just what a weary traveler needs.  The couple sitting next to me were totally cracking up at their server - I had a different server but he was fun and attentive as well.  

I had the breakfast burrito (vegetarian) and it was delish!   Coffee and water were kept full and the burrito was sooo good.    I'd definitely recommend.





Yes, I'm giving five stars to an airport restaurant. Here's why. My husband and I stumbled into Matt's after being stuck overnight in Phoenix, having missed a connection on our way home to CA. Without makeup, in day 2 clothes, and jet-lagged out of my mind, I just wanted to use our meal vouchers on something. Anything.

What we got was just wonderful. Fresh, delicious comfort food. I got a hearty breakfast sandwich with egg and bacon that came with a side of rosemary potatoes. My husband had a giant crispy waffle. My Bloody Mary came garnished with peppers, pickles, cheese cubes, celery, and a slice of bacon.

But what really pushed this review to 5 stars was our server, Michael. He greeted us with sincere warmth and good humor, and kept us laughing and smiling through our meal. Believe me, that was no easy feat based on my mood! He made great suggestions for food and drink, letting me sample the Bloody Mary mix from the drink I selected before ordering (I went with a different one based on his recommendation and I'm glad I did). And when our meal vouchers exceeded the tab, he used the extra to provide us with bottled water for our flight. Not sure when I'll be back in PHX, but I'll eat at Matt's for sure, and will hope for Michael as my server.





Horrendously slow!  It's an airport, if you're this slow, you're no good.  Worse yet, I'm just talking about the to go line!  To go, to them, gets no preference.  

On top of that, they give the wrong food.  Given their before mentioned slowness, after receiving my food, I had to get on the plane, only to then discover, instead of oatmeal, they gave me an egg, bacon and cheese sandwich with potatoes.  While I'm sure it was tasty (maybe), it most certainly is not in my eating habit.  So, there I am on a 3 hour morning flight with the choice of either going hungry or eating some crap that's going to make me feel sluggish and bad all day.  I chose hunger.





Matt's at Terminal 4 in Sky Harbor.  What a great concept (adding a full bar).  The restaurant and bar, counters and tables are just beautiful.  Nice decor that reminds you of Matt's downtown.  However, the food here is just not the same.  Scrambled eggs were dry and seemed like they had been cooked for a buffet.  Potatoes not as good as the original.  Toast was superior (they must have stayed with the same baker).  I saw so much food being thrown away (folks just weren't enjoying their breakfast).  Overall, I was disappointed.  I'll give Matt's another try next time I travel and hope the quality returns.  Come on Matt, get it together and serve quality breakfasts like you are known for.





The service is always horrible. The 2 stars are for the food. There are restaurant with better service and food  in Sky Harbor if you don't have a lot of time pass this one by!





Nothing special about the oatmeal.  Service was decent but felt rushed- which is fine- I get it- we're at an airport....But then when I did want to leave I couldn't get my card run until I stood up to leave. But worst of all:  THE COFFEE WAS HORRIBLE!  Guys, this is a breakfast restraint and you can't make a half way decent cup of strong coffee?  I've had water that had more flavor!!





Probably just a bad night for them, but I interacted with 3 employees and all were short and rude and Uninterested.  I had to ask for a menu, ask if I could order a beer, and when I asked if they have chips and salsa the bartender said "no" and walked away. Nuthin. Then couldn't get them to process my payment for 10 minutes. The exception was Karina, a waitress who was friendly. The only smile over a 25 minute period.





I ordered an omelette & potatoes. The entire plate was swimming in grease. The meal was crazy greasy - not impressed. The service was as good as can be expected during the holiday rush travel hour. If this is my only choice in concourse B I'll opt for Wendy's next time.





Jen was a great server. Very attentive and friendly. The big butter burger hit the spot.





I stopped here during a 4 hour layover and had the waffles and they were great.  I had cranberry juice and water and was well satisfied.  This was a pleasant experience.





We came into the place starving and ready to devour our food. But the trouble had started with getting seated and having to fight with a father and a little girl for our seats because they thought they were sitting there even though they never got seated by anyone. After that we ordered and ended up waiting 20 minutes for our food. I ordered the 5 platter plate (breakfast sandwich), it was really good. My cousin ordered a omelet and loved it. My sister ordered the salami scramble and it wasn't good, I could make better eggs. My brother ordered the big breakfast and ate it fast.The only thing that we hated was the potatoes. The potatoes in general were fine but they were sauted in rosemary or something foul and were just nasty. The food was decently priced and you get what you pay for. Wouldn't recommend for a quick meal. Nothing special.





Good place, real friendly... Good food and drink. Not sure how these folks hold down an airport restaurant though. 10+ min to find a waitress or bartender to order, 10+ min to find someone to pay. If you're in a hurry (as ppl at the airport generally are), consider another option.





So as I strolled through the Phoenix Airport I moved passed the regular fast food breakfast fare and came across Matt's Big Breakfast and thought "this is the place."  The tables were packed and the "to go" line seemed to be moving quickly.  I checked my phone (25-30 minutes to boarding STARTED), read over the menu (Breakfast Burrito for the win) and got in line.  

The young guy working as very nice despite the fact he was obviously SLAMMED.  I should've taken the clue that 1 guy taking all the orders, pouring all the coffee, and having to run around the bar to pick up the to go food was a harbinger of issues to come, but I forged on.  He took my name and gave me my receipt.  As time continued to pass I started forgetting who ordered what and when and I noticed the crowd outside of the restaurant continued to grow, and grow, and grow.  It was cool though, I still had 20 minutes left.  Around the 25 minutes of waiting mark I figured it was time to see if I was close.  As I waited in the line AGAIN, to check the status of my food, I noticed that 3 of the 7 people in the line were doing the same thing.  I reached the front, informed the clerk that I NEEDED my food because I'd waited 30 minutes and my plane was boarding soon.  He informed me my food was up soon.  I waited about 7-8 more minutes after that and was handed my burrito.  No bag, no napkin.  Just the burrito.  As I ran off I overheard another lady requesting a refund because she couldn't wait for her food anymore.

Once I finally boarded my plane (and had to check my bag because I was one of the last 5 people to enter it), I was ready to eat.  The burrito itself was "meh" at best.  The standout was the bacon, it was amazing and it was obviously this wasn't some low cost meat, I found myself wishing the rest of the burrito emulated this taste.  It didn't.  The eggs had next to no flavor and were oily, and I'm about 90% sure the potatoes were cooked in some form of olive oil as well, because that's the only taste they had.  

Overall, I wished I had as great an experience as everyone else who sat down, ate and reviewed, however I wasn't so lucky.  Beyond having a friendly person, the express counter was a joke (40 minutes, that's good right?) and the burrito beyond the bacon completely lacked flavor.  Maybe it was just a bad day I attended, but I don't know if I'll roll the dice again.  If you go, make sure you have an hour plus and skip the burrito.





Terrible service terrible food. The fresh squeeze Oj is not freshly squeezed at all. Food is super slow. I asked the waitress to check on my food since I have a flight to catch. Her attitude was if u don't have dont don't eat here





If you enjoy fruit flies swarming around your beverage, having your meal given to the table next to you (and eaten before they discovered the problem), slow service, then THIS is YOUR place!  Hopefully I Will not get sick from the flies in my beverage!!!  
Guess I will need to wait for the next 48 to 72 hours to see if I get sick.  
I expect this in a foreign country or open air restaurant but not at an airport!





Stopped at this place for breakfast and drinks when heading home from a work/play trip. The food was great but the alcohol was even better ! Try the Bloody Mary, it contains the full package. Bacon, olives, celery, cheese blocks, it is like a meal with a side of booze ! It gets very busy !





As a person that travels for a living I've had my share of bad airport food but this place makes up for all of it. Excellent food, fresh, plentiful and great service. I will make it a point to visit them again and I bookmarked the main restaurant in the city. 
The waffles were perfect and the Reuben was too. 
Don't hesitate to visit them when you're at the Phoenix airport.





Great airport food but service was over the top.  Michael waited on us and was not only very engaging and attentive but he also made sure we got our order to go on short notice.  Mediocre airport food and service seems to be the standard but this place stood out enough for me to write a review.





Staffing needs work. I'm at an airport. I want a breakfast burrito. They took my order and 20 min later I asked for a refund. Ni complaints from me. I just have to go. There are 4 burritos ahead of me. Manager starts yelling at the staff, refunds my order and takes someone's elses burrito and gives it to me. I'm like look its ok I don't want you to throw together an order. Relax. He doesn't. Burrito that he hands me after I take it and run to my flight, is completely different and a mess nor cooked.





Wow. I stumbled across this place on a layover, and to be honest, didn't have high expectations since it's airport food, right? I was so wrong-fresh orange juice, thick peppered bacon, awesome home fries, and big pieces of homemade wheat bread toasted just right, with delicious raspberry jam. It was a little pricey, but nothing out of the norm for an airport restaurant. I'm flying through PHX again in a few weeks, and I'll definitely walk however far to eat here again.





Good quick eatery in the B - Gates of the airport.  They are zagat rated which was surprising, but I can tell the ingredients was quality.  Food came out a bit cold and was missing ingredients from what the menu stated.  All considered, I'd go back but not rush back.





Awesome food, i ordered Chop and chic. 
Lovely food and ambiance, would stop by here again. I have been to pheonix airport so many times but did not happen to be here. 
Will recommend for sure.





First review ever about an airport restaurant as they are usually mediocre at best.  But just had best airport breakfast ever with perfectly cooked over easy eggs, thick cut bacon, home fries cooked with onion and rosemary, and a nutty home grain toast with fresh raspberry jam, and locally roasted coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice.  The service was quick and the waiter was friendly and unhurried; he even brought me a large go cup of coffee gratis.  The restaurant was like an oasis in the desert after suffering all the indignities of PHX TSA. I will definitely be back.





I travel a lot....thrilled with new restaurant options. Matts is first disappointment.   20+ min for a less than mediocre Reuben.  Olive & Ivy much better and worth the hike to A gates.....and most likely faster!





Matt's is definitely a go to food place while traveling through sky harbor!

I travel a lot for work and I am always flying out of sky harbor airport, when I do I usually always stop by Matt's. They have a variety of stuff to choose from, everything from breakfast to burgers as well as some great sandwiches. You get a lot of bang for your buck as well, most places in the airport are super expensive and you don't get a lot of food. Matt's gives you great size portions! They are also very quick so if you are in a hurry but don't want to eat fast food, Matt's will get you in and out in a hurry.





This place had the best service of any airport restaurant I have been to. They were busy and short staffed but everyone who helped us was cheerful and quick. We got our food fast, our drinks faster. It tasted great. Amazing place!!





MBB needs to first understand this isn't 5-star fine dining and people are here because THEY ARE FLYING TODAY
Unbelievable slow service in an half empty restaurant and no food after 20 minutes from ordering with waiters all standing around talking to one another 

People - it's an airport - everyone has somewhere to go  - and I did- I walked out





Butter fried chili burrito and green honey ice tea while Waiting for next flight!  Friendly not cheap.though





Ask your server what's good. I'll give you a hint, *ANYTHING* with the word  "salad" in it is a dud. Not because I don't like salad, I LOVE salads! But the fancy salad, tossed "cobb" salad, egg salad sandwich, tuna salad sandwich, and macaroni salad are all VERY bland. Trust me on this one. And the tomato soup tastes like maranara sauce, but is super good for dipping the awesome grilled cheese into. Tomato soup by itself....meh. Plus....it's $7 DOLLARS for one bowl of tomato soup. No. Everything else is well worth the money. If you have any issues with your food ever, just let your server know (nicely) and they'll gladly fix it for you, seriously. Also...they don't carry ranch. WHAT!?!?! In America?????? Lame. But all their food is seriously thebomb. com, and I suggest you get with your server to help you choose. they're usually WAY busy,  but most of the time very friendly and willing to give you an honest opinion. 

Personally, I recommend the Sweet N Savory french toast. WOW. And that applewood smoked pork sausage???? WWWWOWWWW





We ended up here after our late evening layover flight dropped us off.  We had an hour and a half to kill, so we wandered about the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport unsure what eatery or drinkery to patronize.  Many places were somewhat busy, but Matt's Big Breakfast was spacious enough to draw our attention.  Even though Matt's advertises breakfast, they have a full bar also!  This was our first official day of vacation and decided to celebrate with a cocktail. We found room at the bar and ordered drinks.  I got a Patron Tequila Sunrise, while Joe K ordered a Captain Morgan rum & coke.  They actually offer you choices of premium brand liquors.  Our beverages came in ample sized glasses and they really hit the spot, quenched our thirsts and gave us a mellowing buzz.  Joe was not feeling well and was having a hard time relaxing, so the cocktails were a welcome availability.  Even though our drinks cost $14.00 each, it was a nice splurge that we don't often indulge in. 

As for the food, I can't form an opinion on, but other patrons received some delicious looking meals.  And yes, those breakfasts were quite big!  If we were hungry and had more time, I would have definitely tried out their breakfast!





Love this new breakfast option in Sky Harbor! Been there twice now (first time was late afternoon). The service at the bar was friendly and fast both times. Bacon Bloody Mary's adorned with cheese, pepperoncini and a thick slab of pepper bacon are a must! The waffle is light and fluffy and delicious. The omelette is big, cheesy & comes with mounds of home fries perfectly seasoned.





Busy place! Delicious fresh squeezed orange juice. I probably could have just ordered a gallon for breakfast. Service varied - some people were great but a few that seemed like they didn't care. Pancakes a little dry.





Absolutely the best place to stop by for food when in the PHX airport - perhaps the only place to get a decent meal! I ordered a salad to go. The woman behind the counter was super kind to me in talking to me about the different food options they have, as well as getting me a menu to order something directly from the kitchen. I ordered Tossed Cobb and waited a few minutes for it to get prepared. I realized two minutes later that the salad was already available in the refrigerated section, but the woman insisted that I order a freshly-made salad. And it was delectable! Warm chicken on top of crisp vegetables, and enormous - this is the kind of salad I want for $10. Next time, I'll try the true breakfast items that this place is known for.





Was in town for a training event and had to check this place out! Saw it on Triple D and it was as advertised if not better! The service was fantastic (all the girls were very attentive and friendly) and the food was amazing! Probably one of the best waffles I've ever had anywhere! The home fries, toast, and bacon was top notch!  I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in town! If you haven't been, you gotta check it out!





I travel a lot and this is by far the very best in airport food if not in all of burger-dom.

I picked this place at random as it was near my gate and I am so glad I did.  The food and service were outstanding.

I sat at one of the high top tables.  Plenty of room for my bag under my feet sitting there.  It was lunch so I ordered a burger.  I ordered straight from the menu, but many people requested special needs burgers and they were happy to comply.   My burger came out fast, it was cooked to perfection, very flavorful, well seasoned and just the right temperature.

My iced tea was fresh and clean.

My server, Valentin, was top notch.  A fun guy who took care of everyone with special requests and understood that in an airport environment people need to eat fast and pay fast.  He made each person around me feel special and like they were his only customer.  I can't explain it. Some people just have a gift of working with the public.  He offered to get me a to go cup of iced tea.  He is now a friend for life.

I fly into Phoenix a lot so I will be a regular customer here and, in fact, look forward to it being a highlight of future trips.

It's that good.





- Service disappointing. Irritated host around my request for a specific table. Server dripped coffee on my leather jacket; didn't seem too concerned, but did bring napkins after I already used the napkin on the rolled silverware to clean her mess. Table was ridiculously wobbly; there goes more coffee into the table. Good thing she brought clean-up napkins already. 

- Food disappointing. Lemonade tasted like dirty dishwater; replaced with coke which tasted fine. Ruben sandwich was a let down. Grilled bread was not well grilled; more of a greasy, un-browned mess. Corned beef was a little scarce, especially for the price. 

- Overall impression. I've heard good things about the MBB downtown but only had the patience to wait in line once in my life (my recollection was the breakfast was...ho hum). This was the first I've heard of MBB in the airport. It was generally disappointing and I wouldn't go back if I had other options. Also based on the Reuben, the place clearly shouldn't be called Matt's Big Lunch.... Final tip - there's a Wendy's two shops down.





Sat down and had the Mamacita burger with seasoned fries. Possibly the best airport meal I've ever had. The server was great, the food was out quickly, and unlike McDonald's didn't look like it was rushed to be put together. The bacon was crispy, the bun was lightly toasted and perfect and the burger itself was cooked as I asked and tasted awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone with 20 minutes to enjoy some great food.





Great food. Got a veggie scramble. A lot of food! Good house potatoes that are seasoned with rosemary. The rye bread was very good also. Only complaint was the water tasted gross and consequently the ice tea tasted gross. They should use filtered water if the tap is that bad.





WOW! I just needed some breakfast and got a lot more than I came for! The thick cut bacon was amazing, the eggs were cooked exactly to order, and the bread came along with some really good jam. This place only uses the best ingredients. I'll be going to this place anytime I'm at at the Phoenix airport - even if it's not time for breakfast!





This airport location is an insult to the actual restaurant. First, like all airport restaurants, this was overpriced. The chili bowl was extremely small and I ordered a side of steak fries. There were less than 10 fries. To make things worse, I waited 25 minutes for takeout. 

I had to eat the chili on the plane because I didn't have time. The staff did not pack my oyster crackers and the chili was small and way too salty.

The fries lacked taste. I loved the Phoenix Matt's Big Breakfast and hated this one.





I decided to stop here in the airport while I waited for my flight. Although they were busy I was greeted and automatically offered a drink and menu. I ordered the Matt's big breakfast with medium well eggs. Everything was really good, kind of with it was cooked just a tad bit longer for the eggs. However, the potatoes were perfectly seasoned the pancake was just right light sweet flavor to it and everything else was just right. I enjoyed the food and customer service. I'd go back when visiting.





Just had breakfast prior to my flight. This location not as good as original in downtown Phoenix. Matt needs to oversee more.





Where do I start? Let's start with a server who looked like he was going to have a complete breakdown- came over to take drink orders and I guess 2 seconds was to long for him because he told my husband sorry no offense sir but I have other tables and he walked away without taking his drink order. Ohhhhhh k We were then greeted by another server who said he would take our order (thank goodness) well.... we got our food and the pancakes were burnt and turned over to hide it. My BLT was falling apart at the seams. How do you people get away with this??? Fail





Solid portions, very flavorful, quick and great service!  

Conveniently located and good atmosphere with full bar.





Why do I punish myself. I had an hour before my flight so I gave them another shot.  Seriously, what takes so long to cook 2 eggs?  After 25 minutes and 2 server apologies later my order arrived with bacon instead of sausage. I grabbed the plate and said "i don't have time for you to fix it". They brought me sausage. Right away. Hey they can cook some things fast.  Just a mistake to stop here at the airport before your flight. Give yourself more than an hour.





Oh man, I am so glad that a super friendly patron sat next me because the service was disappointing. With that being said, the food was really good.

Service: No one cleaned the area I sat at, it took a while for anyone to get me a drink, my order was wrong and I asked for an iced tea to go twice and didn't get one. Luckily, the nice fellow that sat next me ordered an iced tea to go and he gave me his. 

Good: While my order was wrong, I did enjoy what I got which was the breakfast burrito without jalapeos and potatoes. Also, their salsa is bomb.com! I want to buy it.





Watch out!  They charge $1.50 if you need more than an ounce of maple syrup. As if the prices weren't already jacked up as an airport eatery.  

Good thing Matt doesn't manage the restrooms at Sky Harbor!





I was looking for a place to eat in the airport and even though this place only has 3.5 stars overall I decided to give it a chance. I ordered everything ala carte because there was no combo that actually matched what I wanted. I had two eggs, a pancake, and homefries. Everything was DELICIOUS. The pancake was nice and thin and barely needed syrup or butter. The homefries were amazing and the eggs cooked perfect. Total came out to around $14 incl. tip which isn't too bad. I would go back again.





Chili is one step down from Wendy's and about 4 times the cost. Even more regrettable was the service and the 20-min wait to get the said order to-go. In an airport, not making your clients sick and timeliness are probably the top 2 minimum objectives. Customers behind me received their orders sooner, which is not great when the waiting time starts to encroach into your boarding time. The most in-your-face obstinance was the supervisor's insistence that, "well, we have to heat it up individually." Yea, okay, soup can be boiled in like 4 minutes and soondobu can be made from scratch in less than 20 min. So no, uh-uh, no thank you, never again. I'll know better next time.





Tues morning 6am ,we stood at the hostess table ,  older gentleman behind the bars looked up at us ,looked around then went back to counting money never once saying hello welcome or kiss my ass. We waited at the hostess station for a few minutes before being seated. Ordered our food and our severs was without any personality. Took our order and a guy in the kitchen screamed are order to the cooks. Our food was served up quickly. I ordered a egg sandwich with bacon and potatoes, on a scale of one to ten , with ten being the best , the sandwich was a 2 , it was hot and fresh but void of favors ! Server never checked on us. The place was clean and bright .  It's better then the Wendy's but not by much.





Very good breakfast that was well prepared.  The Bloody Mary is an excellent choice. It comes with a salad bar in it! I highly recommend it.





1/8 of a star but it's not an option this picture should tell you why and not to mention the server told me that he couldn't take my drink order because he had other tables he still need to get to.





The BEST burger I have ever had in my life.  The Msmacita cooked rare, OMG, the grass fed beef just melted in my mouth.  Whenever I fly through here I hope my layover allows me to make a stop.

Give it a try, and service was great during my visit.





The best airport breakfast I've ever had. Free range eggs, house made home-fries and thick cut bacon- delicious!! You can order to - go if you don't have time to sit down and be waited on . My to-go order was quick!





Good breakfast spot from the B-terminal.  Our family landed at 6 am with a 3 hour layover until our next flight.  The hot coffee is decent.  We got Matt's Big Breakfast x 2.  One order we subbed the griddle cake for toast.  The griddle cake is sweet and delicious (almost reminiscent of corn bread).  The toast was a large slice of multi-grain with a very tasty raspberry jam.  We also got sweet and savory which includes two french toast with a sausage.  

The short: good place for breakfast indeed!





FLY THRU BREAKFAST

I was flying through the PHX airport & had a 3 hour layover. I searched Yelp & found many 4 star restaurants. How could this be? It's an airport! Airports never have good food, so I decided to spend some time walking around checking them out before making my choice. I finally decided to eat at Matt's because it seemed like the all American Breakfast. 

The place was packed at 8:30 in the morning. I wanted to sit at the bar but took the first available seat at a community table. I then noticed there were power outlets scattered through the space but not every seat had access to power. I then asked the hostess if she could find me a spot where I could eat and juice up my phone. She spotted an opening at the bar & told me to grab it. When I arrived I had to squeeze between two guys. My new neighbors were excited to learn about the outlets & they quickly plugged in their devices. So be aware power is available here you're just going to need to find it before you sit down. 

I looked through the menu & I wanted to eat everything. I finally decided to go with Matt's Big Breakfast. It had a little bit of everything. I must also point out that the food is made fresh from scratch with the finest local ingredients around. I love that & I could taste that love in the food. 

My dish came with 3 fresh cage free eggs which I ordered sunny side up. These eggs were no yolk. The eggs tasted amazing & reminded me of Phil's Organic Eggs we buy in the Chicagoland area.  This place locally sources there food & it makes a difference. 

The thick cut bacon is from a local butcher in Queen Creek, AZ & it was so delicious. It was cooked perfectly & had hints of pepper on it. My breakfast even had sausage that was formed into patties. The sausage came from a local butcher up the street near their downtown location. It was some of the freshest sausage I've ever had. I loved it because it reminded me of the sausage patties I make at home for breakfast. It is so nice to have a hand formed patty &!not something over processed & frozen in a factory. 

I really liked the home fries. I'm usually not a fan because this breakfast item at other restaurants is always tasteless & dry but not here. A lot of love goes into this side dish. They take Yukon Gold Potatoes, first boil them, then they bake them and finally finish them off by frying them in butter. They also add some sauted onions & then season them with salt, pepper & rosemary. These potatoes are as good as my breakfast potatoes & I don't share that kind of compliment with just anyone. 

I washed all of that down with a house made griddle cake which is just a fancy word for pancake. This was one of the best pancakes I've had in a long time. The best part it was topped with real sweet cream butter & real Maple syrup. Both of these toppings pushed this amazing griddle cake beyond extraordinary. I didn't use all the butter but it tasted like real butter which is something I don't taste anymore with all of the fake processed food we are being served. I'd like to pass a law that says, "If there is no Real Syrup then you can not serve pancakes!"  Sorry Aunt Jemima but you don't cut it anymore. Real is the way to go. 

Prior to leaving to go & catch my plane I stopped at the pass to tell the staff how much I loved their food. I wanted them to know I appreciated all of their hard work.  They were cranking out some great food. The kitchen space is not big at all yet they kept making fantastic food to hungry travelers. 

There were many breakfast options on the menu. I was enjoying seeing what all my neighbors at the bar were getting.  The scrambled eggs with spicy salami looked so good. It was on my list but it didn't come with a pancake so I opted for Matt's Big Breakfast. The breakfast sandwich & breakfast burrito looked good too. I would love to mention that this place is priced great & it won't break your travel budget. My whole dish was $12.50 which is totally reasonable for everything I ordered. 

I must mention that there is a full bar. Everyone around me was drinking but it was 8:30am on a Friday morning. I couldn't do it, after 8 days in Vegas. I really didn't want to see liquor again.  The real temptation was when the person across from me ordered one of the Bloody Mary's. I wanted to ask them if I could take a photo of it but I didn't want to be that guy. It was one of those that was not only a drink but a meal too.  I will always have an image of that masterpiece in my head. 

So if you're flying through PHX then do your foodie homework because there are many great options to eat at here. You will really be surprised at all the great ratings for the restaurants. I do highly recommend you stop in here for breakfast. Matt's has a great All-American breakfast that will keep you going all day long. You make me want to connect through PHX now when I fly.





Needing my protein for supper, and my low carbs. Love that I found a place in the terminal at PHX that serves breakfast all day. The hostess, Chyrisse, was extremely helpful and friendly.





For an airport breakfast this restaurant was over the top. The breakfast sandwich was excellent. I think the key was the sauted sweet onion and the excellent roll it was made on. Our server was also excellent I asked for a little more coffee right as the bill came and she filled up a to-go cup for me.  My girlfriend got a Bloody Mary that I am pretty sure could have served as a meal in itself. And the price wasn't bad for an airport. The breakfast sandwich with potatoes was $10 and too much food for me to finish.





After seeing all of the reviews when we first moved out here, we decided to give it a shot one morning while exploring Phoenix. We really weren't all that impressed. The food was "ok," the service was "ok," the dining area left something to be desired, for sure, and was incredibly noisy. I guess if we're around the area and literally can't find anything else, we may stop by again... But it was just "ok." We don't understand the hype.





Good food, great drinks, and even better service! I had a couple lovely ladies serving me and keeping me company as I was flying alone and arrived to the airport way too early! The only thing about this place that bothered me was their god awful uniforms! Those shirts would be better worn for servicing the plane over serving me drinks.





This place gets you with the smell because smells really good, but do make sure you have time to wait for your food. A simple sandwich to go it took over 20 minutes. I am just glad I had time to wait for my flight. The staff however is great, very friendly and accommodating.





Reviews scared me a little but I can say my experience was very good...
service was exceptional. I had the French toast and sausage...very good...and the orange juice is fresh squeezed...at least that's how it tasted...none of that funny added sugar many restaurants serve...for an airport extremely reasonably priced....had the sausage not been a little over cooked this would have been 5 star rating





Food isn't bad for an airport restaurant. Service is HORRIBLE!  No teamwork, tons of servers, but no structure, people grouped up talking, I would say it's horribly managed..... waited 30 minutes for a BLT with chips. Never once checked on my drinks or came by to inform me of the hold up. Do yourself a favor and keep walking......





I love  Matts Big Breakfast  but this location isn't the same as the one I go in downtown Phoenix.
They don't have any hash browns which is a must have every time I go to Matts. The toast here was not even warm my butter didn't even melt (wtf)? It looked like they were pre toasting the bread to save time. I asked the waitress and she said it's what they do since it gets so "busy". I've seen the original location twice as "busy" as this place but they don't half assed on their quality.

Save yourself the disappointment and go to the downtown location.





My flight was in another terminal, but I came to the airport early so I could go to Matt's. My last experience was good. This experience was not so good. The sonrisa burrito is nothing to smile about. The garnish on the Bloody Mary was stale.





Stopped in while waiting for a connecting flight. Absolutely awesome cheeseburger. One of the best I've ever had. Not something you'd expect at an airport. Service was great too.





SLOOOOOOWWWWW. Do not come here if you have any sort of limitations on time - not even for take out. I've been here a million times and there is NO sense of urgency from anyone. To greet your table, to take orders, to get you anything. I know this and still made the mistake of ordering take out. Why it could possibly take 25+ minutes to make scrambled eggs & toast to go is beyond me. The food is good but not worth the excessive waiting. It borders on ridiculous. The staff is hit or miss with friendliness - but usually miss.





Dang this place was good! Before traveling, my SO and I stopped here to eat since we had time and I was not disappointed. The hostess was a bit dry, bored, and wrung out but the rest of the staff was very welcoming and friendly so I won't let her influence my opinion. This place seems like the spot that would be packed all of the time, so expect to be rubbing elbows with a stranger while you eat. Aside from this, the food was great! I got their grilled cheese and french fries which were fantastic, they use a really thick bread which made the sandwich even better. I would definitely come here again...if I'm ever delayed and forced to fly Southwest again -_____-





Had a meeting this morning in Phoenix landed at the Skyharbor Airport. Tip on traveling coast to coast, eat before flying. I was scared to eat that I might be going to the bathroom during the flight. Lucky, I had water and some crackers to fill me for my flight. Once I landed I headed over to MBB for the chop & chick with OJ and homefries. A splendid meal well cooked and the eggs were fresh. Their menu caters to most fans but I can't wait to go home tomorrow and try their other selections. Fresh and tender the chop and fries.





This place is a an amazing addition to an airport. The food is absolutely delicious. If there is a wait it is worth it!





This absolutely the best and most reasonable airport food around!!  Had the omelet with mushrooms, peppers and bacon - done to perfection!!





I had the Cobb salad and a diet coke. The food was excellent and a great option at sky harbor airport. The bartender was very friendly and even noted to someone else how great the Reuben sandwich is.





Just popped in for a quick bite and glass of wine between flights.... the bartender was wonderful -- fast and attentive, but not intrusive and the grilled cheese w tomato soup was probably the best decision I've made all day.  It could stand to have a little bit more cheese, but totally delicious-hits-the-spot-comfort-food otherwise. 

The only thing that I found to be bad was he host -- a young man. He was looking down at his phone and did not look up at all as I approached nor as I was standing in front of him. He asked "bar or table" without even looking up but completed his text message. I waited for him to at least make eye contact at which point he asked me again, "bar Or table" in a tone that made me feel as though I was seriously inconveniencing him.





Really good airport food. I've eaten here a few times since it has a great location amongst the American Airlines gates. They have pretty great food and the only comment I have is that the service is spotty. Overall I've had good service but the last few visits the tables around me have gotten their food first, even if it was the same as my order.
All in all I will definitely go back, but don't stop to eat in if you have less than an hour to spend.





At the bar I ordered the standard two egg breakfast, named some kind of hipster BS like two chicks and a pig or something. I opted for fruit instead of the home fries. My server was prompt and the drinks / food came quickly, however, the fruit was so old looking I couldn't bring myself to eat it. One of my pet peeves is wasting food so I can't recall a time I sent something back but in this case I was willing to forego that side all together. The server tried without me asking to get a fresher bowl but she even admitted upon her return from the kitchen that it all looked unappetizing. She didn't offer another side of anything else to make up for the rotten fruit. If you have the time for a sit down meal, take a moment to find another eatery. In hindsight, I'm sure Wendy's next door would have been better...





Keep in mind, any time you're dining at the Airport, there are going to be some expensive prices that you'd definitely reconsider elsewhere. This is the case here. A burger and a drink (lemonade) cost $18.72 prior to the tip. Yikes! This is not "horrible" but at the same time it is higher than what I would have valued the food at. 

Steak fries seemed to be prepackaged. Burger was "just ok." My friend asked what it would cost to add jalapenos to her burger and was told 2$ -- deary me, that was a no go, and put a bad taste in our mouths. 

Service was slow on getting the food out. The server, however, was somewhat apologetic about it. All in all is was just an average/ok experience.





Ordered a Cheese Omelet to go. After 35 min. went to counter to inquire how much longer. Cashiers came back saying she didn't know what happened to order. I requested a refund as I was going to be late for flight. Manager showed up 8 minutes later, to inform me she had to issue refund through my e-mail. No apology was given and still have not received a refund!





Matt's was certainly enjoyable (all locally grown organic for my BIGGEST bfast-love the peppered bacon) and Michael (server) was a treat. This world needs more of his spirit, especially in this profession.  Keep smiling!





Came back because I recalled having a nice breakfast about 1-year ago. My connecting flight is at another terminal and left there to try this breakfast again.
Had Matt's Biggest Breakfast for $13.99. Sausage and bacon were special. Would have preferred the toast over the so-so pancake. 
Eggs came out slightly more 'easy' than 'medium', but was acceptable for me since I like it either way. 
Sat at bar. Katie provided good service while working the bar. Checked back. Kept busy. Even made sure my water was refilled. Thanks Katie.
(normally don't write reviews)





Matthew was my server and he was fantastic!  He was prompt, efficient, friendly, and got my order right!  He was working a number of tables and I was quite impressed watching him maneuver and ensure everyone was cared for.  The restaurant is in Terminal 4 so quite busy but they seemed to be turning the tables well.  I had just a couple minute wait but they also have an express option - takeout area - for those that don't have time.  I had an omelet that was very good.  The restaurant itself is clean and comfortable.  The hostess was friendly as was the person that delivered my food.  Good experience all around - which I certainly appreciate when in the midst of airport hustle/bustle.





Stopped by Matt's at Sky Harbor waiting for an evening flight.  I ordered the Sonrisa Burrito (no meat) which contains eggs, cheese, potato, & jalapeno.  Who doesn't love breakfast for dinner? :) The waiter asked if I would prefer Avocado in lieu of the meat - so I bit and asked for it on the side.  I also requested extra jalapeno.  

For an adult beverage, I ordered a double Tanqueray and soda water with lime.  

The drink came out first.  Immediately I could tell two things: it wasn't Tanqueray in my glass, and the drink was definitely not a double (although it was in a tall glass.)  I mentioned the drink to my waiter, and he explained that a double is 2 ounces, not the customary 3.  I requested an additional double (neat) to test my theory.  Sure enough, it was not what I had ordered, it was well gin (brand unknown.)  I wont speculate as to why - draw your own conclusions.  All in, my premium double was $30, and it was not premium or drinkable.  

On to the burrito:  in AZ (generally speaking) if you order jalapenos, the unspoken rule is that they will be fresh.  In this case, they were pickled nacho slices and missing all of the fresh jalapeno flavor.  The eggs were burnt to a crisp, and this is coming from a guy who does not specifically enjoy the classic runny yolk or French omelette.  They put the avocado in the burrito instead of on the side.  On top of being extremely overcooked, the eggs and potatoes were completely under-seasoned... no salt or pepper that I could taste.  The side of salsa was mediocre, but edible.  

To sum it up: at Sky Harbor, find food and beverage elsewhere.  I left with a $50 tab (I did tip the waiter, as he was courteous and quick.) For $50 bucks, I had a few sips of a beverage I did not order and a few bites of a bad burrito.





We had a great breakfast.  Fresh home style cooking.  Not frozen and reheat like what would be expected from an Airport eatery.  If you're hungry and looking for good food Matt's is the place.





Wow, so the bacon was amazing, there's the 1 star... but if you order an alcoholic drink don't order the liquor. Well liquor (base model) is over $12 dollars a shot. These are more than the highest Priced clubs in Scottsdale. So if you're catching a flight and think, oh a screwdriver would be nice... think again, or go elsewhere. The prices are outrageous and the staff was crazy defensive about me questioning the price. Yo, this isn't the Encore in Vegas.





Decent food for an airport. 
Everything was fresh and all American. 
Was disappointed in the foul language coming from one of the servers who wasn't quite sure what he wanted to be yet?? 
Food was great. Language and his obnoxious demeanor were strange.





My wife and I had an awful 13 hour lay over in Phoenix. We arrived around 8 pm and our flight wasn't until 10 am the next morning. The original plan was to eat a good dinner and try to fall asleep... Unfortunately our plan didn't work out. 

We didn't get our bags until about 845 and all the restaurants were closed, so we scarfed down a pizza. Around 2 am I was searching on Yelp for some good breakfast. 

I got the steak and eggs and it was cooked to perfection. Most steak and eggs are overly cooked but this steak was JUICY. My wife got a waffle with bacon. The waffle was so fluffy and had just about enough sweetness. The bacon here is also amazing. Never had bacon like this before. It was a thicker cut and seasoned with pepper. She also got a mimosa and I got a Bloody Mary. Both were really good. Thanks Matt's Big Breakfast for making this long lay over enjoyable.





Terrible place.  Bacon and potatoes are covered in pepper.  Eggs over easy were raw and cold.  Toast was cold.





Pretty good. Better than most other airport food place. I had cheese omelet w all the add ons. Makes it a $13.99 omelette but was pretty good. Onions were a little mushy but not bad. I would recommend this place. Almost worth 5 stars





No wait to sit at the counter what a mistake. Worst service I ever had. No set no acknowledging I was there ask for coffee twice.  No silverware.  Never got a refill.  Order came out cold

Just a horrible service experience. And the restaurant was only two thirds full.  If you need to be ignored and eat overpriced even by airport standards cold food. Served by staff that should not be dealing with the public then eat here.





There aren't that many good places to eat in Sky Harbor...mainly bland chains or local restaurants trying to do their best impression of their original location but falling far from the same. This Matt's is definitely not as good as the original in downtown Phoenix, but when you have no choice and need a good breakfast before your flight, stopping here is a fairly good choice. My wife and I ordered the hog and chick. The meat was savory and the egg was adequately seasoned. I loved how the bacon was a little more wet/chewy than dry/crispy, as I tend to dislike the latter. I didn't get a chance to try their signature pancakes this time but they didn't look that bad either.





This place is great!!!!!! Great food,  fast service and fresh food.   If I'm ever in the Phoenix airport again I'll be back





If you check out my profile, you will see that I don't often leave negative reviews, however I'm going to have to add one for the terrible food I received here today.

I ordered the Biggest Breakfast with scrambled eggs and what came out can only be described as the single worst plate of breakfast "food" I have ever received. Most of the components where flat out inedible. My scrambled eggs were the consistency of an eraser. The eggs were clearly forgotten about on the griddle and simply chopped up when it came time to plate them, after they set into hard plastic discs. The sausage was even worse! Small salty dried out pucks. I actually knocked them on the plate and they made a hard pinging sound which amused my neighbors. The potatoes were soggy with grease and tasted like funky rosemary. My hotcake came out flat as a crepe. It at least was edible after I drenched it in butter and syrup. Even the bacon was dry and chewy. How do you mess up bacon???

I hope the management starts to pay better attention to the quality of the food being served. I've worked in restaurants before so I know breakfast can be especially hard to manage and I don't like leaving bad reviews but what happened today was inexcusable.





Quick service all around. Amazing food... Sky Harbor has revamped their food choices and I can honestly say this place is up there with Arizona top breakfast places (heard good things about their other locations as well.)
Great ok every way. 
Oh, and the bacon. The bacon was unbelievable.





Can't believe what a great breakfast place this is at the airport they need to open all over the valley if you are in terminal B ask for Katie she rocks!!! Great friendly customer service !!!





I honestly believe the food and setup here is better than the original restaurant downtown.  I had the breakfast sandwich on toast instead of the roll (highly recommend).  If you have an hour plus until your flight and want some breakfast, look no further.





Seating service was slow for an airport.  Breakfast was big serving but toast came out cold.





This place is a joke.  They are supposed to open at 6:30.  At 6:50 we're still waiting to seated because "we've gotten a late  start".  Then, someone, a server, finally suggested to the manager sitting with her coffee playing around on her lap top, that they could open the to go place line only. I'm sorry, but I have no patience with business owners / bad managers that can't get their stuff together.  Great way to kill s business.  I know I will NEVER PATRONIZE THIS  ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN.





Would love to tell you about the food but I stood at the entry for a few minutes and then left. No sign about seating yourself or waiting. No employee made eye contact. Guess they don't need our business.





Sit down breakfast options are super limited in the Phoenix airport and Matt's in generally packed.  I ordered the salami scramble and fresh juice that was pretty good.  Service was okay.  Nothing spectaular, nothing terrible.  OK option if you're not in a big hurry.





Best Breakfast and their bacon is to die for...I always stop when flying thru..skip their brkfst sausage tho but be sure to get a Bloody Mary...Yumm!





The meal was great, whole wheat  toast was very tasty with preserves and blueberry  lemonade was thrist quenching!!





This is a chain breakfast spot that serves breakfast foods all day. This location is in the airport. You can order at the counter and get it to-go or sit-down with waiter service. This place has bar seating as well. I tried the $13 chili cheese burger and the $9 breakfast burrito served with chorizo. You could choose sausage or bacon instead of chorizo. The burger was huge and came with a side of French fries. My bf thought they didn't give enough fries. The burrito came with a side of pico de gallo. It wasn't enough so I asked for a 2nd but I think 3 would have been enough for me. I liked the burrito more than the burger. It was surprisingly super spicy. The burger had an awesome fluffy bun but a very thin piece of meat and some drier chunks of ground beef in the chili. The chili was more just ground beef and some beans than a chili. It wasn't very wet at all. The shredded cheese inside wasn't really melted. The water they gave tasted like there was a bit of lime. It had a metal flavor to me. I like the interior decor (had a giant pig on the wall and large bench-style seats with long round leather pillows) and music playlist (indie music). Their downtown location was featured on the TV show Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.





I was excited when I had enough time till my flight to eat here. I was a little underwhelmed considering how much people love this place. 

They were accommodating and quick, which is important for an airport restaurant obviously. 

I ordered the breakfast burrito. It has too many Jalepenos and not enough other flavors. I had to pick half of them out and then add salt pepper and hot sauce for it to taste good. Maybe I just ordered the wrong dish?? Maybe the one in dt phx is better? I wanted to love it but it was just bland. 

I'm willing to give it another shot but no breakfast burrito for me again.





Great food and service. Waiter Michael is a treasure! Our family was heading to Bakersfield : ( and he managed to put a smile on our faces- service with a smile and truckloads of personality!! Don't let him go!





I have no words for this one. Those place, as the name implies, is a breakfast place. That's their emphasis. So why do they have no half- and half for coffee?  All they have is milk. Saying this is a gross oversight would be an understatement.





You had me at Bacon Bloody Mary. With it's rimmed bacon salt, stuffed olives, cheese, and its penultimate bacon, I was surprised how effective this airport spot was. Could go without the pickle, but that's my preference. I don't write too much for airport eateries, but this one in Phoenix has reason to return between flights.





The waiter Micheal is amazing and makes this place a great place to eat. Keep it going Michael.





There 5-10 min.  Employees make eye contact then ignore. Tell manager and she gives me the "oh so sorry" scripted response.  Terrible customer service and based on mgrs response I know why.





We were surprised to find Matt's Big Breakfast at the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. We usually visit the downtown location when we travel to Phoenix, but ran out of time this trip.  
Low and Behold, we got our fix at the airport.
The menu is a little different than the restaurant. Caters to breakfast, lunch, and dinner. 
The food is still great!





Tasty, well priced with pleasant and quick service.  Matt's uses the best ingredients and it makes a difference.  Portions are very healthy.





Cannot overstate what a great experience this was. Gotta start with the food: my griddle cakes were amazing and my wife's waffle was just about as good. Delicious thick slab, peppered bacon was the perfect side. Coffee was not as good as the food (always the conundrum-give up coffee shop quality for better food?), but at least plentiful. Service was beyond friendly, though marred by lacking silverware after our food was served (thankfully, the butter still melted). Probably the best airport dining experience I ever had. Hope our connection next week allows time for a return engagement.





Food was decent, but customer service needs an improvement. Cleanliness also needs to improve.





Amazing Bloody Mary with a slick slice of bacon, 2 chunks of cheddar and pepper jack cheese plus olives and a pickle. Not too strong but not weak,  a prefect drunk for a long morning! Loved the breakfast sandwich and the breakfast burrito with jalapeos, pefect amount of kick :) wish we had one in Portland Oregon!





There are not enough words to describe how much I like Matt's. It is the most awesome breakfast place ... not just in Phoenix, not just at the Airport, but it is the top of our list ANYWHERE! We recently had the opportunity to be on a flight that was late and missed our connection causing an overnight ... woo hoo ... we got to go to Matt's for breakfast!!! Great service ... spectacular menu ... all the things we like in a place ... AND good coffee.





Good food. Good drinks - they don't skimp on the booze either, full glass of champers for the mimosa and the Bloody Mary is filled with goodies and a lot of vodka! Not quick though, only stop in when their busy if you've got at least an hour to spare.





First of all, they charge $12 for Maker's Mark on the rocks. I asked for a double and barely got what would be a single pour in any respectable bar in STL. Then after questioning the pour, the server tried to convince me they overpoured the drink. After that I ordered a BLT. Clearly they didn't explain the B in BLT stood for bread. The description in the menu said bacon, lettuce and tomato. Clearly the person in charge of doling out the bacon just got finished pouring the double shots of Maker's Mark. They told us we were getting, and they actually got excited about this, freshly made kettle chips. If they didn't open a bag of Walmart kettle chips and pour them on the plate, then I've clearly never had authentically made kettle chips. The portions are a joke, the prices are high and the servers aren't very personable or accommodating.





The best bartender EVER, ANYWHERE!  We arrived in Phoenix in the morning, but my body thought it was lunchtime.  Matt's was not serving lunch yet, but the bartender said  we were welcome to order burgers from next door and bring them over.  He set us up with place settings and drinks and we were happy campers.  One does not expect customer service like this at an airport restaurant - the bartender (geez, I wish I could remember his name) was exemplary.  It was so much fun to watch him work - providing great service to all and doing so with a smile on his face and a serious spring in his step.  I would eat there again in a heartbeat.  Everyone around us was happy with their food, and I must add that the bacon bloody mary looked beyond amazing.  I will have one the next time... for sure.





I would highly avoid the Matt's Big Breakfast Takeaway location in the airport. They state it will take only 15 minutes to receive your order. However, it took almost 40 with no customer service apologizing for the wait. I would pick up breakfast else where because their time estimate is unrealistic. I had an hour until my flight boarded and left the food at the restaurant because it still was not ready by the time I needed it.





You better have a LOT of time on your hands. Waited 29 minutes for my breakfast sandwich, and the finally asked for my money back. That took an additional 10 minutes, during which time the sandwich still never came out. Finally got my money in time to barely jump on my plane. The best part is on top of everything I was ace to feel as if everything was my fault somehow. Not one "sorry for the inconvenience" or anything of the sort. Every single person I encountered including two managers (?) were completely rude. 

Great way to spend my 45 minutes in Phoenix.





They'd rather ignore you than deal with you. Don't go in anywhere close to last call. Rude bartender. Our waitress was nice- her name was Katrina I think? But the lack of communication got in the way of her doing her job. 
I had a "please just let me give you my money" smile on my face, but nobody would make eye contact. Bummer. 
And dear host- if it's that close to last call, don't encourage people to go in and give it a try... It's embarrassing for me as I sit and wait, and embarrassing for you when I walk out disappointed.
My advice- just be nice and be honest!





Our flight to Newark was scheduled to leave at 9:45am this morning.  By the time we made it through security, it was 9:20... (I'm one of those people that cuts it a little too close sometimes).  I was starving though, and knew I needed to eat something prior to the five hour flight!  Luckily, Matt's came to the rescue!

I ordered a Sonrisa Burrito to-go.  It comes with eggs, cheese, jalapeno peppers, potatoes, and your choice of bacon or sausage.  I ordered mine with sausage and no potatoes.  It was a generous serving and I actually ended up splitting it with my husband.  We devoured it and agreed that it was delicious.  I would have liked some salsa to go with it though.  Next time, I'll ask for that!

I'm now writing this review on the flight and feeling good after filling my belly... If you find yourself at Sky Harbor anywhere close to Terminal 4 - B gates, Matt's is a great option.  You can eat in or take it to-go.  So glad that we have so many decent options at the PHX airport now!  Bon appetit and safe travels!





Solid breakfast!  I've been here four times while waiting for my connecting flights and have always ordered the Matt's Biggest Breakfast - 2 sausage patties, 2 strips of thick-cut bacon, eggs, potatoes and a pancake.  Wow, this meal is solid!  Everything is flavorful and fresh!  They have real maple syrup and ketchup without high fructose corn syrup - another plus!  My husband has ventured to try other menu items and they never disappoint.

The service has always been great and fast, which is needed, especially in an airport.  I highly recommend a stop here if you happen to find yourself at the Phoenix airport - Gate B!





Bad service. Bought the food from the cashier. Thought i can sit down to eat. But it's a to go order so they said no you can't sit down to eat even though the restaurant is empty. Sub-standard service.





Not recommended in any sense! Matt's Big Breakfast might be the slowest restaurant I've ever experienced. The quality of the food was barely approaching average and the cost was typical of an airport eatery. It was probably half full of customers and they appeared to have a full wait staff on hand. I sat at the bar and saw at least ten plates ready for delivery in the kitchen while the staff just wandered about ignoring it. The only people that appeared mildly interested in working were the cooks and the bartender. That being said my egg and bacon bagel was of the quality typical of a hungover college student. For the amount of time that I waited and the cost I could have left the airport and eaten at an actual restaurant.





Matt's in the airport, love it. This was one of our favorite meals in Phoenix and now we can get a taste even when just passing through the city. 

Great food for breakfast or lunch, fun music mix, and nice staff make this a go to spot, especially in an airport!





Bad Decisions I've Made in 2017:

1. Picking up a skillet fresh out of the oven with my bare hand.
2. Believing the NY Giants were going to win.
3. Leaning into the trunk of a cab too early, and gashing my head on the rebounding door.

Good Decisions I've Made in 2017:

1. Getting the Sonrisa Burrito before I got on a plane back to NYC.

(Clearly killing it this year.)

Admittedly, my Phoenix airport eatery experience is a bit limited, but after drinking liquor of questionable quality until the wee hours of the morning, this burrito quite possibly saved my life. 

Although the menu only lists bacon and sausage as meat options, chorizo was a nice surprise choice. Beware, it's going to take 15 minutes for this thing because it's real food, and they have to grill the burrito. Which is so, so worth it, even if you have to miss your flight and live in PHX for the rest of your life.

Well, maybe not then.





Best breakfast burrito!  Great service from the "Lisas".  Good spot to kill some time on a layover.  Seriously, the breakfast burrito is delish.  Grilled with just the right amount of spice. Enjoy!





The service was great but the pancakes and eggs were cold upon arrival. This was the airport location so maybe there's something to be said for that but the cold food didn't excite my early morning experience.





If you have time during your layover for more than grab and go, this is a nice little place to grab some breakfast. I had Matt's Big Breakfast. Three eggs, bacon, sausage, pancake, and potatoes. Everything was delicious! Thanks Matt for allowing me to eat your breakfast!





(The opening times on Yelp aren't correct)

Decent burger - decent beer, decent service 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars.





Horrible service at the bar. Understaffed. Decent beer list but overpriced garbage for wine. If you have time, go to Blanco Taco in the A gate area. This place is a joke.





Not really sure how this place only has 3 and a half stars. They've got all the hallmarks of a great breakfast place (aside from being in the airport, of course). But Matt's isn't just good for being in the airport; it's good all around. 

The service was spectacular, even the host who had to put up with a lot of attitude from angry people who didn't want to wait for a table. 

The menu prices were decent too, aside from the alcohol of course. But the hog and chick breakfast was $10.99 and comes with all the usual fixings. This is more affordable than most brunch places nowadays, but it was stellar! The toast and bacon were memorable. 

Next time I find myself in need of breakfast in the Phoenix airport, I will be headed to Matt's!





Great vibe, HUGE portions. Twilight, my server, was professional and really fun. I had the Cheese Omlet and couldn't finish it was so huge. Recommended.





Amazing bacon. Simply superb and unexpected for an airport terminal. Phenomenal. Great price.





Great food and excellent service!!!  I had the Sonrisa burrito.  I would highly recommend it.





Cheese omelet: Potatoes were very tasty, but greasy (and I'm fine with some grease in my homefries). Good whole grain bread in the toast, but disappointing that there was no butter. Omelet overcooked, but much worse was that the cheddar cheese was chewy & stringy--somehow badly overcooked, which is difficult to do in an omelet. Very slow (albeit friendly) service, too--not good in an airport restaurant.





Wish I would have found this place
years ago.

You never know from the store front but if you're looking for a great breakfast, then look no further, Matt's is the place for you.

The staff at Matt's is accommodating, the food is amazing, and the prices are very reasonable.  The quality of the ingredients  is evident in everybite. Matt's takes breakfast  to a new level. 

Matt's big breakfast, is just that, big. Matt's serves classic breakfast food with a  twist of unique combinations.   Today I had salami  and eggs, homestule potatoes, sourdough bread with homemade peach preserves.  All I can say about the peach preserve is it was absolutely delicious and it's made at Matt's daily.

If your looking for a great breakfast at a reasonable price give Matt's a try.





My favorite breakfast spot and the ONLY reason I enjoy not having a direct flight with a layover at PHX airport is this place! They have such healthy and delicious options. Everything is so fresh! Can't wait until my next layover to eat here!





10 minute wait for a table. There were 2 of us. They wouldn't separate the 4 top for us and the couple right behind us. Wait, a table for 4 finally arrived. No wait, their table was ready.  No waffles ( or any sweet & savory) and no mushrooms. Antone, who originally took our name, was a pleasure. The gal he was working with (no name tag) actually was yawning while talking to us. Might be a little thing but not a good first impression. We waited 24 minutes for our food and I had to send my pancakes back because they were burned on the bottom. My husband's breakfast burrito was mediocre at best (his words) It was a Sunday morning at 9am.





You might have to wait if you visit the downtown location but no wait here. They pour a generous mimosa. Their BLT come on fresh sliced bread, with thick slices of bacon. I like to add avocado. The pancakes are perfect and served with real Vermont syrup. Great place to eat before you get on a long flight.





Great, great spot to wait for your plane if you're in Terminal 4. When I went to Phoenix ages ago (and ate carbs with no abandon), this was my favorite place in Phoenix!  Now that I don't enjoy the pancakes or the hash browns, I am still glad to post up at Matt's, enjoy some of their delicious peppered bacon, grab a drink (or a few), have great service, and listen to good music while sitting in an airport.

Thanks Matt's!





Pretty solid cafe in the middle of the PHX airport.  one of the few places they will seat you and bring a menu vs. cafeteria style. decent lunch and bar too.





What a great find at an airport location . Gone are the egg mcmuffin and breakfast burrito meals. Matts makes everything fresh and quick onsite . Simple fried egg, bacon , cheese and grilled onions on a soft potato roll makes an unbelievably tasty irresistible sandwich all day . I guess airports are improving their food offerings and places like Matt are making it into reality. If you are at Terminal 4 at sky harbor don't miss this place.





The Cobb salad used wilted lettuce, and was served minus the bacon. The tuna sandwich was all bread and a pathetic excuse for tasty. 
 Matt needs to eat his own food once in while. 
Don't waste your time and go to Wendy's next door.





Food was good, phenomenal if you consider the fact it's airport food, and the service was quick, I had mine 10 minutes after I sat down. Toni was very attentive and made sure I had everything I needed when I wanted it. The quality is not quite on par with the downtown location, but it is defiantly above the rest for PHX.





Stopped in for drinks and a bite in between flights. Great service, excellent food!! Erika was an amazing bartender/server! Had a tasty breakfast joined by a couple really good Bloody Mary's.  A definite must stop when in terminal 4.





Matt's infinitesimal breakfast is pricey.  I was not very hungry so I thought I would order an egg and a little sausage with my drink.  What arrived was a tiny little patty of sausage that brought to mind that "where's the beef" commercial from the 80s.  The egg was fine and the service reasonable or this would be 1 star .  I feel cheated.





Best Airport Food in the World!!  They use consciously sourced ingredients like free range meats and eggs.  Amazing comfort food.  Better than home-cooked meals!  Not just breakfast..they have lunch and dinner items too.  If you have some time at Phoenix Airport, this is the only place to eat in my opinion.





I had about an hour layover in Phoenix and decided to stop here for breakfast. There was a decent line of people waiting to be seated, so I thought it must be worth the wait. There wasn't a host/hostess on duty, so people were cutting in line to get seated before others who had been waiting longer. Anyways, I finally sat down and ordered a cheese omelette and added bacon and sausage. The omelette comes out, and it's a little lukewarm. Ok fine. Then a couple bites into the omelette, I see a mushroom. Hmm. Maybe it just snuck in. Nope. I peeled back the omelette and saw a ton of mushrooms. I really dislike mushrooms. If this omelette is supposed to come with mushrooms, list them as an ingredient on the menu! The menu literally said your choice of cheese and that's it. No mention of mushrooms. Unpleasant surprise for sure. The potatoes were cold too. It was a disappointing breakfast to say the least, but the service was good.





This place is just decent nothing spectacular. My family and I went just recently to the downtown location. My waitress seemed to be in a hurry asking if we're ready to order every 30 seconds. The menu sucks in my opinion not enough options to choose from. Also, from the getgo I told my waitress that I will have my drink with my food(apparently she forgot). Instead of her pouring that out she put it in a refrigerator and then brought me the same glass of Strawberry Lemonade once my food was ready. This is just not the place for me. I went to IHOP and got a better breakfast the next day. With a much cheaper bill. 

P. S. Original Breakfast House is much better!!!





Been on a run of DDD joints this week while PHX area.. so caught early breakfast at Matt's BB in sky harbor .. got the big breakfast and while I would not say any one thing was the best I ever had every item on the plate would rank in the top 3.. and everything is fresh homemade .. very unique in an airport. While just like everyone else I could discuss unique homegrown and homemade artisan bacon, one of the best pancakes ever . I have to say I wanted to order more of the breakfast sausage and take it home with me on the plane.. if I had a cooler would have filled it up.  My grandfather would butcher his on pigs. And make his own fresh sausage the flavor and perfect taste I had missed for 50 years. Matt's breakfast sausage was the perfect replica. I will be back ever chance I get when going thru Sky harbor airport .
MattsBB thanks for taking me back to one of my favorite childhood memories .





I usually try and stop in when I am connecting in PHX as their food is pretty darn good. However today the service was extremely SLOW!.  They need to remember people have connecting flights and don't have a lot of time. Took 90 minutes to get in/out today, almost missed my flight. If my flight wasn't delayed I would have missed it. I had to ask for my check 3x.  So if you have less than two hours I wouldn't bother here.





Christmas Eve at 9:50pm and the waitress Corrina was the rudest person I've ever encountered. I'm stunned. I literally left the restaurant because of her. I would have left you a $10 tip for my $12 sandwich Corrina, it is Christmas Eve after all. I'm not a grinch... For the record, she was immediately mean. Even before I could say hello.





I really loved this place.  Our waiter was charismatic and attentive and fun!  The decor inside was cute and interesting to look at.  There were tvs to watch news or sports if you wanted.  The wait wasn't too bad-maybe 15 min at most.  The bacon was the best I've had!  My son got the kid's waffle and it was huge!  He ate every bite.





I love Matt's Big Breakfast so was glad I had enough time to eat before my flight. I ordered the 3 egg omelet. The server asked me if I wanted cheese and if I wanted anything else in the omelet.
