I ordered provolone mushroom spinach and peppers. The food was good but the surprise was when I got the bill as I was charged for the cheese and the veggies. Did not realize I would be charged as the server made no indication and I did not initially ask for these items until prompted.  Beware.





We decided to go to the Phoenix location for Father's day breakfast. Hubby saw them featured on Triple D.  While yes the wait was long (almost an hour) we felt the food was well worth it.Hubby and I don't like blueberries and I am not a real big fan of eggs, but their blueberry jam is so amazing I wanted to buy some to take home (which you totally can!). They even cooked my eggs the way I wanted (done very well) without me having to send it back to cook longer. The food was so much and so good that we couldn't finish, but we wanted to so badly. Will definitely come here again and wait.





Not impressed. The customer service was awesome and the coffee was hot. Otherwise, this is a no go. Door was expensive and cold. Watched the food sit at the window for 10 minutes before it made it to us. The price to quality ratio is way off. Maybe the main location would be better.





I just needed to get something to eat before my connecting flight. Lucky to find this place. Good food and really friendly staff. Made me feel like I was at a local hangout.





I waited over 30 minutes for my breakfast which is inexcusable for eggs and bacon in general but multiplied in an airport setting. And it's not enough for the host to tell you food will take 20 min. Again it's an airport!!!!  I will stick to Matts on Camelback and explore other options in the airport.





Wow! Considering this is an airport restaurant, I am very impressed with the quality of food served here. Their breakfast sandwich was flavorful and well worth the $9.00 I spent on the plate. If you are ever in terminal 4 of the Phoenix airport check this place out!





Don't even bother if pressed for time...after waiting 25 mins for my "to-go" order of one sandwich that never appeared I had to sprint to catch my flight..

before ordering at to go counter told hostess flight left in 30 minutes, response food takes 15 minutes tops.  Told me no problem! Ordered a breakfast sandwich and waited, waited, waited... looked like staff moved in slow motion.. asked hostess to check on the food bc i needed to board.  she strolled off to back of kitchen and stood chatting up staff.  I waited for a few minutes and the ran to catch he flight sans food.
Really shouldn't have a Togo counter..

Actually the airport should just get rid of Matt's and replace it with Over Easy - a phx based restaurant that undoubtedly could do a much better job...





The standards for an airport restaurant are pretty low. Just some food in a clean place. But don't expect to be greeted nicely...at all. And don't expect an item listed as a "Tossed Cobb Salad" to not be tossed, served in a pile with cold fatty bacon, and dressing on the side. 

But the worst part was the amazingly grouchy hostess. Have you seen the Seinfeld episode with the soup Nazi? Picture that. Super rude...lately me rephrase that SUPER RUDE!!! I mentioned it to the waitress who told me that I need to give her a break because it was only her third or fourth day on the job. I thought, are you kidding me? This is how she behaves and she JUST started there? What will her behavior be like after she gets tired of being there.

To be clear, I was in a really good mood when I got there. I had the perfect amount of time for a layover, had a great flight and a great business trip, I wasn't too concerned about the price as my meals were being covered by my clients. I smiled and tried to be friendly and she was just a grouch. I have no idea what her problem was but projecting it on me was unprofessional and just unkind.

A hostess is "paid" to be friendly. That IS their job. To kindly greet guests, warm them up for the waiter, and then find an appropriate seat.

Honestly, the server wasn't much better. She had a "mildly pissy" attitude. Not as bad as the other.

I gave this 2 stars and I'm not sure why I even gave that many. I guess 1 1/2 would be appropriate but I'm feeling generous.

I'm pretty sure that the restaurant won't contact me but I wish they would.

If you're stuck in the airport, try somewhere else.





Worst service in any airport. Order a beer and Cobb salad. I was sitting in front of the beer tape.
Still took her  five minutes after I order the beer. Order a Cobb salad waited  25 minutes and it never came. She forgot to order my salad. Terrible service





Matt's Biggest Breakfast! 

First time flying out of this terminal, decided to belly up to the bar here at Matt's. The gentleman beside me had three plates of food in front on him, each looked better than the burrito I was contemplating on the menu. I asked what he was having and learned it was "Matt's Biggest Breakfast". I'll have that!

A pile of scrambled real eggs, a huge pancake, fried potatoes, two sausage patties, two really thick slices of bacon with peppered edges, and I added toast. 

Oh my, that wasn't only the best airport breakfast I've had, but may have been the best breakfast I've had in Phoenix.





I chose this burger place, and I think that Modern Burger would probably have been a better airport choice.  My burger was overcooked, and it didn't taste good at all, despite all of the bragging about being cooked in butter.  Skip it.





I ordered grilled Chicken sandwich with avocado and fries for takeaway. Cashier seem to doesn't care for the customer, she didn't provide napkin in the bag, didn't care to offer for ketchup or anything else. When I asked her about after I opened the box, her response was very casual and didn't care about customer experience. Food quality is medium but the experience is very poor.





Great Airport Burger  & steak Fries!





I'm not sure what all the hype was about. My server was friendly and cheerful. The dining area was clean, but it was also 7 am so it shouldn't be too dirty. As far as food, eh. 

I've been wanting to try the location in downtown but there's always a long wait. So when I saw Matts Big Breakfast at the airport, I had to try it. I definitely will not go to the downtown location now. It's not worth waiting in line or going out of my way. It's great for anyone who wants lots of food for a reasonable price, especially at the airport. But taste wise, you're better off going to Dennys. Meaning, don't come here looking for good tasting food. There are plenty of great local restaurants in terminal 4. 

I'm giving this place 3 starts because the service was good, location is good, and the place was clean.





Everyone says they really like this place. I have to say it was good. Especially for being in the airport it was a nice change from the usual.
We had a long flight in front of us so I wanted to eat a real meal. So we went to Matts. We had a small bit of a wait. They were packed very popular place.
We were seated and quickly served. Our server was great! She was fast, refilled out drinks and even brought us a to go box. Sorry to say I do not remember her name. as this was before we went on vacation. A lot has happened since then.
The food was good but, not great. I got the pancakes that I ordered with my meal when I was almost through with my breakfast.
 I realize they are very busy. It was decent. I would go back. Maybe when I am not so rushed.
The price is a bit high I think. But, it is the Airport and rents are high there. 
I will give it a go another time. Coffee was good. Service was great , food was so so.





First time checking it out.  Service was friendly and quick.. Wish I could have given more stars but the food wasn't much to write home about.  I didn't have time to alert my server of my disappointment as I needed a quick bite. Was able to pick apart bits I wanted. I paid extra for sausage, and mushrooms... Come to find out, mushrooms are from can?? Why? Never seen so much grease and water pool up on an omlet.  Best part was the side of sourdough bread!





This might be a top 3 breakfast I've ever eaten. Perfect size portions and reasonable prices. The bacon is delicious it's a pepper crusted bacon. The home fries are delicious potatoes with rosemary. The bread that came with it was a sourdough. I couldn't get enough of. Service was great everyone working there was friendly. I will definitely be eating here in my return flight next week.





Food sucked, service sucked.
Only one server was nice to us and the one that originally helped us was rude and kept gossiping, using terrible language in front of other customers, and talking about how the other girls working were pissing her off. The food also took forever to come out and it was cold by the time it got to us. Next time I'll play it safe and just do a McDonald's breakfast or something. Do not waste your time or money at this place.





Top notch food and service, done quickly and with a good understanding attitude.
My BLT was fresh, with tomatoes that tasted like tomatoes should and fresh crisp lettuce on some great bread. 
My buddy had a breakfast that was also fresh, plentiful and delicious.
There's an amazing amount of good food in the Phoenix airport, yet this stands out for both great food and service.





I get paying what the market will bear, the basic economic principal of guns and butter.  But I'm still aggravated when I pay exorbitant prices at the airport and feel slighted, which is all too common.  

Not in this case, Matt's Big Breakfast at the cost of $10.83 (pre tip) delivered a quality meal, good service, and a fair price.  I had the Sonrisa Burrito which satisfied my hunger, and was top shelf quality.  It had plenty of scrumptious bacon, jalapenos, potatoes, and perfectly cooked eggs.  The highlight was the swine, they make mean bacon strips!  Another plus was the side salsa they provided, much better than anything that comes out of a bottle.  I washed my burrito down with a cup of coffee.
 
The physical location is open air, bright and friendly.  They also have a big square bar which can seat around 20 people.  I found my way to the sit down counter, where my server was Kristie, she was friendly, but obviously busy.  I never say this, but I was completely satisfied with my bang for the buck!





Breakfast was good but the server was a little much. To each his own but the flamboyant flirting was quite offensive and after years of construction I am hard to offend. Since I was displeased with my service and just wanted to get out of there i opted to leave no tip. Michael our server decided to in a round about way make comments on tips and so on and so on make the experience even more awkward. Like I said food was good but the pet nick names and service made for an overall poor experience. I will stick the the original restaurant from now on.





I had the waffles which came with a side of bacom strips. The waffle was good and fluffy but the bacon was burned to a crisp. It was dry, overcooked. The service was pretty bad. The waitress was nice though unattentive. I noticed this with the others there as well. And the music? TERRIBLE!





Really good breakfasts. Our waiter, Michael was hilarious and upbeat. He made the whole meal fun. The food was very good. I'd eat here if it was outside the airport. It's obviously more expensive than an outside restaurant, but even taking that into consideration, very good food. It cost us about $50 for four to eat breakfast. A normal breakfast enter is too big. It would be safe to order one breakfast and split it.





Service sucks sooooooo bad. I waited 25 minutes for a bowl of chili? Really? Did they have to hunt a cow? I mean you scoop it in a bowl and you serve it. It should only take 5 minutes but 25 minutes???? I walked out.





Foods great. Bartender...not so much. Poor attitude and rude. Stay in the main terminal.





The food was good. I had mamacito burger and a local beer. There were perfect. The burger is a little bit spicy, but i love spicy food. So no big deal. 
I had coleslaw for the side. I didnt like it i wish i had something else.  
The service was a little bit slow for the airport. Others than that were good.





Service was fast.  Food was terrible. Got the Breakfast Burrito - it smelled weird like it was fished out of a garbage can and tasted like something was rotten inside.  I can't believe I ate even one bite of that thing. I seriously thought I was going to hurl.





I came in this restaurant at 5:50 a.m. there was probably five or six people that work here walking around. Every last one of them walk right by me pretty much did not give me eye contact nor even say good morning. One young lady walk right by me and walk to the other side of the restaurant to help someone. It gets so old coming into an establishment to give your hard earned money and just be blatantly ignored. Finally I asked a young Lady,"hey, can anyone even see me here!!" The Manager Desi walked by and asked was everything ok, I said absolutely not!! You have 5 people includifee yourself that saw me come in and no one even said good morning!! Not to mention everyone simply ignored me!! I told the manager Desi this is totally unacceptable not to mention I am an Airline employee, also I frequent the first Matt's Big Breakfast downtown for years. Then her attitude changed a little. Truly this is not a good way to start your day or to spend your hard-earned money for breakfast. I could not figure out what was so different about me ...I can only guess!!....after all that I had to ask for water, more Coffee, wow!!!!





I don't normally think of food at the airport as a great place to have breakfast. However, I have been proved wrong this morning.

What a little surprise in the middle of the airport. This place is taking breakfast seriously. I don't feel I am being given sub par food for an exorbitant amount of money. If this was a restaurant anywhere else, I would go back again.

Our servers name was Matthew. Although they are very busy, and I can see why, he is a great waiter and very attentive. Awesome service and a True professional. 

I must say that the bacon is awesome. Nice big piece of meat very peppery.  The porkchops were amazing as well. The art of cooking eggs is not over looked here. They know the difference between an over medium and an over easy egg.

Would you like toast with your breakfast, don't expect the generic toast that you get in every restaurant across America. Beautiful thick slices of great read. The sourdough bread was absolutely amazing, and I'm from the San Francisco area.The raspberry preserves were amazing and tasted house made. 

My hats are off to the manager and the staff at this restaurant. Job very well done. We are very pleased!!!





My second time here today and this place is really exactly what you want in an airport eatery- quick service with a smile. Sat at the bar both times and the bartenders have been attentive and welcoming. 

Settled on the omelet last time and this time I went for the burrito sans the jalapeos...since I can be a wimp about that. It comes out looking delicious and tasting the same. It took only 8 minutes for my food to come out too- which is pretty awesome if you ask me. I walk over here from the A gates because I prefer this breakfast to others- it is this specialty after all. Check then out if uou're here in the AM.





I've made this mistake twice. First time, it was a rude waiter that rubbed me the wrong way. Second time...25 minutes for an order of oatmeal. The take away counter is chaos. The person working there cannot both take orders and serve food. There's too many people. Chaotic.





Every time I fly out of phx, I always eat here. It's amazing. Great food and great service. Sit at the bar, Paul the bartender gets you in and out fast.





Good place to grab a bite-- not your normal airport grub. Breakfast is Served all day. 

I had the "smothered and covered"-- chuck steak with mushroom, onions, and mushroom gravy.  very good. The mashed potatoes were better than most steakhouses. 

Good TVs around the bar-- an odd music playlist. Drink selection ok. Employees were high energy and pleasant and accommodating. 

Typical airport pricing was the only negative.





Good food for a reasonable price, especially for airport food.  And the fact that they have some local craft beer only adds. Highly recommend if you are stuck in the Phoenix airport.





Had the Rueben w steak fries.  Great corned beef.  Paul the bartender has a great personality and seems to like his job.  Hard to find good peeps behind the bar anymore.   Especially in an airport.





On a layover in the Phoenix airport I decided to stop at Matt's for a drink and quick bite to eat.  After grabbing a seat at the bar it took over 15 minutes for the bartender to address me and provide me with a menu.  After another 10 minutes I was able to order a drink, however, based on how long it took to just order a drink I decided to pass on food, as I was on a layover and needed time to make it to my next flight.
I received my drink, which had no alcohol, so I addressed in with the waitress, who gave me an attitude.  After that it only went further downhill, leading me to ask for my check and leave.

I can only imagine working in an airpot restaurant may be tough, tired customers, rushed to get drinks and food, etc, but I was none of those.  I only ordered a drink and expressed a concern, especially for the price I was paying and received an attitude.  Definitely not the customer service experience I was hoping for. 
I will definitely pass on Matt's next time I am in the Phoenix airport and visit another patron.





Came here and just ordered a drink, but the service was so quick and friendly. The staff was very helpful, and all of the people around me who ordered food - it looked delicious. It's hard to find good airport food, but this place uses fresh ingredients and actually seems to care instead of the usual apathetic fare. The lady next to me was being really difficult and making a custom sandwich, and the bartender was so accommodating. Next time I am in terminal 4 gate b I will definitely come back here! My only complaint is I wish they were open longer!





Ordered the smothered and covered.  The food came out nasty and covered in cold gravy!  WTF!  The food was cold.  The ideas was great, the flavors reminded me of Hamburger Steak with gravy back home in Hawaii.  Also, if you ask for hot sauce, specifically Tabasco, they only have Tapatio!  WTF, cheap hot sauce.  Luckily j brought my own Tabasco sauce to the party!





Employees with attitude. A forgotten order that was then rushed through. Food that was undercooked and unappealing. Told it would be 10 minutes. Found the absent management after 22 minutes. Pointed out to them that 22 was significantly more than 10. If you only have one machine then you probably shouldn't make promises you can't keep. Heard an employee make a rude comment about the  22 minute wait. Avoid, avoid, avoid.





This is the slowest moving airport restaurant I've ever been too. The employees do not seem to care that there is a line of people waiting to check in as they are standing around joking and laughing. After flagging someone down because we saw an open table we were finally seated 15min later only to be told the kitchen is running 35-40 min late. Under normal circumstances fine, but this is an airport where people need to catch flights. We had to walk out because after the wait for the table, and after the time it would take to order and settle in when we finally would have received our food we would have had to leave to board. They could have told us before we waited for 15 min that the kitchen was behind but they did not.  So now I have two hungry small children unable to eat before a long day of traveling.





Good thing we had a long layover..... Potatoes only tasted like rosemary. Bacon wasn't salty but thick. Bread was great. Over easy eggs were dry.   Seating for 2 are so close to your neighbors that I saw a heavy set guy walk away from the place.   Even regular sized customers were way too close together. A shot of Baileys for your coffee was $12.00 and they had no idea what a side of red was..... I don't frequent Phoenix but if I did, I wouldn't go back.





Amazing service. I got seated pretty quickly and was impressed by how friendly and attentive the staff was (not only to me, but also to the people around me). Food was good, not the best I've had but still pretty good for the price. Would recommend!





Got the breakfast burrito and it was about 90% potatoes and 10% eggs and bacon. Not very good at all.





we took the red eye flight from Hawaii to Phoenix and needless to say me and my family of 5 were completely exhausted and hungry. fortunately we quickly got a table at Matt's and ordered right away. we didn't even have to wait long for our food and that was awesome because it was a long night and we were completely starving. I ordered the griddle cakes and they were fabulous. light and fluffy and the syrup seemed homemade. all the eggs are from cage less chickens. everything my family ordered look delicious too. would highly recommend this place and I wish they had it back home where I am from.





I am an avid visitor at the downtown location, so this visit was very disappointing. I had high hopes at first because they were able to accommodate my request to substitute meat for pancakes at no extra charge, however my dreams were crushed when the food came out less than 5 minutes later. 

The pancakes just weren't good. I've had "just add water" box pancakes better than these.

I requested scrambled eggs, but I got a fried egg chopped up. The potatoes were cold and tasted as if they threw some hour-old potatoes on my plate. I love Matt's potatoes, so I know how they should taste. 

When I told my waiter my issues with the food she took my plate back to the kitchen. Then she returned with the check, expressing how she gave me a 10% discount. I hate ate a few bites of my food, so I was baffled that she was charging me basically full price for a meal I did not eat. I agreed to pay for the pancakes because I ate most of them, but refused to pay for the eggs and potatoes. The manager approached me, and with a not so great attitude told me they weren't going to charge me for the meal. He didn't apologize for the terrible service, but instead acted as if I was just being problematic. 

Again, I love Matt's Big Breakfast, but I will stick with the downtown location and never patronage at the airport location again!





As a Matt, and as a breakfast lover this was a slam dunk. 

As far as airport food goes, this is one of the better places I've had and with reasonable prices. I think it was around $9 for the Five Spot Platter and around $8 for the egg salad sandwich. Both were big portions and I distinctly remember the bacon in the Five Spot Platter being extra-large, juicy, and thick. 

Sometimes, after a long flight you want to get fed and filled up like a dump truck. Matt's will take care of that for you. It was also close to our American Airlines terminal.

Also, it was open late which is a relief because as it turns out there are a ton of options to eat in this airport but a lot of them aren't open late (11pm or later). 

I should also shout-out our waitress. She was an absolute hoot. Being from drought-stricken California, I asked for water tentatively. She responded by ribbing me and saying she would have to check if "water" was on the menu. All in good fun and she was super attentive even though Matt's was packed. Must be the whole open-late thing. 

Very hefty, very filling, and because everyone says breakfast is the most important meal of the day, I would recommend putting Matt at the top of your list of places to eat in Phoenix's airport.





Phoenix airport spot. Meatloaf, mashed potatoes and gravy.  Strong showing. Meatloaf was very dense, like it a little more moist typically. Flavor lacked a bit but the extra side of gravy. The Mrs has grilled cheese and tomato soup. Loved it but richhhhh. Best part was our server Dez. She rocked it. Definitely made the meal and the place.





I expected the typical airport burrito - big price, small portion. I was glad to be wrong. While the first half was mostly potato, the second half made up for it with egg, cheese, and sausage. Only regret- not getting the salsa.





The Matt's Big Breakfast in downtown Phoenix is much better than the Airport location.  The service at the Downtown location is faster and friendlier, and the portions more generous.  Our bartender/waiter at the airport looked like he hated his life. Never smiled once and wouldn't make eye contact or speak at an audible level when he talked to you... it was actually kind of amusing to my husband and I.  The people sitting next to us were vocal about his poor manners/service, but we just wanted some bacon so we got over it and managed to laugh about it.  I got the Hog and Chick; the potatoes here were not as crispy here, but it's all the same locally sourced ingredients for sure.   (Seemed like it was a smaller kitchen but the restaurant had more seating than other locations, so maybe they were rushing the cook on the food? We waited about 30 minutes for our food from the time  we ordered.) Overall 3 out of 5 as the service had major issues, the dining room was crammed (my legs  and elbows were touching the stranger next to me), but the taste was just as good as the other locations.





The breakfast sandwich was fantastic and a great start to our vacation, but far and away the real star was Michael. He was so energetic,  funny and helpful. I have flown through this airport at least 2x a month for 18 years and he has been the best server I have had. Thanks for truly kicking our vacation off right!





Two airport employees recommended this place. It's the only sit down in the American Airlines terminal, and I was just trying to get my contractions to stop after my mad sprint to my flight after the connecting one was late. I got a meal voucher out of it *le sigh*

I really like that there's outlets pretty much everywhere you sit. That is awesome. Service was fast. I got a honey lemonade... which tasted like.. uhhh.. honey lemonade. It was off, but that's totally my fault.

I got the Sweet and Savory, which was French toast and apple sausage. The entree was no bueno. I am not reviewing to James Beard winner status, but it's a few rungs below IHOP and Denny's. I didn't finish my food, and I'm totally pregnant and exhausted. Something in the execution or the recipe went horribly awry. 

Food and drink: $16 something.





The chicken sandwich was pretty tasty and a pretty good size for 10 bucks. DON'T get the $3+ coleslaw instead of kettle chips unless you just want thick sliced cabbage drenched in creamy dressing. Should've gotten fries instead!





I used to love this place, and actually got a longer lay over today just so I could eat breakfast here. I'm so disappointed,  the service was horrible, you can here the servers talking trash about tube customers. The hottest just screamed out "we are about to have a fight today"!
My server just served me burnt bacon, Never return things but it was bad, he docent say sorry ,or oh let me fix that, he say snotty, new bacon? , then runs of and brings be barley lest burn bacon, again no apology,  then I see him go talk shit about to the hostis. I'm so sad that this place sucks now it used to be my high light of coming to this airport, and now that I have no reason to come here anymore I will be making my connection thru a different airport all together from now on.

What bad service completely , undeserving of a tip at all.





Probably my favorite breakfast joint in Phoenix. I love the food so much and the service is great. Also, their coffee is delicious and they are constantly refilling you. Praise. If you want to be seated early, make sure you go early in the AM. Especially on Sunday's, they're normally packed so be there by 8am. Best kn the menu, to me, is the Five Spot, however their pancakes and waffles are KILLER!! Extremely fluffy and made from scratch. You seriously can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Everything is delicious.





Airport location is not as good as the location downtown.  

They get really busy here and often have a 15-20+ minute wait.  From this experience I will not return to the airport location again.





This was a decent meal, expensive and service was iffy but it was an airport location so I think that is to be expected.





Was sat quickly, table was clean and waitress was quick and friendly. I decided to order the meatloaf because the waitress said it was yummy and she was right! The meatloaf was grilled on both sides to have a crisp carmellization. The mashed potatoes were delicious with a great grace and the side asparagus was perfect! I will definitely be back. Thank you!





MATT'S BIG ATTITUDES! Avoid the bar. There are many other bars in terminal 4 for some reason this bar you are dirt under their feet. Hot beer on tap and cold attitudes.

I travel thru phx airport 42 weeks a year. Eaten here many times. Wasn't till tonight when i met Melissa the bar tender i was compelled to write about it. Avoid her. Mean as s snake.





It was like we didn't exist. It took around 10 minutes of standing waiting to be seen. We actually watched people come and go behind us because no one was there to greet us. Eventually, somebody came. 

The first thing that struct me as odd when we finally got seated was that we could not modify ANYTHING
If I wanted a waffle on the side, our waiter said I had to buy another full meal that had the waffle. They wouldn't even give my Mother the option of removing her onions from a meal someone said was optional. Very disappointing. 

Aside from that, the food wasn't bad actually. Up until we noticed my Mother had hair in her potatoes. She was only half way finished her food when we informed our waiter. He said he would take it to his manager and return shortly. So while we wait, I search my food like a madman hoping I don't find anything, resulting in me not even wanting to eat anymore. The waiter returned and said that it wasn't hair, it was only a scratch in the plate. 

Really...? A scratch that can move and land on other food with a push of a fork? Right

He also returned empty handed. If it was just a scratch in the plate, why didn't he give us the food back? My Mom left not only still hungry, but offended as well. The food didn't take too well to our stomachs either...

Thank you very much, for being terrible. We will NEVER eat here again.





My Uber driver advised I try this place before I left Phoenix, so I took the recommendation. It was more crowded than I expected but all good places are. I waited for the hostess to take my name down but he kept acting like people weren't standing and staring at him to say hello. After a few times of this a waiter spoke to everyone which saved me from walking away. The hostess still hadn't said a word so I did and just decided to sit at the bar since something was available. I ordered the French Toast an egg and a Mimosa. So GOOD!!! The ladies at the bar were quick and pleasant, made sure everyone was served and would check back frequently. Everyone else and the food made up for the flustered hostess. Glad I got to visit, I'm sure I will be back!





If you are a breakfast place, than learn how to make an omelette !  Mine was dry, like-warm, flat, dense and not presented well either!
Also: no cream for coffee! Do you know what that does to coffee? 
Disappointing - for the price you charge, you should do much better !





First time at the airport in Phoenix, and Matt's is a pleasant surprise and great breakfast for airport restaurants. The staff is friendly, and the decor is bright. If you ever are at Terminal 4, great spot for food and drinks. Plus there are many places to recharge your phones and computers.





Food was great! Had a wonderful breakfast. Highly recommend!!!  Organic and local food. Bacon was so thick and well cooked. The whole grain bread was great, with a homemade jelly. I am a picky eater, but this food was quality!!





I've eaten here about 3-4 times and for whatever reason the staff seems annoyed that they are here, distracted and almost rude. 

I've eaten breakfast at Matts downtown PHX and the experience and frankly quality of food is much better. 

Ordered Matts Big Breakfast: bacon was cold, sausage was undercooked and the eggs I ordered over medium were also under cooked. 

Whole experience was disappointing.





If you're looking for breakfast at any time of the day, look no further. You will be filled up and be leaving satisfied as the portions are indeed as the name indicates: BIG. The quality of the food was perfect. Absolutely no issues and everything was cooked to order. 

The service was AMAZING. If you have a chance, ask for Emily "Monster." She was the most hospitable waitress and had everything to the table promptly and had a smile on her face the entire time.

You absolutely should eat here if you're at the airport and looking for a quality meal.





Best airport meal ever. Very fresh and flavorful, and reasonably priced.





Made the mistake of trying this location after swearing off the original due to the wait times and poor staff. Apparently this location is no better. The wait wasn't bad but the hostess never mentioned the waffle iron is broken today. Only after being seated did I learn the only item I would get from here isn't available today. What a waste of time.





Good service every time.

Paul is great bartender!

Amazing bacon Bloody Mary .

See you guys next time.





Ate here Fall 2015 and enjoyed it. Would definitely go back if I'm ever at the Phoenix airport again.





Our waiter, Michael, was GREAT! He was entertaining and wonderful! My order wasn't 100% correct, but it was super yummy anyway!!!!





My server (Miguel) was super awesome, right on point with everything, quick, friendly, and attentive. I ordered a Fancy Salad. The plate arrived greasy which was weird because a salad with chicken shouldn't be greasy. The manager came out and apologized immediately. They built another fresh salad. 

While it wasn't a perfect experience, the staff made up for it in friendliness and caring.





I stopped in here for dinner on a Sunday night and where the terminal overall was slow, this restaurant was hopping!  Pretty popular place it seems.  I was flying solo and was found a seat quickly when I approached.   

I tell you, the customer service here alone was enough to make me want to go back!  The host and the server were both excellent.  

The food I had also was spot on!  I had burger with this jalapeno aioli that reminded me of hatch green chilis!! Not sure what they did but man it was so yummy!   I also paid a couple extra bucks and got the steak fries.  Normally not my thing but these came out crispy and were served with an A1 BBQ sauce.   So good together with the burger.

I can't speak to the breakfast as I only had dinner here but I'd be willing to try it out if in Phoenix for breakfast!  

Safe travels!!!!





Love the way they converted Matt's to an airport concept. Much more successful than the attempt made by Lolo's Chicken & Waffles. For those of you just passing through Sky Harbor, these are both local Phoenix institutions worthy of a try.

I think Matt's effort here is more successful simply because they have their own dining space to manipulate, not a shared space. They use it well. Some tables. Lots of counter space for single travelers. Some communal seating. Lots of outlets. A take away counter. Great breakfast food early in the day and a full bar for later. Or breakfast food later in my case. A lunch menu is available as well. And it's all priced pretty reasonably for an airport. Well done.





One of the best, BLT's I've ever had. Great find in PHX airport. Friendly & fun staff. You have some time to kill, waiting for your flight, then get here.





Very disappointed. They're in an airport, and I k JW it's not fast food, but I ordered a waffle. How long does it take to make a waffle. And then they bring me French toast a half hour later. I told them I ordered a waffle and they said it would be a while longer. Can't review the food because I didn't get any. 

On top of that when I sat down the counter was wet and dirty. The staff said they'd wipe it down. It took them 15 minutes before they did that. Poor service.





Open early for breakfast. Ordered steak and eggs. Medium well came out bloody and blood on eggs. Server noticed it when he got to table and asked if it was ok? Was not. He took back and made a comment "our cook is really bad". After overcooking steak brought back to me with cold eggs still covered in blood. Not my best experience.





Friendly staff. Great drinks. Delicious salsa. And most importantly the exquisite ice.





The food here us pretty good and service is usually friendly. They are slowwwwww. Really not a good trait for an airport restaurant. Only eat here if you have at least 45 mins til boarding.





Had a layover in Phoenix 6:50 am, decided to get breakfast while waiting for our next flight. Staff was nice and friendly, hubby and I ordered the skinny, thought a nice light breakfast would be good. It was 4 egg whites with gruyere cheese, chicken apple sausage and spinach. What we didn't expect was the spring greens that came with it with a very strong smelling wine vinaigrette. The eggs were practically swimming in it. The eggs had so much cheese in it, the smell of it paired with the vinaigrette was very off putting it turned our stomach so much so early in the morning that we couldn't even think of ordering anything else. Manager apologized and said whatever we can do, we'll do it. We still got charged $10 for a small cup of coffee and small glass of orange juice :(.





If I'm flying out of terminal 4 then I'm eating at Matt's Big Breakfast.  Even if my flight is at 10:00 or noon or 2:00.  Even if I have to traipse the rest of the way around the terminal to my Southwest gate, it's worth it to me to get here early and have a delicious breakfast.  They have the best bacon for sure, and the staff has always been fast and friendly.  Maybe someday I'll try something else, but for me the hog and chick is the way to go.  Love everything about this breakfast from the bacon to the roasted potatoes to the homemade raspberry preserves on the fresh baked marble rye toast.    Delicious!





Fresh oj and a great omelette and excellent service! The toast was super fluffy and delicious.





Easy 5 stars from me.  I travel for work a lot and all my AM trips start at Matt's.  The food is fantastic and comes out fast.  Both the steak and eggs and the Belgian waffle are top notch.  Bacon Bloody Mary is best ever in my book, too.  I've been to every major airport in the US and PHX is my fave.  So much good food here.  Sucks that you have to have a ticket to get in.





Great place for breakfast at PHX! Service was 5and the food was really good. Wonderful bacon and potatoes. The pancakes were freshly made and super yummy. Our server Michael H. Is great and made us feel like family. Good job!





I arrived there at 5:30 this morning for breakfast. After finding a table that wasn't wobbly I ordered the  cheese omelette with mushrooms. It comes with toast and potatoes. The potatoes were undercooked and room temperature. The toast was room temperature and wouldn't even start to melt the butter that was put on it. They brought me a new batch of potatoes and new toast, which I appreciated. It seemed to me that the omelette was not freshly made. I've never tasted one like that before that was freshly made. From the way I was dressed it was obvious I worked at the airport and wasn't just passing through. I probably won't go there again. I am always happy to support local businesses over chain restaurants, but it was a really simple order and most of it went wrong, unfortunately. The waiter, however, was really nice.





My co-worker and I ate here before boarding a flight. 
It was packed with people and for a good reason. The food was worth the wait and cost. Which really wasn't bad for an airport.
Our food came out fast and fresh. No waiting for slow service. These people have it together.
Both of our dishes were very tasty. We each had Matt's Biggest Breakfast. My eggs were perfect and I'm hard to please. I could have eaten more and wished I did, since it was a wait for dinner as we missed lunch traveling. 
The coffee was great by the way.





Ambience: B-
Cleanliness: B+
Customer Service: C
Food: B-

Price 
-Its an airport, its expensive, end of story. The prices were very inflated but I have seen worse so there is that.  

Atmosphere
-Again, its an airport. They try to make it look like an old fashion diner, they fail, but it still beats eating Doritos at your gate. 

Customer Service 
-Its an airport, people are not trying to be there all day. Now I'm not saying the wait staff should put on running sneakers but at least be efficient and by efficient I mean don't be on your phone in view on costumers for several minutes while people are trying to flag you down. On that note, don't look down on your phone while taking someones order and then get annoyed with them when you bring out the wrong order. Unless you were texting the chef, I'm pretty sure it was your lack of listening skills to blame on that one. 

Food 
It was edible. Again, it beats a $6 bag of Doritos. It wasn't great, it wasn't bad, but it served its purpose in that starve to death at the airport. 

Overall
I don't think I've ever had a great experience eating at the airport and this was no different. Usually I get decent costumer service though, so that sort of added insult to injury in this case. If you are going to robe me blind by inflating your prices, at lest do so with a smile on your face.





Stopped in 1st time and was very impressed. Seats were open at the bar and we ordered the omlet and BLT. Both came with side of hash browns which were amazing! My omlet was huge and I wish I had ordered cheddar but ordered provalone instead. I could only finish half due to the amount of food. The sourdough toast was awesome as well with the fresh made jam/jelly. Service was great. Highly recommended. They have lunch items as well.





2nd time eating here for breakfast. Really like this place. Service is great & solid, fresh food that's made to order. Perfect for when you have to spend a morning at the airport.





Food was excellent, the staff knows the menu well and they are all so nice! Wish there was one in Colorado. Loved the waffle and the bacon Bloody Mary.





wow! i did not know i could get a great meal, and an attitude change at the airport! my flight was delayed, do i was going to miss my connection.... when i walked into "Matt's Big Breakfast!" my server greeted me, like i was his best friend and intuitively knew i needed a BlOODY MARY, with BACON! so now that my mood is getting better, i order an omelet, OMG, this is the best bacon i have ever had! my server was as efficient as he was HILARIOUS! i had heard the rumors about Matt's Big Breakfast, now i am a believer! Michael! ask for MICHAEL!





This was a great discovery. Breakfast anytime. The 5 step breakfast sandwich was awesome and the happily kept the request for no onions off with a smile. The chili burger was a real life medium like I ordered. I am impressed with any plane that does this let alone a place in the airport.





Best breakfast I've EVER had! At an airport?! It was almost worth missing my next flight. If you have to be stuck in an airport, look for this restaurant!





Very disappointed the second time around. Service was awful as in she took my order delivered it and never once came back to see how it turned out. When I was leaving I told her how awful it tasted she said sorry have a great day. My french toast was so undercooked and burnt on the outside I couldn't even finish it.





Fast friendly service. Thanks Alexa! Food was delicious. Loved the handmade sausage patties.and rosemary potatoes.





Terrible service. Their employees are so rude and make you feel like they almost don't want you there. Service was terrible but I don't mind dealing with people like that when I'm on the go. What just made me never want to come back was when I saw the host ask a guy that was sitting at a table to get up and move (mid meal mind you) to another place outside the restaurant because "he had takeout" it was from their same place!!!! And there were about 6 other open tables!!!! Are you kidding!!?!? Never coming back! I'd rather get a prepackaged crappy sandwich next time.





I really enjoyed this place, and I find it hard to believe it's in the middle of an airport terminal. The service was great. My boyfriend was crabbier than a crab apple since we missed our connecting flight, but the server was so gracious and understanding. I had the Bloody Mary and wawawewa, it put a lil pep in my step. Definitely one of the best I've ever had, from the garnish to the actual drink. I also had the thick cut bacon. It was sick -- some of the best bacon I've ever had in my life. Grumpopatomus had some kind of meat (pork, I think) smothered in onions and gravy and stuff. He said it was really good.

The price was a little stiff, but hey, that's airport fare for ya! Cheers!!





I thought the food was very basic. We started out with Mimosas (because hello we were going to Hawaii)... It came out as a full glass of champaign (yes, please) and you got to add orange juice. We got the burrito and Matt's Big Breakfast to share... It cost about 50.00, which I wasn't surprised since we were at the airport. Our waiter was excellent, very very funny guy!!





What's better than a waffle as a late brunch when you have a layover at 3:00 pm? I don't care where you are in Terminal 4, this place deserves your business. My server was friendly and prompt. The waffle I ordered was hot and delicious. The bacon was crunchy and flavorful. It satisfied my breakfast sugar craving. 

4 out of 5 stars, because the food took longer than expected and there were a lot of crumbs and pieces of paper on the floor. The waffle could have been slightly crisper also. Overall, I would go back if I'm in the mood for breakfast food.





Nice enough server, but evidently there is a condiment shortage: no ranch or bleu cheese dressing, no sour cream. Bread for tuna sandwich looked as if it had the possibility of tasting good but I didn't try it as it seemed to have been left in the arid AZ sun all day today; dry as a bone. Beer good. Glass warm. May be my least favorite airport meal to date.





Was waking by and had time to kill. This place was really busy and breakfast before a red eye flight sounded amazing! Say at the bar and Maria A was on point. She was one of the best servers/bartenders I've had. She was manning the bar herself and also helping some other staff. She saw your glass nearing empty before you thought about it. She also kept a smile on her face with every customer encounter. The service definitely enhanced my dining experience. All the plates coming out of the kitchen looked delicious. The Sonrisa Burrito (minus meat) was fantastic. Had great conversations at the bar. Definitely worth stopping in.





Matt's was the perfect breakfast after a wedding the night before. The food is delicious and high quality. I loved the taste of all of the ingredients. I had the chicken sandwich and the breast meat was juicy, and paired fantastically with the pesto sauce.





Could not be better in any way!  Service was very fast and the food is amazing.  The bacon was very thick and fresh, potatoes were perfect and had some fresh rosemary in them. This is the best toast I have ever had, nice and thick with a nice homemade jam.  I hope I'm at the B gates on terminal 4 again soon to get a meal here! So good!





I had eaten at MBB downtown once and was a fan of the food they served there. I really am behind the city's initiative to encourage local successful restaurants to open up locations in Sky Harbor airport, and Matt's Big Breakfast is a treat! They also have Lolo's Chicken n' Waffles, Deluxe Burger and Chelsea's Open Kitchen to name a few local fav spots that we frequent in town and at PHX.
MBB is precisely what it sounds like Big Breakfasts. Keep in mind, it is located at Terminal 4 AFTER YOU CLEAR SECURITY.  Whatever tickles your first meal of the day fancy can be tickled deeply and thoroughly here. The menu is a true journey through morning comfort food presented in more bountiful and gourmet style that your regular combo #6 at your local slop n' drop diner. Last time I ate there before a flight I had a massive omelette with rosemary potatoes (which are amazing btw). My wife had poached eggs and off the bone ham which seemed to have come right from the farm!
The only caution I would give is to make sure you have time to have a sit-down-and-order mea. The service is pretty fast but the clients come in waves and everyone seems to need to catch the same flight. l had to chase down our server to run my card as it seemed everyone in the place was trying to pay at once and were likely mostly on the same flight so be sure you're not in a photo-finish situation to your gate.
For those in a rush, I think they also have a walk-up counter and sling breakfast sammies to go for those wanting to stink up economy class with their brought-on food...a practice I abhor. I never bring hot food onto a plane. It's rude. Bring a cold sandwich or a salad and leave your stinky McRaunchy's or Blazing burritos in the terminal!
MBB...come hungry and then enjoy your post breakfast drooling coma as you soar the clear blue skies!





Friendly service and fresh food.  Both are usually hard to find at an airport. We enjoyed our breakfast very much.  They make homemade bread.





I've been to Matt's three time now and the service here is just slow. The food is great when you get it but 15 before anyone even took my order at the bar?!?  I had my water and left.  The bloody Mary's are great and the food is awesome, just make sure you have time and patients.





I ordered the omelet with 3 cheeses and home style fries. I asked if they could add grilled onions and raw onions and they did!!It was so good. Everything taste so fresh! The people were so friendly and I had the best server, Darnell.





Ate here during our layover. Usually, I prefer pancakes over waffles, but no protein was offered with the pancakes, so I chose the waffle since it comes with some bacon.

HOLY COW!

I actually set my fork down after the first bite. That was the best waffle I have ever had in my life. I usually don't react to food that way, and I wasn't happy with our somewhat rude waitress, so for the food to turn me around on the place that quickly is impressive, to say the least.

The waitress is the only reason I took a star away, and I'm willing to accept that we may have just caught her at a bad time. Unfortunately, we don't travel through that airport normally, so I'm not sure if I'll ever be able to go back and give them another shot.





I wish that i just ate at the place all of these good reviews were for. The bloody Mary had no flavor, salt pepper and hot sauce made it ok. The big garnish polished it up a bit, worth $10 airport price at best, not $14.

I had an omelet with mushrooms. The plate was covered in the grease from the omelet, which was overcooked and chewy .The potatoes were both burnt and cold. 

The bartenders treated the patrons like a nuisance. Zero chance of getting a coffee refill. The place was packed when I sat down and emptied out by the time I got my meal. I sat with and empty coffee cup and bloody glass for 15 min until I threw down my card. 

I'll skip a meal before I come back.





Dear Matt (assuming that Matt exists),

This is not about the food - it was excellent.

This is not about cleanliness - it was spotless.

This IS ABOUT ... Alexa, our server.  She was beyond excellent.  Clone her.  Really.

We arrived on the red eye from Kona.  Good olde American Airlines decided to skip feeding us in First Class, saying that the 5 hour flight allowed insufficient time to serve 12 people the "Full Breakfast" that was listed on our itinerary - I kid you not.  Just shut up and each your potato chips.  Coffee?  Cold.  Decaf?  Instant.  First Class, my arse.

We arrived early, hungry and cranky.  There was a bit of line.  The restaurant seemed packed, yet we were seated immediately.  How'd you DO that?  (By paying attention and sweating the details).  Waters arrived immediately.  Lemon?  Let me get that!  Coffee followed promptly.  Hot coffee, thank you.  We never saw the bottom of our coffee cups.  The breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito were both excellent.  The portions were generous. Hot food, hot.  Cold food, cold.  The Bloody Mary's ... rock.

And ... Alexa also pointed out a virtually hidden AC outlet so that I could (re)charge my phone.  She's an important asset to your success.  Treasure her.  Nurture her.  Reward her.  (No, we are not family.)





Place was packed on the Tuesday morning I visited. However, we found space at the bar to be serviced immediately. I ordered the salami scramble which came with your choice of toast and breakfast potatoes. Food came out timely and it was very good. Potatoes were my favorite. The jam they provided for the toast was delicious, too. Customer service was great.





Thoroughly impressed! I've never had an actual "real meal" in an airport before. I meant to take a picture of my plate, but I was halfway done with it when I thought about it. This is good, honest food. I just got off a plane from a super early flight and was pretty hungry. I ordered 2 eggs over-easy (which were expertly cooked), rosemary home fries, thick-cut bacon, and really thick rye toast with fresh squeezed OJ. The toast was too thick for my liking because i like to use it to sop up the yolk, but it was accompanied by raspb preserves. left full and walking a little slower. They make everything to order, so don't stop if you're about to jump on a plane, but it's worth the stop if you have the time. The OJ was $5 which seemed pricey to me for what it was. The meal was about $15, but you certainly pay for convenience when in an airport and I didn't have a problem with the price when considering the meal.





we sat at the bar this morning while waiting for a flight and the bartender was phenomenal. 

The food was okay. But as a frequent guest at the other Matt's locations I was disappointed with the quality of the food. 

It just really isn't the same. 

But better than eating at McDonald's so there's that.





Great place to eat between flights. Was hungry and tried their breakfast and it was amazing!! Definitely coming here again. Super great friendly service makes this a top notch place for me.





Seriously some of the best meatloaf I've ever had, doesn't even need the gravy. Quick service, strong cocktails, nice spot before boarding.





What a fantastic spot to grab a meal. I got the Bloody Mary and meatloaf. Every ingredient in the Bloody Mary was perfect. Extra crispy celery. Briny olives. Crispy thick bacon. YUM. Meatloaf was excellent.





Ordered the cheese omelette and added bacon and onions. It came with potatoes and toast. Maybe just my taste buds but despite the reviews I read, the rosemary seasoning is overwhelming and the potatoes seem undercooked. Looking at empty plates as I left, I see lots of uneaten potatoes so I suggest the chef rethink their recipe. Valentin was my server and he was good and the speed of service was good. The toast is about 1/2 inch thick and more like a dessert; again not my cup of tea but whatever. Crossing this place off my airport stops; will stand in line at Wendy's next time. Sorry!!





Worst airport food ever! Cancelled my salad because there was a roach running across the bar. I got my margarita and there was something floating in it! I wouldn't complain about the glass being dirty and just send it back but that was one to many for me





YUM! Great breakfast and service--in an airport?! SO SO good! French toast, sausage, eggs over medium; even their ice tea with fruit infusion is fantastic. Sat at counter: served politely and efficiently. Excellent experience! Matt's and Sky Harbor Airport are recognizing Phoenix and Arizona well. Makin' this home girl proud!!





Not the best but not the worst.  I took a seat at the counter since there was a wait for a table and I was a party of one. Bartender/waitress flopped down a menu.  After perusing, I ordered The Hog and Chick, which was basic eggs, meat, potatoes and toast. I asked if I could pay extra to substitute a pancake for the toast.  Waitress gave me a dumbfounded look and said "yeah, I guess but I don't know how to do that".  That was the red flag I should have paid attention to. Then she asked, "sausage, bacon, or ham?" I picked ham.  Ordered a coffee that came in a tiny cup. They don't have cream, just milk.  Food arrived, decent in taste and usual presentation.  Pancake was small and average.  Here's the kicker...ticket showed pancake substitute was $5! For one pancake.  Ham was an extra $5! (which I just discovered should have only been an extra $1)Tiny coffee that I had to ask for a refill was $3.50. My ticket was $26 for a slightly better breakfast than Dennys! I didn't question it as the waitress didn't seem like one to mess with.   Entertainment was a super flamy and friendly waiter catering to his customers and giving much better service than I had and watching a line cook repeatedly digging out waffles that were stuck in the waffle iron and ripping in half. He used them anyway for the waffle orders to go. Too spendy for what I ordered, probably wouldn't recommend nor return.  The place should be called Matt's Big Ticket Breakfast. Boo.





It is extremely hard to find good airport food, especially with great service to boot.  This place had the best breakfast I have ever had in an airport.  Coffee was fabulous.  I have to give a shot out to the incredible service I received from Michael.  He was bullied by a customer and treated horrible, but kept a smile on his face and a spring in his step.  Way to go Michael!





Kristie is a rock star. The place was packed and she was tending to the long common table. She took care of me and everyone around me like no other server I have experienced in a long time. I work with chefs and travel the country eating in the best restaurants. Take good care of her! The food was really good too. I recommend!





Matts was recommended to us by some friends who are well familiar with the Phoenix area. apparently they have a few locations. This one is at Phoenix Sky Harbor airport (we were waiting for a flight). If you are at the airport and need a meal, you can't go wrong here. 

We ordered the waffles, and a "Hog & Chick" (Two eggs, bacon, toast, potatoes). Fresh OJ to boot. I enjoyed the Hog&chick but the waffles are a better choice. Overall, not the greatest breakfast I have ever had, but for an airport, it's decent.

I have heard that the other locations are better. When I am back in town, I will try them.





Waited 30 minutesfor a burrito I had to leave without. Don't advertise a take away counter if you can't get food out in less than half an hour





Friendly suggestion. Let folks who buy your to go items sit at a table to eat. Especially if your not busy. After all they paid a premium price for those goodies. Thanks.





I ate one meal meal here passing through at the Sky Harbor Airport.  Of course the restaurant name has "breakfast" in it but it was lunch time and I did not want breakfast.  I approached the desk and waited for a few minutes to be acknowledged.  I was seated at the only empty table in the place and wanted to make sure that there were non-breakfast items on the menu.

I decided on the chili cheeseburger with steak fries.  The patty was large which was good for me.  The chili surprised me because it it had beans in it.  I usually eat beef chili with no beans on my burgers.  The burger had good flavor to it as they use butter on the buns.  The fries were very good as I like the steak fries.  Overall the food was good.

It took a while to get seated but the service was friendly and was a good experience.  I didn't feel super rushed as the food came out fast enough and I had plenty of time to eat with time to spare to board my next flight.  I was definitely full when I left.  This was a three star experience for me.





down-home Southern-style - a cut above for airport food

I had the reuben sandwich with a side of macaroni, with the freshly-squeezed lemonade with honey. The marble rye bread on the sandwich had crust embedded with what tasted like caraway seeds, and was lightly toasted, and fresh-tasting. The pastrami is made in-house, the sign says. The meat was so-so with more fat than I expect, and the sauerkraut lacked flavor. The macaroni salad was really flavorful and I savored each bite. Now the standout for this meal was the lemonade!! I could suck down a gallon and still want more. Ironically, I was trying to avoid excess sugar, and though the sign claims that there's no added sugar, they do add a LOT of honey, which does contain tons of natural sugar, though sugar is sugar, and as addictive as cocaine and heroin, I keep reading in my holistic health blogs. That comes as no surprise. 

I'd love to write more, but I am way behind on everything. Anyway, what a buzzkill I can "bee". Get the lemonade here, and enjoy life! Airports are really hard to be in, with all the waiting and the loud jarring noises, abominable behaviors right and left, and being WAAAAYYYYY to close for comfort to everyone in all those hellhole godawful tightly crowded stinky nasty airplanes (I don't fly first class - I'm so middle-class I can't bear to part with extra money for a few hours of a little more leg room and I don't need free cheap headache booze and used dirty blankets), so soothe yourself by eating what makes you happy, then exercise like crazy later.

What's not clear at all is that if you order at the counter, you take your food to go and you are supposed to eat it elsewhere, like at your gate, not in the restaurant, I later found out. Well, I committed a faux pas, unknowingly, and sat in the restaurant at a table right behind the counter where I placed my order. I apologized to the waiter who came by, and I asked if I should move, but he was gracious, and let me stay. 

The other menu items, like the cheeseburger, looked really tempting. 

People were enjoying themselves with beers, watching the futbol/soccer highlights reel at the bar.





Staff was friendly. Food was awful. We ordered The Skinny (4 egg whites w/gruyere cheese and chicken sausage). It was bad enough that there was more cheese than eggs but what made it inedible was that they also put spring greens on the plate covered in a vinaigrette. The smell was absolutely off putting and nauseating. I don't know if it was just the smell of the vinaigrette or it just didn't blend well with the strong gruyere. Either way the smell made It 100% an appetite killer. Other menu items might be very good but I have not tried them. I sent this back and had no appetite for anything else. 
The manger did remove them from the bill, which is expected since we didn't eat any of it, but still charged us for coffee and a juice ($9.75) even after asking what they could do to make it right. Go figure.





Service was fast and good, but that's about it. The chicken Cobb salad was lack luster. The chicken was not fresh. Same with the bacon in the breakfast options. Nothing felt fresh, but all of it was greasy, even the salad! Skip this place.





I have no idea why this place is so popular? How do they have three locations?  These questions boggle my mind.  We ordered the bloody mary after seeing a picture on yelp.  I am always looking for bloodies with fun garnishes.  This one looked fun!  Every garnish was meh.  The cheese seemed like it was going bad, the olives were drying out and the pickle was the worst pickle probably in the history of pickling.  I love pickles! How does one make a mediocre pickle?  I did not think it was possible.  The best garnish was the celery LOL.  Oh, and the bacon was so yuck!  Moving on to the bloody mary.  Nothing special at all.  I ordered a veggie omelette with cheddar.  It was good.  I have had better omelettes.  It wasn't fluffy and the veggies were somewhat greasy.  My sweets had a burger and said it was overcooked and there was nothing special about it.  Like I said, I have no clue what is so special about this place.  All in all don't eat here expecting a fresh over the top delish breakfast.  Expect average truck stop food pretending to be something worth talking about.





Unremarkable chicken sandwich served by unenthusiastic wait staff.  Sandwich was supposed to have a pesto taste of which there was none.  Even the addition of the missing romaine lettuce would not have helped flavor wise.  Paid an outrageous $11.50 for a 5 oz. pour of Kim Crawford Sauvignon blanc.  I give it 3 stars because this is my first negative experience here.





Very nice food and friendly service. We had the omelette and the french toast. Everything was fantastic! Best food I have ever had at an airport!





Second time I've been the Matt's while traveling and will return again, service staff are absolutely the best, try the grilled cheese and tomato soup and all of the hamburgers are great





If you are looking for a tasty Bloody on your way out of town for vacation or a Egg White & Spinach omelet before heading off for a business trip, this place won't disappoint.





I normally have enjoyed Matt's Big Breakfast, particularly their coffee. Had time before a flight this morning to grab a cup of coffee after making the trek from gate C. Stood in line at Matt's Takeaway only to be told I could not purchase the plain, black coffee I have always been able to enjoy when sitting down for breakfast at their airport location. This seemed odd to me, so I clarified, receiving the same response without any explanation as to why this was the case. Seems odd to me they can sell only coffee with cream and sugar added. Based off of this, I can't recommend them for an early cup of joe at the airport.





Such a surprise to find wonderful food at an airport! The homemade strawberry jam is the best! The sourdough toast is thick and delicious. The staff is great. Cannot day enough good about this place. Will come here anytime I am at Sky Harbor!





So I had been wanting to try this place. But, I have always been in such a hurry when I am at the airport I had not had time. The plus side is ,it is inside security so you don't have to worry about getting through Security. Which can always be stressful.
It is a very popular place as it is on the low B gates and there is a lot of flights out of that side in the morning. I came here with a friend from Denver after coming in from a flight. So we were not rushed. It is a very clean looking place. A great menu to choose from as well.

I ordered the Steak and Eggs, just a note, they do not do poached. So I got scrambled. It was very good and the steak was cooked just the way I like it. My friend got potatoes ,eggs , and bacon. The food was delicious and cooked just right. It was hot when it came out and it came out fast. The only thing that makes me give it 4 stars instead of 5. Was our server. She never brought us more coffee. 
Seriously we had to ask 2 other servers for more coffee. Which they brought us and with a smile.  Our server Alexa( I think that was her name). Did not seem too happy to be there and did not want us to have more than one cup of coffee. 
The bright side is, Food is great, place is clean, and most all the other servers are awesome.





I know this isn't really a bar but these were absolutely the worst Bloody Mary's I've ever had.





Their coffee was bad, the service was slow (they forgot my order) and they don't have half and half! Seriously, it can't be that hard to find a local source for cream.





Nothing worse then a cook that can't make eggs over-medium. Potatoes were good but the Thick cut bacon is seasoned with way to much pepper.  Nice friendly staff. Will have to try something different.





Hanging out here before our red eye flight. Cydnie was amazing!!! If you are ever in terminal B, stop in! She's friendly, warm, funny, and kind.  Airports can be nerve wracking but she's such a treasure!  Drinks were great too!!





We stopped here because we needed some breakfast to eat. We had been on a 6am flight from Monterey to Phoenix and this one of the places that seemed decent. 

There was a line but it seems that there is always is, however I had to wait 20 min more for my waffle, once I did order, with two strips of bacon. 

Honestly it was nothing special, edible, decent, and if you have a lay over and don't mind the wait. Go ahead and stop here. But it's nothing to write home about.





While the food tasted OK, it was served completely cold. The server must have gotten distracted because we were one of the first people in the restaurant when it opened early in the morning. We waited longer than we should have for the food to come, while people that came after us we're being served in half the time. Also, we asked if we could substitute one pancake in place of home fries and toast, and we were told that we would have to pay $4.50. Crazy! After flying all night, we were really looking forward to a great breakfast. We would not dine here again.





Passed through here with enough time for a sit down lunch...had the Hog and Chick with ham steak (plus an extra ham steak because it is just that good)

It is honestly almost coming to the Phoenix airport just to hit Matts.  I don't like potatoes usually but I will clean the plate with Matts potatoes, just the right amount of fresh rosemary and onion.  Great sourdough toast, delicious raspberry jam.  

And the ham!   Just please do yourself a favor and get the ham.  This is what you think about when you think ham, salty, smoky, crisp and soft all at the same time.  Can't wait to fly through terminal four again.





Color me shocked. I didn't have high expectations for a place in an airport, now I feel like airports are going to be held to a whole new standard. I opted for a Bloody Mary - which hands down is one of the best I have ever had. A small meal in itself. I also went for an omelette with a side of potatoes. Those potatoes, so delicious. Well seasoned with rosemary, crispy on the outside, and perfectly soft on the inside. Paul was an amazing bartender. Hope my flights are all out of this terminal whenever I am in AZ!





Had an extended layover in PHX airport and decided to try this place out. I had forgotten that Guy Fieri highlighted the downtown spot on DDD.

Local coffee served from Roastery of Cave Creek. The panda needed that caffeine.

Five Spot Platter ($8.95): Breakfast sandwich with bacon, American cheese, two eggs, and grilled onions. Potatoes on the side. The roll is large, with a small layer of filler. On the plus side, the roll was soft and fluffy. The roll's flavor reminded me of a croissant. The potatoes were seasoned generously with salt and pepper. Bacon was excellent. Good portion. Overall, I'd say The Five Spot hit the spot.

I just sat at the bar for this one. Good service.

I saw others at the bar ordering Reubens. Hefty sandwiches that are recommended by the staff if you want a nice-sized lunch.

I'll have to remember this place next time, should I opt for a very gluttonous meal.





The food is very good but the wait is long at certain times of the day. Still worth it.





Stopped in with my wife for breakfast before boarding our flight. It's a small place so expect to wait sometimes when they are busy about 30 min. So I recommend planning ahead to arrive at the airport early so you get to try this amazing food.

The pancake was amazing nice and fluffy with just the right amount of very subtle crispiness. What else can I say about BACON!!! BACON ROCKS and the bacon here is a little thick, crispy, and very tasty! The home fries are seasoned and cooked with friend onions so if you don't like onions might want to let them know. 

Our server was Tim and he was AWESOME. Great personality, friendly, and just a cool guy.

Highly recommend visiting this great place!





This brunch spot is a MUST go-to either here or their location closer to downtown! I was pretty happy being able to start and end our trip here in Phoenix with Matt's. It's a great Phoenix staple!

First things first, service here is FAST which is very appreciative especially at an airport. They have portable credit card machines they will bring to your table after your meal to pay so three people could pay at once without having waiters scrambling around the small space to run your card, run back to you, then run back to the table to pick up the tip receipt.

We got sat right next to the waiter station and our waiter was very attentive and fast. I got the chop and chick this time because I really liked the pieces of pork chop I stole from my boyfriend last time ... :P and he got the breakfast sandwich. Instead of the lemonades, he got a bloody mary and I got a mimosa in a stemless wine glass.  

I would say quality, service, and prices are the same at both locations we went to. This would probably be the definition of a good restaurant to try out at the airport here.





So I had the pleasure of eating at both locations while in PHX and this one out did the original!  I had this gin, lemon and soda water drink which solved my pissy attitude towards the airport :).  For food I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup and added bacon to the grilled cheese.  They had awesome buttery bread and the soup was nice and thick.  Every employee seemed like they were having a great day which helped as many of us were grumpy from canceled and delayed flight.  Prices were good so I strongly recommend!





Airport restaurants and bars are almost always going to be lesser than their counterparts. You're naturally going to get bottom of the barrel employees. Ones that can't get the same job outside of the airport. 

But, this place is especially bad. I'm an okay cook. Maybe pretty good. But not great. I could make better food than this place all day. It's terrible. If you need to eat a meal, it will do the job. But that's it. For example, the burger is really just pathetic. It's a very low quality ground meat. I mean something you wouldn't even see available at the grocery store. The bun overwhelms the meat because the burger itself cooks to a withering lump. Everything they put on the side to load the burger is equally unsatisfying. Nobody cares about the price in an airport. You have a captive group of buyers. Make good food. 

Service is sub par but nothing unusual for an airport. Just your typical waiting too long for everything even though you're obviously waiting to catch a flight. When I'm flashing my credit card though, let's get the transaction done. Don't walk away telling me my receipt is in the cup next to me. When is the last time somebody looked at a receipt in a restaurant. Just pay me out.





Why hello hashbrowns smothered in rosemary!

Stopped by here for a quick bite before my connecting flight and I literally fell in love with the potatoes. The coffee was strong and good but they don't offer cream and this girl likes fat in her coffee so thumbs down to that. Come for the food, not a service filled experience.





I fly a lot from the Phoenix airport and always come here for the awesome food. Today I decided to try the chili for the first time. It was cold! I sent it back and it returned lukewarm. I ate it because I was hungry, but was incredibly disappointed.





Food was great! First time trying out their breakfast food here. I got "The Hog and Chick" and it was fantastic & delicious! It was so packed when we got there and right when we sat down, it slowed down. Service was good even though she needed to smile more lol but it's fine. The food came at the expected time which is great. I liked it!





Beware food may be unsafe!!  Three of us ate here yesterday.   Service was fine, but we were sick all last night and today.  100+ temperatures.  Clearly food poisoning.  They should have their cleanliness and food preparation checked.





Really wish I could give this 3.5 stars, but system won't let me.  Ate here last week while on a layover.  Could not pass up trying the Bloody Mary (even though I don't actually like vodka) once I saw the bacon!  The cheese was a little weird, not gonna lie.  Also had the enormous Reuben sandwich, which was really delicious.  Service was great, friendly, food was plentiful, and the atmosphere was comforting.  Would definitely eat here again if given the chance.





Had the breakfast sausage burrito, spicy, meaty, and hit the spot. Service at the bar was a little slow but good server was very friendly. 
Coffee was better then the Starbucks 3 gates down

Tv's at the bar, NHRA on a Sunday morning





I know better than to have high expectations when going to airport bars and was having a great time at this place. But then the bartender, Lisa was a little rude. First she rolls her eyes at me when I tell her there's an error in the check as she charged me for a more expensive vodka and I guess it was to much trouble for her to change it as she tried to downplay the error saying they were the same price when they are not. Then after I gave her what I understand is the usual $1 per (airport overpriced) drink tip, she starts acting up and being sarcastic about her service not been good and that we should let her know what she did wrong so that she can get better because we gave her such a bad tip. I honestly never had a waitress or bartender ever give me crap about my tip before I even leave the place. What a shame.





Best breakfast I've had at a airport hands down, 
Good size portions and very good. Had ham and cheese omelet with fried potatoes and they actually had seasoning fried with them and onions
Was good stuff, Price was very fair for a airport





Quick eat and beverage.  I order the Cobb salad which was subpar.  It was tossed in balsamic which I have never seen before. A lot of the sale was wilted and brown and it was lacking the key ingredients of protein.





Jennifer, thank you for your great attitude today; you were genuinely very sweet and gave stellar service to me and the folks at my tall table.  You were very attentive, and went above and beyond to give us what we wanted.  The lady next to me did not like bacon that is not super crispy. You saw she did not eat it and came right back with some lean, crispy pieces. She took my silverware :)  The gentlemen next to me asked for a drink which Matt's serves on ice which he is not used to. You quickly apologized and wanted to make it right.  Matt, you need to give her a raise to keep her on staff; folks like Jennifer are rare and you cannot afford to lose valuable employees like her.   This is a great spot if you are sick of standardized chain food in airports looking to serve shareholders rather than customers BTW.
