Crappy service coupled with really bad sandwiches they make subway look like gourmet.  It's no wonder there's never a line at that place





I came here to get my wife a quick sub to eat for her while she was on lunch. I asked for a Beach Club and I was charged a beach club. My wife tested me and told me that their was no meat at all. I looked up on the menu and the beach club has turkey and etc. I called the store and spoke to Zach and he said they would fix it for me. I arrive at the store around 6pm and they "manager" (cough)cough) told me they could not do nothing about what happened. They basically started a full blown argument with me. I showed them my receipt and still nothing was done. When I asked for a coperate number I was told to Google the number. I asked for names and they all stayed quiet. I will NEVER come here or eat at any Jimmy John's ever. I the people here were rude, obnoxious and didn't care about my problem.





I've heard some people really rave about this place. They were so excited went Jimmy John's came to the valley. My review is based on a single experienced but it was definitely sub par. 

Am I the only one that has had a need for napkins or extra condiments? With the 7, count 'em, 7 kids in the sandwich preparation area and maybe 3 customers I was confused why when my girlfriend asked for napkins at the register, the girl told her they were at the other end.....literally like 5 feet away. So we walked 5 feet down and asked a different girl standing there and received napkins.

Went outside, sat down and realized there wasn't mustard on my sandwich. Went back inside and asked for some, "We don't have any." Yeah they don't have any salt, pepper, mayo, mustard or any self serve condiments. You have to get those things when it's being made. Weak. 

The bread was fresh, everything was really, but it was no where near an amazing sandwich. I'll probably try it out again but at least I'll know what I'm getting, an okay sandwich.





Used to frequent this place when I lived in Arizona. Fast delivery and even better sandwiches. Love the beach club.





I don't get all the hype - this is a good sandwich at a good price. Though I like the vibe and the attitude reflected in their decor and promotional materials, but the product itself is nothing miraculous. I gotta say I love me a tuna sub now and they - it pains me to say that lowly Subway blows this tuna out of the water.





Overwhelming on your first visit if you don't know what you want to order.  No kid meals.  You can't have anything "on the side".  I wasn't overly impressed with any aspect of the experience or food but it was okay.





The first time I went in there I was baffled by the menu. I am used to the typical Subway experience where you're in a line, telling them condiment by condiment what you'd like. This place was different. Their menu already has a classic combination of ingredients stuffed into their bread. 

So I ordered the #1 - Pepe (Ham & Provolone basically). While I was sure I would like the combination, but isn't a sandwich shop always about the bread? Well, that's my opinion. And I have to say, their bread is lacking in my opinion. It's that tough bread that can't really be that good unless you have steel teeth & an iron jaw to chew it with. I just don't dig chewy bread. The service was great. They immediately attended to me and took my order, but the food itself, I just wasn't impressed with the bread.





I've given this place a few chances to prove themselves and every time I am disappointed. The staff is rude, their sandwiches are usually made wrong, and they charged me for avocado and didn't put any in my sandwich. I have yet to have a good experience from this place. Plus their sandwich selection sucks.





One of my worst customer service experiences, period, happened here. I have been a fairly regular JJ's customer for about 12 years now and my only bad experience ever was here. They got my togo order wrong and then refused to refund me for the petty $6. 

Instead of refunding my card they offered to deliver a replacement. I told them on the phone that the sandwich was mostly eaten, since I was hungry and it was not an allergen issue, and I would rather have the refund. However they told me they can only do exchanges and since I have never had a problem at any JJ's I do not have prior knowledge of their policy on such things.

About 15 minutes later the delivery person (apparently the general manager?) arrived and when he saw the partially eaten sandwich he got a pretty bad attitude. After a short conversation he told me there was nothing he could do for me and left with my replacement sandwich; which I hope some one ate instead of it becoming waste in a trash can.

I have to close this by just pointing out that it is odd how this location will fight tooth and nail to not refund 6 dollars but will send a general manager, who likely gets paid $20+/hr, to drive 30 min to drop off the fix. Spending $10+ to save a $6 refund does not make very good business sense. Additionally, since they did not actually fix the problem and were just asinine, they wasted their time and money and still lost a customer at their location for life.

They messed up my sandwich and I didn't realize until I had left the store that it was still cold in the center. I called and they said that I needed to toast it. I told them that I asked for it to be toasted and that it was still cold. I then asked if I could just have a refund and they refused because I had left the store.

I went back a few weeks later and the same guy was working who I think is just not all there. Definitely a huge jerk and pretty dumb. They messed up my sandwich again in the same way (which I think might be down to the way they are preparing the chicken compared to other subways) so I just had him microwave it this time. 

Oh I also asked for a medium drink and he just gave me a large and said that it was a medium. Like, dude, I'm not retarded. I know what size of drink I want and I don't want that giant cup you moron





I went to this Subway Friday night, 8/18 and stood in the store for 5 min alone....no customers, no staff, nothing. Worried that maybe there was a robbery or something, I began asking loudly, "hello, is anyone around"? I left & drove around the back of the store, around the corner from the tattoo place & there was the staff in the alley, looking at their cell phones. I sat there for several minutes before they went in. Mr. Owner...you're losing allot if $$ here. Appalling...





Mm. Sandwiches. I think this is a very good Subway. It smells like freshly baked bread. They are very polite and the food is very fresh. This would have to be my favorite Subway because the service is always great.





Larger than most subways, this place gets packed around lunch time. They are open on most holidays, like today, Easter. Bathrooms are usually kept clean and the food is exactly what you see. The service is some times slow and the people are like zombies when it comes to, "what do you want?" Otherwise, no real complaints.





Wow great customer service!!!!! Hannah and Faith both are excellent.  
Our first time to try the Reuben and yum! It's good! Obviously the bread is not grilled but I am sure it is healthier. :) this subway is very clean inside and out and the restrooms are spotless.  
Music pleasant and not too loud to visit.  We will be back!

17.review:
This is not the Italian Food you're looking for.... 

OK, this place has gone seriously downhill with the new management, and the food was bad enough to make Marco Polo weep. 

Let's start with the good.... The place is big, the staff was friendly, the bar area was pretty nice, and they had a lot of TV's playing the Cardinal's game. I could totally buy this place as a sports bar. 

Now, on to everything else.... 

The parking situation is abysmal, but hey, that's Avondale for ya... I won't blame this restaurant for the shrieking baby, that blame goes squarely on the shoulder of the parents who were busy getting their drank on. 

We ordered: 
Apps: Onion Rings / Friend Mushrooms / Moz Sticks
Entree: Steak & Cheese sandwich, the "special" calzone, and the lasagna. 
Well, we didn't order the lasagna at first, of the 10 things listed in the pasta section it was the only thing available that wasn't spaghetti and meatballs. 
$50.00 for the check, this included drinks & a mediocre tip. 

The appetizers came to the table, and as soon as I saw the fried mushrooms I had a bad feeling. 

Everything was perfectly shaped and colored. This is because everything certainly came out of a freezer bag 5 minutes ago. The moz sticks were flavorless, the onion rings were perfectly round onion flavored bread rings, and the fried mushrooms were an undercooked disaster of batter, covering the world's smallest mushrooms. 

I'm not a super Italian food enthusiast, the kind that expects it to taste like it came from a Tuscan village. I just wanted something that tasted less like fried batter, and more like FOOD. 

My wife said the Steak & Cheese was OK. The meat and cheese components were tasty enough, but the previously frozen roll was undercooked and doughy. 

The lasagna was rough, Stouffer's puts out a similar product in the frozen food section of Fry's, so save yourself some money and try that if you want, because this was just not good. No seasoning, bland cheese mix, and straight from the jar sauce that was almost too sweet. 

The calzone, the Palermo's Special Calzone, was sadly also from frozen, and I can't let it go! (see what I did there?) It was perfectly shaped, and the outside was crispy, however, like all frozen entrees of this caliber, it was a soggy nightmare on the bottom. Inside it was watery and nasty. No taste, horrible "cheese" filling, and the same disgusting sauce that the lasagna was made with. No Bueno. 

The waitstaff was nice, if not a little absent after food delivery, but the food was abysmal. I'm a fat guy who loves to eat, and this had me rethinking everything.

I can tell you that #1 Brothers is right down the road, if you want a better Italian ANYTHING, go there, cause damn.





Good pizza and great hot wings! New owners work their butts off and are super friendly. I recommend this place for sure. I just wish they would add Buffalo Shrimp to their menu!





Palermo's is our favorite place to go for pizza and wings. New owners are very nice too! We go there every other Friday evening. Last night we brought s bunch of friends from church and used the meeting room. Everyone had a great time! I hope this place is a success!





Had the choice between the pizza here or a $5 dollar one from a chain, decided to give Palermos a try. Wrong choice! The price to quality ratio was just completely off. You really do not get what you're paying for, but hey the kids loved it so what the hell. Will try it again, but will not stray away too far from the pizza. The first thing that I noticed was that the pizza was very greasy. Greasy pizza, which is no problem if combined with pizza that has flavor, but the flavor here was completely lacking and greasy pizza without the flavor is no good. I kept eating just to see if it would improve. It did not. Like I said, I will try it again, so don't take my word for it. Try it for yourself.





Awful undercooked.  Got the runs from one piece.  Paid $22 for large crappy pizza that got me sick.





Really good pizza and wing specials.very affordable.cheezy tasty pizza.appetizers good and not expensive.if your a beer drinker they make the best michelada this side of the border.highly recommended.great for family and kids





This is my new go to pizza and wings joint. I get a mug of dos equis while i wait and it comes in a frozen mug. Love this place

18.review:
After a day of shopping in Kierland Commons we were looking for a late lunch and a cool drink.  We sat in a booth in the bar area and the service was great.  They've got a great wine list and the menu has a great varied selection - something for everyone.  For us, we just enjoyed lots of appetizers.  The spinach artichoke dip and the bruschetta sample platter were terrific and moderately priced.  It was a great place to spend an hour or two after a long day.





Trying to be nice since we moved from the Columbus, Oh, the home of Brio/Bravo/Lyndeys(founder) etc.

In the few months we have been here, we have had dinner, carryout and happy hour.   It does not seem to be the same quality food and attention to detail in any of the 3.  The worst is the "happy hour" food which per other posts is inferior quality.  The portions are just right and the prices are great but if the food sucks so what's the point?   Also, they broadcast Happy Hour but the bottle of wine was full price and we were not given other choices.The carpacio is always excellent and not bad at happy hour as well but everything else is salty, greasy and lacks the freshness and zip that I can't believe I am saying, from the midwest locations.





Brio has great service and very friendly staff. The food quality is a bit inconsistent depending on what day you visit. It's a great family place and the portions are large so expect to have leftovers.





My wife and I have been to Brio 3 times. All three times the wine was served HOT. Not warm, room temp. HOT. Each time the waitress acknowledged the fact and asked us if we would like a "side of ice". Are you kidding me!? When I asked if they receive a lot of comments on the wine, she replied "yes, but usually ice helps". On to the food..... average is about the best it can be rated. We have tried the restaurant 3 times just to be fair. Too many managers, servers, bartenders running around to have mediocre service and average food. Three strikes on this place...





What a beautiful place, went for happy hour great prices, nice portion sizes, beautiful presentation, the staff was friendly an attentive, the food tasted amazing, couldn't of asked for a nicer time, the chef was amazing, very professional, would definatly recommend this place an take out of town guests... Loved it!!





Service was atrocious when we visited. Shame too. Because we generally loved Brio when we lived in Denver. Perhaps the customer service standards are different in CO from AZ.





I met a friend here for lunch, and we ordered the soup and salad, the Bistecca
 salad, and minestrone soup, really good price, and the salad was chilled, it was delicious, the soup was pretty good too, I think I like Olive Garden's Minestrone better, my girlfriend says their Happy Hour is really great also !





Amazing service, excellent food, definitely will let everyone I know, locals and visitors to not look any further than Brio for an excellent meal. Brio has really met and exceeded my expectations.





I went here for lunch today with a friend.

The marlin special sounded good so we both ordered it.

Not such a great idea.  The marlin was overcooked.  My friend said it tasted like chicken.  The roasted veggies were just ok as well.

Next time I'll stick with one of the pasta dishes.





The food here is delicious! The lasagna bolognese exceeded all my expectations and more! It was one of the best lasagnas I've had in my life!! My husband got a pasta with a creamy red bell pepper sauce, and he enjoyed it as well. The creme brle was very good as well! I look forward to trying more dishes!





True italian rustic, like most Italians this place stuffs you with a ton of food. Breads, salad, main course and dessert...you won't leave hungry.





WOW!!! What an experience! If you visit Brio ASK for ASHLEY! She will make you feel like royalty. True Tuscan culture and atmosphere. Absolutely love this place! The service is what really stands out! An amazing experience!!! Thank you Ashley!!!





My son and now wife held their informal wedding in the private dining room on 10/20. Everything was great.  The event coordinator got everything arranged according to their wishes.  All of the guests enjoyed their meals which were prepared and presented very nicely.  The servers did a great job, especially considering all of the mingling guests they had to take care of.  The private room was perfect for the occasion.  Thank you to all involved! Char





It is what it is. A very pretty chain Italian restaurant. If you are looking for authentic or out of the box original, don't go here. If you are looking for solid, safe Italian American fare, this is your place. There was nothing wrong but nothing outstanding either, oh, except the butter, it was awesome. And to Jason B., all the shrimp that we get in Arizona is frozen. All of it!





Three of us dined. I had a whole roasted chicken with mashed potatoes and grilled veggies was excellent. Of course, I could not eat a whole thing. My son really enjoyed ravioli w/ tasty sauce. My wife had crab cakes which was good. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Do I go back again? Yes, definitely.





The food was ok, but the service was POOR at best. Only 8 tables with customers at the time and they couldn't handle basic service. Our waiter poured our waters and asked what we wanted to eat. He took our order and disappeared. We flagged him down after 5 minutes or so and asked for some bread. He said it was still being made then disappears for another 10 minutes, shows up with our 2 entree salads and a chicken Marsala and said the bread is almost done.  2 minutes later he drops off the bread and disappears for the rest of our meal. He never asked for our drink order, didn't check on us during our meal, or even refilled our waters.I asked for the manager and explained what our experience was like so far. He apologized and said he would be right back to refill our waters, which he did. Even though we told the manager that our waiter never took our drink order, HE didn't even care to know what else we might want to drink besides water. We gave them the benefit of the doubt and figured Brio was out of sodas, teas, coffees, beers, wines, and liquor for the rest of the weekend. They offered us free dessert, but at that point we were just done.  Remember, this was when there were only 8 tables that were occupied. I can only imagine what the service would be like if the place were slammed, but then again maybe that's why the place was empty on a Sunday afternoon.





Brio was the 1st leg of our progressive dinner last night (8-14-2013)  It was my dining companions birthday celebration and he had never been before.  I chose Brio for appetizers.  We were greeted promptly and seated.  I had stopped by the restaurant earlier in the day to drop off a birthday card and flowers for our table.  At that time I explained that we were only having app's there and moving on to another restaurant for our main course and a 3rd for dessert. All was well when we were seated, card and orchid in place (whew).  I ordered the Carpaccio and the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant for appetizers.  Wonderful was the food and service.  Until the server offered a dessert for the birthday boy.  Just an oversight, but all was well.  Thank you to Brio for making it a great start to our evening!!!





really good food & a good bar.  the location is good too.  definitely gone back numerous times.  parking is a bit of a pain, but not horrible and they have valet, although i think valet is the biggest scam around.





The food was awesome as always. However, this is the second time I've sat in the bar and had the bartender as my server. He is awful!! I asked for my check and it took him 10 minutes to bring it to me and then it took him another 5 minutes to pick it up. I was on my lunch break so I was in a bit of a hurry and he just didn't care. He did this the last time I was there too. Just awful service...





We discovered this one after shopping the west elm, and stopped in for a snack, had the meatballs, which were tasty, and served with polenta, which we liked, Decided to come back and try the happy hour, had their burger, really good, shrimp cocktail, not that interesting, more meatballs, still liked them, and the service was efficient if not overly warm, The place looks like an Italian version of the Cheesecake factory, all big and fancy and chainlike, but the food is definately pretty good, so we ll go back and try dinner soon,





Had a nice lunch here today.  The food was really tasty and they had some nice, healthier options instead of all really heavy stuff with huge portions.  I had a 5 oz filet with some yummy vegetables in a balsamic sauce.  My 3 1/2 year old liked it, too, it was kid friendly.  The service was good and the staff was friendly.  We would definitely come back!





I wanted to LOVE this place since we were planning to reserve a room for our daughters birthday but we've had a change of heart. While our server was a bit slow, which was understandable since it was a busy night. But my husband's order(short rib) was frozen! Seriously frozen inside. How does a restaurant charge $20 something for a frozen meal?! This place is nothing but an overpriced Olive Garden. Without the awesome soup and bread!





My husband and I love the atmosphere at Brio Tuscan Grille.  Upon walking in the door we were greeted by five smiling friendly faces at the hostess desk.  As a hostess walked us into the dining room I asked her to seat us at a booth, which was not a problem since It was early in the evening.  Our waitress was just as friendly. We ordered two appetizers and savored every bite of the crab and shrimp cakes and gorgonzola lamb chops...YUM!! (These appetizers are also listed on the menu as entrees.) My husband ordered a fish special as his entree.  I don't recall the fish name though our waitress explained it was similar to sea bass.  So far everything we ordered was perfectly cooked...moist with plenty of blended flavors.  The entree I ordered was spicy shrimp with orzo and vegetables. The veges were tender though the shrimp was a bit over cooked. I'm crazy about orzo...this was extremely oily. After several bites I gave up on trying to justify the oiliness.  This wasn't our first time at Brio and certainly not our last. Their menu has so many scrumptious sounding items I'm getting hungry writing about them!





Brio is on my list at least once every 3 months. It's my go-to choice when out of town friends come for a visit.

Always spot on no matter the menu choices.

Always spot on service - top notch. The same caliber as restaurants that charge far more.

I have yet to find any item on their dinner menu that is less than perfect. I like that there are many choices always so well prepared. That's part of why I like this place so much. All too often, it's easy to find a "go-to" for visitors where you end up having the exact same meal time after time. Boring.

Definitely going to go back. Again, and again.





Perhaps the worst service ever. Sat for 45 minutes with no bread or inquiry of our food order. Finally ordered food including flatbread. 20 mins later manager can over (who has since disappeared after multiple attempts for his reappearance) and told us they had no thawed dough. Seriously. It's Friday night at 8:30. 
Had to ask for bread again. Had to ask for food more than an hour in when all other tables had been fed. 
Asked for manager again. Assuming he slipped out the back. 
Food fine. Horrible service.

Comments stand. Since writing, Brio did the right thing. New manager Larry comped everything. Other manager never reappeared. Bad experience but they do the right thing. Thank you Larry.





On a crazy busy 'day after Christmas' restaurant hunting expedition, our family in Scottsdale took us to Brio.  The food was all-around excellent, and the appetizers were out of this world.  The spinach dip and beef/shrimp appetizers were particularly memorable.  

An extra star for being so kid-friendly!   Our children were crazy/screaming by the time we were finally seated, and the waiters pushed the kids orders through quickly to maintain our sanity.  Thank you!





Had such an amazing experience here last week. 

Dined here after early day from work with my best friend and my grand parents. We had appetizers, lunch (nana and I had pastas, zach and my papa had sandwiches, we had deserts (lava cake, cheesecakes, and tiramisu, wine, and coffee) and the entire meal was exceptional.

Lunch was super busy, but they always kept an eye on us and made sure we were well taken care of. 

I have always had an amazing experience at Brio and love it there. Check it out for date night or for a nice family dinner.





As one of the major new restaurants in my area, I've been wanting to try Brio since it opened, and I'm glad I did - I was very pleased!
-- Roasted red pepper and mozzarella bruschetta was very good...my only complaint is that it could have used a little more balsamic, and the mozz was a little greasy. I personally would have done a mix of mozz and goat cheese but, hey, I'm not the chef.
-- Chopped salad was okay...chopped lettuce, cucumber, tomato, onion, olive, and feta in a nice, light dressing
-- Pasta alla vodka...highly recommended! tortellini stuffed with ricotta in a spicy tomato cream sauce, with basil, crispy prosciutto, and garlic for that special added kick of flavor that makes this dish unique
-- Chicken limone...your standard picatta, but with two huge breasts of chicken and a side of yummy pasta (although the pasta was a little cold)
-- "Dolchinos"...small servings of desserts...we tried the key lime pie, which was yummy, but it was the bananas foster creme brulee that evoked a WOW!
All-in-all, I'm very pleasantly surprised by this chain restaurant. Lovely dining room, attentive service, and great food at moderate prices (figure $25-30 per person).





Went here for the first time with my lady at her request.  Nice ambiance, Overwhelmingly delicious food and presentation by the chefs.   We started with the insalata caprese, which was fresh with a very balanced dressing for the greens that came atop the salad.  I had the crab crusted salmon and basically wiped the plate clean.  She had the sweet potato chicken risotto, which she found to be delectable.   Our only qualm was that the service was underwhelming to say the least.   It should never take 20 minutes to get water on a table, our server never checked back on food satisfaction, and we had to grab another employee to check us out when we were finished with dinner.   For as staffed as the restaurant was, the front of house did a major disservice to the kitchen for the evening.    5 stars for food, 1 star for service.





Went to this restaurant few weeks ago.  The food was great including the desserts.  The service was very good.





Went here for lunch. Was good food. Took long time. Our waitress was very out of it and smelled
Like alcohol. Kind of amusing but had we been needing to be somewhere I would have been really mad. Hopefully the managers look at these.





What a great experience we had at lunch today at Brio Tuscan Grill at Scottsdale Quarter. Our server Scott was very professional and service was great. It was extra special when the Executive Chef Joe Milbert came to see if we were satisfied with our meal and if we needed anything. Bravo for Brio. Recommending to my friends to frequent this establishment.





Amazing: optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people work here and make excellent suggestions on food. I always get the best service and food here. Our friend complemented the Moscow mule made by Sara: very sweet and talented bar tender. The manager is pleasant as can be and booths are ambient and comfy. Thanks Brio and keep doing amazing work on pleasing our taste buds





Excellent time for 3 couples to dine and catch up.
We had may great entrees and some outstanding wine.

Or only challenge was that they had a great fish special and 2 of our party was told at 5:55pm that it was sold out.  so for a weekday the specials are suspect.

The service was kind and attentive.  The value was good and great taste in the food.
Worth  the drive from Tempe
Tom





We come here all the time for happy hour and normally have amazing service.  However this time we had Danny R as our server.  He failed to refill waters after asking a few times.  Was to busy chatting with servers to drop a glass of wine at our table while holding it for at least 5 mins.   Asked us 30 mins after we got our food if it was ok bc we didn't eat much of.  Then we waited another 10 mins for our bill.  All in all the service this time was subpar to previous visits.

After note I speak with the manager he credited the bill back.





When I walked in I felt like I was in a restaurant in the Venetian or Balaggio hotel. Realy nice and the host staff and waiters gave the best service you cuould possibly get. I ordered the homemade tortellini stuffed with a ricotta mixture covered in a pink vodka sauce. The dish was right on, 5 stars for this dish alone. I only wish there were a few more tortellini cause i could have eaten them till i exploded. Anyway dad got the pork chops topped with gorgonzola . He loved them. My mom and girlfriend got the steak topped with hollidaise. They both liked that but the steaks were over done a bit. They had a huge party they served before us and think our steaks were forgotten about and were a little over cooked. We told the waitress and they took both dishes off the bill and gave us free dessert. We got the dessert sampler and molten lava cake. Freakin unreal desserts. I will be back I would have given them 3 stars cause of the over cooked steaks but they made up for that in a big way and I will be back.





So these stars are for the way my complaint was handled. After waiting three days for someone to contact me I decided to call and ask to speak to a GM, he was not in and I spoke to Adam who is a manager. Adam refunded my charge, invited me back with a guest for a meal, but MOST IMPORTANT,  listened to me and apologized for my experience last weekend. I will come back and give this Brio another try. This is how my situation should have been handled that night. This is customer service.





Went to Brio for dinner early Sat. night. They were on a wait (of course) so we opted to sit in the Lounge. (I have heard  that they offer an awesome happy hour, apps are $2.95. I am looking forward to returning and taking advantage of that!)  Anyways.. This is my second time here and both times I have ordered the Pasta Alla Vodka. Absolutely Delicious!! It was so good, I don't want to venture out and try anything else on the menu!  Our server was great. It was a wonderful experience!





Girl's night out! Movies and Happy Hour at Brio.  The misters were going so we sat outside.  We were quickly seated and offered water and drinks. We ordered wine, 3 orders of pepper shrimp, flatbread, a burger, carpaccio, and tomato and mozzarella.  The wait staff is awesome.  People watching is fun.  Happy Hour is simply delish !  Everything was excellent and plentiful.  Our server was happy to give us separate checks and to go boxes.  A wonderful experience.





Yum! Always got the steak salad here and after moving away I had to go back when I visited.





After recently returning from Italy I discovered the Brio Tuscan Grill while shopping at the Apple Store.  With a new appreciation for Italian food I tried the Risotto and Insalata on the lunch menu.  

The Bistecca Insalata (a quarter cut of head lettuce and creamy ranch dressing with tomatoes and bacon) was crispy and tasty.  It could almost make a meal by itself with a glass of red Tuscan wine along with the seed filled crackers for extra taste.

The Risotto with Shrimp and Scallop was a small but adequate portion.  A little more flavor but not nearly the size nor quality of fresh shellfish I had along the waterfront in the Fishing Village below the town of Sorrento.

All in all a good new spot for lunch on the patio as fall finally approaches the Valley of the Sun.





Great food. Not your traditional Italian menu. I bit pricey, but large portions. Service was excellent.





The food here was fantastic. Came in with my family of 5 on Saturday evening. Had to wait a few minutes for a table, no big deal, as a party of 11 came in before us. We got seated near the bar in a large booth, but the table was itty bitty. Especially for 5 adults. 

By checking in on Yelp, I received a free appetizer. We got the Margherita Flatbread, and it was delicious! Rather big, perfect for sharing - enough for all of us. I can't remember everything that everyone ordered, but my mom and I split the Grilled Salmon Salad and it was SO good! Splitting it was perfect size; they do offer 1/2 sizes on the salads. All of the food came out very quick as well. 

Our server wasn't the best, he was very slow, and not good with recommendations. It felt as though he didn't want to accommodate my brothers request to change sauce on one of the pastas, as it took away from the taste or something like that he said. He was also very, very slow. He was too busy leaning against the counter by the computer at the end of the bar, drinking his beverage, and flirting with another server. We had to ask the manager to refill our drinks. 

The restaurant it pretty large, very clean, and well decorated. The bar is rather big too, and they have a few TV in there. I will definitely come back here next time I am in town.

5 stars if the service was better.





The boyfriend and I decided to eat here after attending the hello kitty event. Haha. 

For appetizer, I had the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with Parmesan flatbread. Honestly, I was so full after that. I didn't even want my entre anymore. Haha. But as my entre, I ordered the Ravioli Di Bello. Which had portobello, mushrooms, grape tomatoes in it. It was very creamy but hard to eat.

The service was so slow. Our drinks took forever, I asked for napkins and it took almost 15 minutes for me to get, same goes to the to go box as well.

The ambiance was nice, the decor and set up is  like Cheesecake Factory.





This can be a great restaurant IF you order right.  I previewed the menu and reviews first and had the shrimp and eggplant appetizer as my meal.  It's heavy, but oh so good!  I'm kind of a vegetarian except I won't give up seafood. And, I LOVE eggplant so this was perfect for me.





Why doesn't yelp allow half stars.  This is really a 3.5 restaurant.  Typical higher end Italian chain.  Food was ok but not exciting.  Was I expecting any thing different? Service was good.





Worst ever! Filing complaint waitress was horrific the worse experience ever another couple was just as ready to leave as us. Very sad people can be so rude





Sat at the bar couch for 15 minutes.  Bartenders and hostess walked by us 3 times not even a glance! Wow.  Horrible.  Got up and left to Mexican food place across the street.  Unbelievable.





Waited over an out just for our food. Service wasn't great. My pasta came out looking very dry, as if it was sitting out on the counter for awhile. Sent it back as I was not able to eat it. 2 minutes later it came back to the table. Same pasta, just some extra sauce mixed in. Lobster was very mushy. This is the second time I have visited, and I will not return. First time I had a 2" long bone in my food, and the waitress told me that I "now have a tooth pick for after my meal."





Salmon was great  
Service excellent 
Local beer, ill try again 
This guys never disappoint, this is the care that you get in a family owned restaurant with the highest everything





Food is good, Service though definitely needs improvement!!  This was my second time here, and unfortunately I'd have a tough time coming back.  Even for happy hour.  (which is a pretty good happy hour).  Our server, (Alecia G.) might have just been having an off day, but as mentioned above my previous visit, was a male server, who had no clue how to describe the food, or to suggestive sell on martini's and or cocktails.  This visit though was on a slower night, and I expected better service, than just having to ask for water refill (it is hot in AZ... you'd think water would be almost a given each time I got a cocktail).  We had to ask for the 4th place setting when our food came, and by the time we got that, the flatbread pizza was cold, and pasta the same.  At least there are other restaurant options in the direct area, (SOL, Eddie V's, etc)





My guests and I were seated and we asked for bread, as one couple had just gotten off a plane and they  were starved.  We got it 20 minutes later after asking 3 more times and threatening to leave.

The Calamari appetizer was the worst ever.  50% of the plate (not exagearting) was old breading, and the calamari was tough and overcooked.

I ordered the Shrimp Risotto, which used to come with shrimp and scallops.   No more scallops.  But of course they raised the price on the dish anyway.   Welcome to new American dining.   Cut the food.  Raise the prices.

Brio presents a nice atmosphere because it was physically well designed.  Problem is, they forgot to hire anyone who can cook or provide nice table service.





Wonderful place for lunch or dinner.  The service is fast and friendly.  The menu has all different types of choices including a wonderful gluten free menu! If you like beef carpaccio there's is the best I've  had by far.  Phoebe our server was very attentive and cheerful and the manger even stopped by to see how everything was going:).  I will definitely be back!!





This place has not disappointed me in the 5 years I have been going there.   Their happy hour is excellent, dinner menu is great and the service is always very good.  My server this time was Vivianne and she went beyond the call of duty, had incredible manners, very friendly with great suggestions about the food.  I am truly impressed





I like this restaurant! Come here every time I'm in Scottsdale. I like the food and the prices!





We had a great time at Brio the server Max was on top of everything very friendly and the manager Joe was very gracious and welcoming. We had ordered the lobster tail shrimp and risotto was an epicurean delight   We all 6 plan on returning soon and will be hosting a birthday party soon and plan on taking our friends there.





Stick to the pastas, everything else is poorly prepared. Dried up chicken and overpriced steaks. Prices do not reflect the food quality.





This is one of our favorite places for Italian food!!! Such a good fancy dinner for a reasonable price. Our waitress Samantha was clearly trained well and super personable. She did such a great job and made the experience fantastic!





This is one of my favorite spots as it has the trifecta of great ambiance, service, and food. 

During my last visit, our server recommended the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant* appetizer, and with good reason too! . It was amazingly flavorful, saucy, and peppery. By the way, saucy means having the ability to mop it up with the complimentary bread!

As far as entrees go, my two favorites are the Pasta Alla Vodka* (this was also recommended by our server) and the Fettuccine Napoli. I'm a bacon lover and these both have pancetta ;) The Seared Shrimp Risotto* and Citrus Chicken* both have great but simpler flavors in comparison to the previously mentioned menu items. I hate to say anything negative about this place, but the shrimp in the risotto was most definitely seared as described, but a bit on the tasteless side as well.

During my first visit, we tried the bread pudding dessert.. To this day I still fondly think of it and often imagine the next time we will meet again. I'll be damned if you find a better bread pudding!

Last but not least, the bellinis are awesome! I definitely recommend the peach bellini over the raspberry bellini as the raspberry is a generic kind of fruity and the peach is just... peachy :)

While I've been to better Italian restaurants, this place is amazing in terms of location and bang for your buck.

* = check out my photos!





We went to Brio last night with 4 friends, the food was great and our waiter Carlos was great. The peach Belini was very good, the salads and main courses were prepared just right. We used to go to Bravos in Pittsburgh, Brio is the same menu and good food. We will be back very soon and ask for Carlos.





There are so many better choices in the local area.  The food is bland and the service is slow.





I have to say the whole reason I give this restaurant 5 stars is because of our server Adrian- he was so personable and friendly!! He catered to our large party and was very consistent with his service, I really appreciate a restaurant that hires someone like him who truly cares about our experience. I will be back thanks to him!





My wife and I have been to this restaurant 3 times and dont know if we'll go again. Brio has potential as noted by our first dining experience but it seems to have gotten worse each time thereafter. We noticed the sauces have become watered down with smaller portions and when we called them on it we were told they do that for the happy hour crowd but we were in the dining room for dinner. They did replace the dish with the correct sauce and portions but we still felt as though they were trying to pull one over on us. When your spending more than $50 on a meal for two nothing should be watered down. The service which was amazingly good when they first opened has also slipped and we found ourselves feeling somewhat neglected at times with a forgetful waiter. Consequently, I've noticed we dont seem as motivated to visit them on date night anymore. Hope management cleans up their act.





What I like about Olive Garden and Carrabba's is they know who they are.  They're chain restaurants that give you an OK meal at an average price.
  
Brio is a chain that tries to be a classy local Italian restaurant but they don't live up to that. Don't get me wrong, the food is OK, the decor is beautiful and the restaurant is huge (thus taking away from the classy local restaurant feel).

I started with the calamari which was a bit soggy and came with two sauces that were spooned over about half of the serving. What if I didn't like the sauces? Ask for the sauce on the side.

For my main course I had what was advertised as Shrimp and Lobster Linguine.  A few problems with this dish.  The linguine was a bit overcooked and the lobster turned out to be scallops.  When I asked about the lack of lobster I was politely told that there was an error on the menu. Someone couldn't have told me that when I ordered?  Wasn't I supposed to notice?  

The service was very good.  As the restaurant filled up it got hard to hear across the table. Again, the classy local restaurant atmosphere they try to project ruined.  They do have an enclosed patio area that would be much quieter but I think they like to hold those tables for private parties and large groups.  Wouldn't hurt to ask though.





We had a luncheon for a friend's birthday today at 11:30am and all went well. I had an appetizer the shrimp and eggplant - it was delicious.  2 waiters were great. I think I would give 5 stars if we didn't have to ask for bread and coffee. The parking garage is a bit confusing and seemed to be busy today.  We had a few empty chairs, but 11 people is a good size group.
Thank you Brio staff for a good lunch!!!





Lasagna Bolognese was a good dish. Meaty. Shrimp and lobster fettucine was tasty as well. Nice restaurant inside, good ambiance. I will return.  The cheesecake mascarpone was excellent!





Celebrating an early Mothers Day, shared the Lasagna Bolognese, Salmon Griglia, Tuscan Grillled Pork Chops, Pasta Pesto and Calamari Fritto Misto. Large serving of  Lasagna and very traditional, while the Pork Chops were very tasty and prepared well. The salmon and pesto were from the "light menu" which were small portions. Everything was prepared and presented very well.  
The service was very good and the restaurant has great atmosphere for a nice evening. 
Would recommend this for a nice relaxing evening





Underwhelming.  Food was just ok.  Maybe because we had a group of 10, but we were there on a Sunday and hardly anyone was there.  Food was cold and service was just ok. They hardly refilled our drinks and never offered dessert.  This used to be one of our favorites.





Went to Brio's with my bday group of 8 girlfriends.  I, and 2 others ordered the calamari, and unfortunately we were disappointed in it. The manager came over and took replacement orders from us for the steak salads. He then credited 3 out of the 9 lunch orders to apologise for our initial disappointment.  What can I say, service like that makes me very loyal, and all my friends agreed we would continue to visit Brio's where the food is always tasty and the service is impeccable. Thank you to the manager for making my lunch special for me instead of the disaster it could have been.





I love the Scottsdale Quarter in general. The shrimp crab cakes are so good. I'm typically not one that likes the sauces that come with the food. But the sauce that comes with the shrimp crab cakes is so good. My waiter was so nice and personable I do wish I could remember his name.





Ate there Sat. night, party of 10, for a birthday.  LOUD, terrible service.  Waiter took 3 tries to get us right check, waited 15 minutes for coffee service and never brought the pot back for refills.  Lobster items ordered by 3 of group had no lobster in them!  Waiter ended up bringing bits of lobster to table separately.  Agree with other reviewer that food was cold by the time it finally reached the table.Veal was so over salted that it was unedible!  This was for both of the people that ordered veal.  The cod was over cooked and also unedible.  I believe there was confusion on part of wait staff as to who was handling the table.  The peach bellinis were wonderful, however.  NO WAY would I ever go back.  Sad, because it is a beautiful place with a decent menu.





Friends have raved about Brios in other parts of the country, so I finally went to the one near me. Absolutely loved the Pasta alla Vodka. Handmade pasta filled with ricotta cheese, bits of prosciutto, in the best vodka sauce ever. My friend ordered the crab cakes & also loved them. Great service, nice atmosphere, all around wonderful dining experience.





I go to Brio often for happy hour. The food is always delicious but recently the service has been something to mention. A new server named Nikki took care of us and was so great that we ask for her by name when we go. You guys made a great choice when hiring her. Hope to see you all again soon.





Solid spot good for large groups. Menu and food is nothing to remember but wouldn't expect much more given it is a chain.





Just had a great brunch with hubby Howard at Brio Tuscan Grille in Scottsdale. Had their beef carpaccio. 
Large enough fo two with capers, special mustard and olive oil and forcaccio crackers. Fabulous and two great bloody Marys. The perfect Sunday light brunch for under $25. need I say try it!





Took my daughters here for a nice lunch on a Sunday.  It was aesthetically appealing and service was fine, but the food was appallingly bad.  The chopped salad we sent back because the greens looked old.   My flatbread was cold, tasteless, and the texture of a matzoh.  The mushroom ravioli was inedible, overspiced, salty and cold.  My caprese salad was passable, but short on both olive oil & balsamic vinegar, with an anemic tomato.  For over $60, a complete bust.





One of my favorite restaurants, the prices are reasonable and the food is outstanding. It's a little bit too good when you are trying to diet. However, the lobster bisque is to die for, and one of the chocolate desserts actually melts in your mouth. Definitely a great place for a nice and quality lunch or a peaceful dinner!





Let me say I come to Brio especially because of their super delicious tomato bisque I can't get enough of! My only wish is that they served it more often during the week and on weekends, and not only on Tuesdays, a weekday when I rarely go because it's about 40 minutes from where I live and weekdays are always super busy. I also love their beef carpaccio, it's amazing and a must-have. It's all I ever eat (plus the soup) when we go there. Service may be slower sometimes but we keep entertained and fed with their great bread. Brio is one of my faves but please make the tomato bisque available more often!





The originality of the dishes are platitudinous however there was some fresh and delicious qualities. The bruschetta flight was decent (every place feels the need to put bruschetta on something that has the texture of a stale pretzel but its so much better on a piece of lightly toasted bread like sourdough) and the risotto had good flavor but the shrimp inside the dish were puny. Solid wine list, good happy hour, plus good service would bring me back for a snack and a drink... I would probably skip dinner though and just patron the happy hour.





Best waiter we have had in a long time! Thank you to our server Michael. Great food and wonderful service.





I've been here for a few family dinners. When I see family ,I'm talking 15 people at the table. For some reason Brio can't handle large groups. It's never easy.  Always chaotic. And the food honestly isn't that great.





On Yelp, 3 stars says "A-OK," and that's what I think of when I think back to our meal at Brio Tuscan Grille. 

The inside of the restaurant is expansive and the architecture is nice, in the way that many Phoenix restaurants are new and designed to look old. I didn't mind it, but it lacked the intimacy that I love from a dim Italian restaurant.

Our server was nice, maybe a bit slower to get us things, but she didn't make it a bad experience. And she definitely sold us on dessert at the end - one of the most impressive parts of the meal!

I got a shrimp dish that was noted on the menu to be "healthier." When you're at a place like this, you know that the butter runs deep, so nothing is really healthy, but I was hoping for something a tad heartier than what I got, which was a small-ish helping of veggies and a few shrimp. Luckily, my dining companions filled my plate with tons of their food - most notably an alfredo dish that was pretty fantastic. And her portion was enormous. So...take that for what you will. Fianc got a filet, which he loved, so good on them for not messing up a good cut of meat!

Wine list was extensive, but not a lot of by the glass options, if I remember correctly. 

Again, I really enjoyed dessert. We got the "tasting," which I think was a "small" portion of 3 or 4 desserts, and I just remember it being massive - like we couldn't finish it all between 5 of us. There were three full size desserts. And it was only $10! Don't make me tell you twice - save room (or don't) and get this.

Wouldn't make this my first stop on our next trip to Phoenix, but wouldn't say no to it, either!





Invited my mom there last night, found on Yelp that if you check in you have a free app.  Our server tell us that we can choose between app and bruchettas. We pick the Spicy Shrimp and eggplant and it's was delicious!!! We finished the spicy sauce with the warm bread!  We also found on Yelp some pasta with angel hair,  shrimp, caramelised onion,.. but they didn't do it anymore but the server recommend something similar and put shrimp instead of chicken  (without any up charge :) ). So we both had the Pesto pasta . It wasn't very flavoured,  we had to put some salt and pepper.. we will come back for a glass of wine and the amazing spicy shrimps and eggplant! ....and the patio is beautiful !





Me and my friend decided to try out brio at the quarter on Sunday very disappointed on the service we asked for one thing and the waiter brings something else after two hrs. The  food was nothing special, I will not recommend......





Totally overrated and overpriced. I've been out to eat there three times now. Usually I go grab happy hour because they have a pretty good deal. So this time I went in for my birthday and had a pretty bad experience. To start off they put us (8) at a small circular table that was cramped. Next the server would disappear for 20 minute intervals and we had no idea where he went. The server was anxious and highly stressed running around and wasn't able to play close attention to such a large party. That was just the beginning. The food was sub-par. I ordered a $29 8oz filet medium rare and it was like I was chewing gum. Usually, a filet that price should be cooked the way you ask. Maybe it's the style of restaurant or chef but I received the rarest steak. I had to eat food from others at the table to be satisfied at all. My sister ordered the salmon and had to send it back because it was extremely overcooked. She has been a server for 12 years and has some kind of knowledge on food. I think for the price the food should be much higher quality. I was there for my birthday and definitely won't be going back for anything, maybe the happy hour. I hope they get this message and make some changes.





Meh. As my fellow Yelper said to me a few days after we ate here: "No Brio review, I'm shocked!" 

I didn't jump on writing this review because I was pretty underwhelmed by the experience. The ambience sucks, the service wasn't very good and the food was totally average. 

My cursor is blinking at me and I still don't know what else to say about my time spent here. 

Ambience- looks like an Italian cheesecake factory. Why are the collumns so huge?!

Service- the bartender kept interrupting us to take our order when we STILL weren't ready. Jeez, does it look like I've moved my menu in the 53 seconds it's been since the last time you checked? And then disappeared when we were finally ready. 

Food- 
-carpaccio, not bad but does it seriously need to be that huge? The two of us didn't even come close to finishing it. 
-Mediterranean pasta, pretty much the only one without a cream sauce on the whole menu. They split it for us which was nice and it tasted all right with mushrooms and chicken and stuff. 
-tiramisu came out frozen. They were super apologetic and didn't charge us for the replacement, but it was still awkward. They obviously just heated up a piece which made it melty and just not that great.

So yeah, that's that.





OMG, I LOVE LOVE LOVE this Brio location! Practically every single time we go there, we have exceptional service and tasty food (the bread is to die for!). If something's not right, they fix it right away. 

My favorite dish is their beef medallions...I don't know what's in the sauce, but it's addicting! And their desserts are good too. The restaurant has a very nice ambiance to it, it's very rustic and relaxing. 

I highly recommend trying Brio out if you're in the mood for some good Italian food and great service!





Brio is one of my favorite Italian restaurants.  You're not going to get mama's memorable home cooking from Italy, but it's good food.  Even though most dishes are very flavoable and delish, the lasagna is my favorite.  Great staff that's efficient, and professional.  Plenty of parking in garage.  You may have a wait some nights.





Honestly, I don't understand why this place has such a low rating. Maybe those people weren't here during happy hour? 

A group of five of us stopped in on Friday after work. It is an AWESOME happy hour! The Rosa Sangria is to die for, and all of the other drinks looked great, as well. The food is really what made this place special. Very reasonable prices (especially for Scottsdale) and a good amount of food. I recommend the Blackened Shrimp, the Artichoke Dip, and the Eggplant Fries (my favorite). The deserts are fabulous (there was a caramel/pumpkin cheesecake desert that was to die for, the lava cake was amazing, too!).

Our waitress was very attentive, considering it was a busy time. She even held her grace when we were being difficult and asked for separate checks. The crowd is obviously very Scottsdale (Botox and plastic surgery all around), but it won't deter me.

I will be returning!





5 star for the best resturan that i ever gone for great pasta , kind castomer and good location . My husband and I usually go there we had a great times every time, I recommend to going there  my favorite juice is lemonade strawberry





Three separate times my girlfriend and I have had issues here.

1. We came on a day when the restaurant was fairly empty, maybe 5 tables in the whole place. Food took forever, waitress would disappear for a long time.  Everyone has an off day but this did leave a sour taste.

2. My girlfriend wanted to have her birthday party so we wanted to go visit the restaurant and while there set up the party. We arrived and the wait was 45+ minutes.  No biggie but we didn't have time to wait.  She asked if the manager was available to discuss a party of 20+.  The hostess was extremely rude. Had she said, "I am sorry, the manager is busy right now so may I take your information?" then that would have been fine.  But she was like "The manger will not see you right now. We are in the middle of dinner rush." in a very rude voice.  We called later and the manager said he would have been happy to see us and that she was indeed being rude.  He did not try to salvage the party reservation.

3. Last night we went again. It started off great with the waiter seeing to our needs. We got our appetizer and soup and then he disappeared for a long time. When he returned he informed us that he had forgotten to put in our dinner order.  He took off one soup, which was nice of him, but in this situation the manager should have visited the table.  We were there for a long time and left with a bad taste in our mouth.

We love the lobster bisque but will not return.





Love the decor in this restaurant- it makes it seem very upscale and authentic to European cuisine. However, the prices are too steep and portions are too small (compared with the nearby Maggiano's). The service is nice and the complimentary bread has some variety, which makes it quite interesting. Here are some dishes we've tried:
- Pasta Brio: the most unique of the bunch & quite tasty
- Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine: rich sauce, would've liked more seafood though
- Campanelle Carbonara: slightly disappointing and very run-of-the-mill flavor





Very good.  When you check in you get a free appetizer! Every yelper can get excited over that. I chose the spinach artichoke dip and it was good, on the heavier richer side but yummy! Than I ordered the sliced steak salad which was delicious but drenched in dressing. We finished up with the lava cake which was AMAZING! So decadent. They had chocolate ice cream on it instead of vanilla and I loved it! The bite of cold ice cream warm cake  and hot filing was just SO good. I'm talking drive her again just to have the lava cake good.  Worth the splurge on calories





I have sent the restaurant a private message as well, shall see if we hear back.  Went for dinner here with a party of 9 a few weeks ago. The place was packed, while we were seated quite promptly for our reservation, everything from that point on was far from prompt or good. Sat down at 7, finally were able to place our food order at about 7:40, by 8:30 still didn't have our food. Everyones luke warm food finally came, except for my husbands, he waited another 7-8 minutes for his, lucky him, he had the only hot dish. It was like everyone else' meal sat under the heat lamp, like a gooey mess of pasta and we even had a rare lamb chop in the mix :-( Manager came over to apologize and say that he was sorry and would take care of us. Had a few creme brulee's comped and the lamb chops. Will not be dining back here again, manager just seemed to be putting out fires and we were one of them. Our waitress tried her best and was apologetic. Very unimpressive, pricey meal for what we got.





Fantastic service from Sarah at the bar! She is so funny & friendly. All our food was delicious! Definitely coming back here again soon.





My friends and I have been coming almost every Wednesdays for months. We come during happy hour and sit on the patio. Usually, the host is very helpful and we are sat right away. The happy hour prices are very nice, their Tomato Mozzarella salad is awesome! That's what I get all the time.
However, we do not come here for the service, that's for sure, to be honest, it is quite horrible. Which is the reason why I only put 4 stars.
I came here for dinner a few times as well, their pasta are delicious!





Worst service ever!
We went on Mother's Day just me my husband and son, hostess was rude and said they were booked for the night but we could sit in the bar. I had to ask twice about the booths before she stopped texting to answer me. 
We sat in the bar forever before we were greeted. We sometimes saw our waiter even when we stood up to flag him down he avoided us but was in the back where we could still see him talking, dancing and standing around. Even when we tried to flag down the manager he walked right by us twice. My husband's salad never came but we were still charged for it, our pasta was cold and just beyond disappointed in the place we picked for my first Mother's Day. Will never go back or recommend to another person.





Had a reservation for 13 people. After we sat down, there was a 20 minute wait for our two waiters to just take our drink order. After we FINALLY got our drinks, they took our food order. Halfway through the order, a different server took over. Then, we waited an hour for our food. Two people in our party ordered the lasagna. As they were delivering the food, they informed us that they only had one serving so they split it in half and served it. We had two children under the age of 5 with us and we asked for dough for them to play with four times before they brought it over. Also, had to ask for drinks several times before they were brought to the table. The manager never came over and talked to us. From where we were sitting we could see that he was looking at us and talking about our table. When the brought the bill, there were still the 2 separate orders of lasagna on it, even though they took one full order and split it in half for two people. I was highly disappointed in the service. Not once did they apologize or ask if there was anything they could do. I will never return back to this restaurant or recommend it to anyone.





I love going to this place. I haven't had anything here that I didn't like. Their customer service on the other hand is a hit and miss :(

However, their food speaks for itself so it hasn't dampened my opinion of this place. 

I love their steak salad. It's very, very tasty. Just order the dressing on the side though. It's over powering if you let them mix it in, at least in my humble opinion.





What can I say, the ambiance when you walk in looks like a nicer, more upper class version of Cheesecake factory. It has high ceilings, drapes, expo kitchen... everything you'd want in an Italian-american spot.

The wait staff seemed kind but a bit "above the rest"... if you know what I mean. Just because the location is in Scottsdale doesn't mean you need to act out the assumed local attitude.

In the food department, the food looked beautiful. Plated for a photo opp, so that was nicely done. As for flavor, it doesn't stand out to me as a place that is AMAZING... it is more of a 'good' place to eat. I would definitely not drive out of my way for this restaurant. But if I'm again in the area and craving this type of cuisine, I'll most likely stop in





I went last night with a group of friends,  I had a Brio Steak Salad, and it was very good. The waiter was very nice and friendly. I also have a cosmopolitan martini that I LOVE it!





Not impressed with restuarant but they're Happy Hour is amazing - that's impressive! You have to get there early though or you will find not one seat - $2-3 dollars a plate for very good Italian, no wonder it's not easy...Enjoy!





I had the lasagna there and it was good. Large portions came out on the plates. They had only 3 drafts on tap so not much choice there.  I would come back.





I was here a couple of days ago for lunch with a client.  Instead of fighting for parking at Kierland, why not check this place out the next time you're in the area?

It's an attractive restaurant with a big open dining area.  Kinda fun to people watch.

I had the mezza chicken.  Basically a chicken breast, mashed potatoes, grilled veggies with a mushroom sauce over the top.  Plenty of food, that's for sure.

Good service and reasonable prices.





Great food paired with the worst service I've ever had. Received our entree before our drink. Had to walk to the bar to get my water filled. Never again





I was last at Brio Tuscan Grille in this location in early February and gave it a 4 star review.  I went back today with an old friend who has also greatly enjoyed this restaurant many times in the past.  We were both very disappointed.

I had the Shrimp Mediterranean just as I did, just one month ago, in February.  This time, instead of ample perfectly cooked stalks of asparagus, there were two or three small cuts off one spear.  Instead of an abundance of  fresh vegetables cooked to perfection, they were sparse, limp and not very fresh tasting.  The orzo was unimpressively prepared.The shrimp was still  good.

My friend had the special which said it had scallops and eggplant among other listed ingredients....I think it included rissoto.  While the scallops were perfectly prepared, the rest of the meal lacked any significant amount of egg plant and other listed ingredients.  She said it tasted like all tomato.  The eggplant was her main attraction to this menu item and was grossly underrepresented.

This is the only time we have ever had a coupon, but I do not think the sharp drop in quality was because of that.  There was some confusion in applying the coupon that required some kind of a card or a phone number despite having printed and presented the coupon received in my e-mail.

The bread and lavosh were still excellent, as always, but the dessert selection was not as imaginative as usual and did not tempt us enough to order.

I hope this was an anomaly, rather than the new normal.  We have enjoyed this restaurant in the past.





Love this place! The food is absolutely delicious and the service is always spectacular. I recommend ordering their casear salad- their homemade dressing is impeccable. Also their flatbread and pasta alla vodka are both favorite dishes of mine
Love this place, always stop by when i'm in the area.





Two of us tried Brio on a Thursday night at 6 PM.  It wasn't crowded, except in the bar where the happy hour crowd was enjoying themselves.  The rest of the place was only about 70% full so we got a table immediately, and it was pleasant and not noisy.

My wife ordered the Bistecca side salad for $3.95 which she said had a great dressing.  She enjoyed it.  The sour dough bread and flat bread was good too.  Our main courses were Angel Hair Pasta Primavera for $14.50, and I had the Daily Fish Special, $18.95, which was three large Sea Scallops with a salad of greens and mixed fresh veggies with  a balsamic vinegar dressing.  I loved the Scallops and salad.  My wife liked her pasta dish too.

The desert selections offered were small bowls with different fillings.  We enjoyed the Key Lime pie filling, for $2.45.  

Our server was nice, efficient, with just the right amount of attention to our needs without being a bother.

The parking is in a multi-level parking garage that is right next to Brio.  It wasn't a hassle to park, but it wasn't very crowded so we parked on the first level.  There is valet parking for $6.

Overall we really enjoyed ourselves.  And we think most people would like Brio.  Our total bill was $56.73, before tip.  This included one glass of wine at $7.95, and one beer for $4.75.





Hands-down, Brio is one of my favorite places in all of Scottsdale and across the country as a whole.  I know that, no matter what city I'm in while on travel, I'll get good food and good wine from Brio and the staff is pretty darn professional.  I love Brio happy hour, especially the ravioli and beef carapacio and the Brio burger is BY FAR one of the best for a chain restaurant. 

I first started going to Brio a number of years ago back east in the DC area, and I've been a fan ever since.





We were looking on Yelp for a good seafood restaurant near the Phoenix Mayo Clinic tonight and found Brio Tuscan Cafe had good reviews. Not only that, but Yelp offered a free appetizer. We were so glad we tried it! Our appetizer, Roasted Garlic, Spinach and Artichoke Dip, was yummy, and our entrees were uniquely prepared, presented, and delicious. I had the Grilled Salmon Fresco, and my husband had Shrimp Verduta. Can't wait to return and try some of their other wonderful options!





This place is a disaster. Went in for lunch on a Sunday and it was dead. Our waitress was fine but the food made the Olive Garden look like a Michelin star restaurant. I sent back my salad because it was wilted and slimy. The minestrone was super salty and tasted like it came out of a can. My sister's ravioli wasn't good... It tasted like it was heated up in a microwave. My mom got a caprese salad and it was okay but nothing to write home about. The flatbread was cold with very anemic looking tomatoes  and tasted like it had canned Parmesan cheese on it. For $60 with tip, even with the salad taken off, it was like highway robbery. Absolutely the worst italian food I've ever had.





So far, I've tried 3 out of the 118 Brio Tuscan Grille's.

I've tried their location in Alexandria, Virginia, which I previously reviewed (3/5 Stars), a couple visits to their location in Gilbert, Arizona (4/5 Stars), and was close to this location, and thought I'd try it.

BRAVO BRIO RESTAURANT GROUP

Bravo Brio Restaurant Group is the parent company of the Bravo! Cucina Italiana, Bon Vie Bistro, Brio Tuscan Grille, "Brio Coastal Bar & Kitchen", restaurant chains in the United States. 

The company owns 118 restaurants and trades on the NASDAQ stock exchange under the symbol BBRG. 

It was established in 1992 by Rick and Chris Doody in collaboration with Executive Chef Phil Yandolino, and is based in Columbus, Ohio. Brian O'Malley is the company's chief executive officer and president.

Bravo! restaurants have a Roman ruin style dcor and an open, Italian style kitchen focusing primarily on pastas and pizzas.

The company's goal is to be the "Best Italian" restaurant company in America.

THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE

On this occasion, I had a training class in the area, and wanted a quick bite. 

I had never been to this location, but I've enjoyed their other locations.

Although the decor is a little kitschy-over-the-top, I like it. 

My server, Kelvin, was super fun.

I had the shrimp appetizer, which I always love, and it was practically free with the Yelp check-in voucher.

Everything I had was OUTSTANDING. 

CONCLUSION

Are they the "Best Italian Restaurant in America?" 

I'm not sure about that, but, so far, every visit to this location has been fantastic! 

The food is good, the restaurant is over-the-top cute, and the service excellent.

4/5 RECOMMEND

OF NOTE

*Plenty of parking in the garage across the street.

*Valet parking available.

*Gift cards available.

*For more information: brioitalian.com





We sat at the bar last night at Brio and it was wonderful! The two bartenders Marian and Brenden were the perfect hosts!! They were friendly and beyond helpful in deciding on what to eat! Thank you so much for taking such good care of us. We are most definitely coming back to Brio of Scottsdale!!





Went this evening for the first time actually as a fluke. Was waiting for a table at Postinos, but they had a wait there thay was a hour long. My friend and I were roaming around and stumbled upon Brio. We went in to just get a drink at the bar, but was greeted with such friendly service that we decided to just stay for dinner. Wednesday was $5.00 martini day in the bar area. Had 2 different ones that were great. A lemon drop and a peach one. The yummy basket of bread was a nice treat until our salads came. Great wedge salad. Got the vodka sauce pasta with ricotta, and it was so tasty. Cooked to perfection. What a nice restaurant to just stumble upon, but will be back again soon. yummo





Went last nite for happy hour.    Weds is also $5 martini nite evidently!   I had the Raspberitini and the Lemon/Basil tini.    Both were excellent!  Our server Brie was happy to bring us samples of the HH wines ...... but my friend didn't care much for them and opted for a $9 glass of blended red from Australia..... at the recommendation of another server.  
We ordered 4 appetizers of the HH menu ...caprese salad .... very good.     Margarita Flatbread ..... excellent.   Beef Carpaccio ..... tasty and beautifully presented.    And the black peppered shrimp  .... we asked for the spicy sauce on the side, which we got.   And we asked to hold the black pepper, and just bring the peppermill ..... as I don't like black pepper or spicy!

Well she did her best and offered to order something different for us and had it taken of the check.   We ordered the garlic/artichoke/cheese dip instead and it was great.

I used to eat lunch here weekly when I worked next door. That was almost 5 years ago. After I moved back to Phoenix, I thought that I lived and worked so far away from Brio. Tonight I made the trip and will be back on a regular basis as it is worthy he drive. The food is still fantastic. Our server John in the lounge dining area was one of the best I have had the pleasure of dealing with in a long time. Totally professional and very friendly. Not bad.  Service was good and food moderately priced.  More of an open concept, so it is loud depending on the night.  I order the crusted filet and it was great.  I'd go there again.





Went to a Sunday lunch with my mom, but never again.  The service was awful and it wasn't even busy at all.  My mom ordered a chicken flatbread only to find two hairs (not hers) and a piece of plastic wrapper? No thank you...





Love the presentation of the dishes,  the quality and freshness! The happy hour it's amazing.





The food was bland and barely edible.  The beef app was a joke.  It had no flavor.  Even the mustard didn't help.   The caesar salad was yellow.  Not even a shade of green in there at all.  The lobster bisque lacked flavor.





I give two stars strictly because the customer service was TERRIBLE, I guess we came late and agitated our server, but who knows. The food was very good I had a flatbread that was excellent and the carpaccio was also good and HUGE. The mall that Brio is located in could really use a jolt of electricity, but that seems to be all too familiar these days with the funky economy.





We came here for a Bon Voyage dinner for our good friend leaving for Australia.  Our reservations were through Open Table.  We were promptly seated.  Our server, Christa was excellent.  She worked with my wife to secretly plan to put a decoration my wife had made on our friend's dessert.  The appetizer, eggplant with grilled shrimp was delectable.  Sourdough bread and crispy flatbreads were fresh and fully flavored.  The Pesto Pasta with chicken as well as the Tomato Bisque soup was memorable.  Finally the desserts...unforgettable.  The Carmel marsclpon cheesecake withe the Australian  Flag on top, and the Tiramisu.  The restaurant was clean including the restrooms.  Valet parking $6.00.  All in all a great experience.





There are many things that come to my mind when I think of Brio.  Interesting food, great quality, elegant atmosphere and friendly service.  But one thing has stood out recently since I have gone there and that is, $2.95 appetizers in the bar until 6pm.  When you think something is $2.95, you probably think it is either a small portion, not good or both of these things.  Well it is neither of these things.  The appetizers are generous portions and great tasting with several selections to choose from.  I want to just make it easy and say to the waiter, I'll have one of each please.  I love a good cheeseburger and the Brio Bistecca Burger is definitely my favorite right now.  It comes on a tasty bun with mozzarella cheese and is served with well done potato chips...yum!  You don't even get messy eating it because they cut it into quarters for you.  The bruschetta is also easy to eat because you can just pick it up and bite it.  They have two different kinds on the happy hour menu.  Roasted Red Pepper & Fresh Mozzarella Bruschetta with fresh basil and a balsamic drizzle and Sliced Steak Brushetta with Gorgonzola Dolce, arugula, fennel, charred tomato, shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano and Tuscan Italian dressing.  There is also a Margherita Flatbread that is prepared with Fresh Mozzarella, vine-ripened tomatoes and fresh basil cooked in an authentic Italian wood-burning oven.  I don't eat calamari but my friends ordered the Calamari Fritto Misto which was fried to a crisp golden brown with peperoncini and they liked it.  This is probably just either half or less than half of what they offer for $2.95.  I still haven't tried either shrimp appetizers or the eggplant appetizer.  The Beef Carpaccio served with field greens, capers, mustard aioli and fresh Parmesan cheese looks excellent as well.  Tuscan culinary creations are perfected at Brio.  If you decide to go, please save me a seat in the bar.  As you can imagine, they go rather quickly.  Buon Appetito!





We hadn't been back to Brio for almost a year so were worried that it might not have the same pizazz it had before. However, we had an excellent lunch (my wife had a flatbread and I crab cakes with some delicious veggies). The only disappointment was the free tiramisu birthday dessert that wasn't much more than heavy whipped cream with a touch of coffee taste. Service was not particularly attentive.





I was not disappointed .......... the service and food were Very Good.

                  You'll find a  Quality Meal ....... with Quality Prices.
                  From the Hostess to the Servers ........ its all Ten's. 

About the Food ...... Throughout my life ..... I've had better Italian.
This is Upscale Dinning ....... its more about the experience ...... then the Food.
Conversations with your tablemates ....... are almost impossible ..... Extremely Noisy. 

        By all means ........ Try it Once ........ Then decide for yourself about return visits. 

                       Me ......... I'll be back ....... every 2 or 3 months.





A few days after the amazing Yelp event at Brio, I decided to go back to enjoy my FREE bruschetta! This visit was yet again, AMAZING! First off, Kimberly, our waitress, was the most personable, helpful, awesome waitress ever! She was very insightful and suggested some pretty tasty appetizers. I'm not a fan of eggplant, but she assured me it was to-die-for. She was not lying, it was delicious!

They also had the same live music as the Yelp event had and he was just the perfect sound for a happy hour date on the patio.

Then, to top it off, the manager that was hosting the Yelp event came over and introduced himself. Thanked me for going to the Yelp event and for coming back! So hospitable! I felt like I had a second royal treatment!

Thanks Brio, you guys are awesome!! :)
