Wooo, very great food and great service. Thank you Mary! I applied a coupon on yelp, then I ordered a tomato mozzarella(appetizer) dish which is good for diet( low calorie). And it was very delicious! After lunch, I was told the lunch was $0 balance! A surprise!   I will definitely come back with my friends and highly recommend!





Beautiful decor, super friendly staff, but it's a chain...

Typical italian fare and a brunch menu, so we tried both.  We had the french toast which is better at IHOP or any other breakfast joint.  We also tried the lunch sandwich and salad combo. My turkey club panini was a waste...tons of bread with one slice of turkey, too much cheese, and an unchewable tomato.  The chopped salad was ordinary.

We won't be going back. Once is enough.





We were very disappointed by this restaurant. We expected to be impressed, and simply were not. This place does not live up to its hype. 

We came here for a birthday dinner, and I had a certificate for a free Beef Medallions with Shrimp Scampi. We also ordered the Brio Chopped salad and Calamari. 

The salad was delicious, but we weren't impressed by much else. The calamari was tasteless to say the least. The beef medallions were not cooked to our preference- we ordered them medium rare and they came out well done. The shrimp scampi included only a few shrimp on top of the medallions, all sitting on a bed of orzo pasta and small pieces of roasted vegetables tossed in a sauce. 

We were just disappointed. I would suggest going somewhere else.





We decided to go there for lunch as my wife had a work outing there and enjoyed the food.  The restaurant was less than a quarter full and the waitress was friendly.  The food was decent (calimari, lobster bisque and salads) and the portion sizes were fine.  I was just puzzled why it would take over 30 minutes to receive our salad orders and soup.  Since the restaurant was empty I did not expect to wait that long for a rather simple order.  We then had to wait over 15 minutes to pay.  My final impression of my experience was having 3 hostesses (or waitresses) hanging out by the front door gossiping and ignoring me.





Absolutely fabulous experience today for lunch.  This is a great place to eat if you have food allergies or sensitivities. Not only do they offer several options that are gluten free, but they were also quite flexible about making some variations for my friend who has many food limitations. The manager Steve was very personable and came to our table to be sure my friend's needs were well taken care of.  My Pesto Chicken & Quinoa Salad was excellent as well. To top it off, it is conveniently located near the parking structure and the prices are reasonable. I will be back again soon.





Lovely interior but average to below avg. food and definitely over-priced for the quality of the dishes.
This was my second time at Brio - first time was lunch and food was fine (Strawberry/Chicken salad) but service (for 2) was terrible! It took 40 min. & 2 inquiries after ordering to receive the salads. At the time I thought, while the salads were good (not great or unique) it wasn't worth the wait or the high prices, though the restaurant itself is lovely. Also, I had to ask for a table that wasn't next to the loud clanging of the open kitchen so my friend & I could talk without shouting.
So, 8 mos. later my 17 yr. old wants to celebrate his birthday where? Yup - table for 5, dinner, please!
I will say the server was very nice & very accommodating. However, once again we found ourselves seated right next to the open kitchen & we were told all the tables for 5 were by the kitchen - so we shouted over the din (restaurant was only 1/2 full?). So, with entrees from $18.95 - 23.95 we opted for the "Dinner Special" an all-inclusive 3 course meal (3 entrees to choose from) for $16.95 ea., (beverage extra) and the ravioli appetizer. 
The appetizer was delicious - only 4 large ravioli for $14.95 though and the Chicken Milanese ordered by 3 of our 5 was enjoyed. I tasted it and it was good. My choice, the penne diavolo w/chicken tasted like spicy cheesy-Mac with tomato sauce mixed in - not great at all. Our other guest had the strawberry-chicken salad and enjoyed that.
However, it was agreed that basically it's Olive Garden at twice the price in a better neighborhood. If you want authentic, true delicioso Italian food I recommend Roma Garden - same prices, not a pretty neighborhood but mamma mia, it's authentic! Or any other favorite place you love for Italian - Brio is not for foodies or anyone who wants to talk at a meal.





Went into Brio the other night as SQ is close to home.  The restaurant was very nice looking and being as it was happy hour I took a seat at the bar.  The bar staff was very friendly and I was happy to find out they had some awesome deals for happy hour.  I tried their shrimp and eggplant appetizer and it was amazing.  I'm not usually a big veggie guy but between the shrimp and sauce this dish is delicious.  The bread was warm and fresh and I ended up using too much of it to sop up the sauce from the appetizer dish and made myself full.  Can't wait to come back and try more.





I work at Scottsdale Quarter and this little gem never disappoints! I always receive Outstanding Service! I'm constantly stopping in for my quick lunches which they accommodate by being quick with my order! Also, several peers I work with enjoy meeting up for drinks or a snack on the patio!!





the food was exceptional and the waiter was awesome...everything was timed perfectly...my wife said her chicken was one of the best dishes shes ever had...i had the lobster and shrimp linguini...excellent...the strawberry shortcake was fresh and very tasty...definitely would go again





Cheesecake Factory is way better. This place has very slow service and the hostesses seemed stuck up. The food wasn't all that great either, but the appetizers are pretty tasty. I think this place is way overrated.





Great food in a fun, upscale atmosphere, but you can come here dressed in anything.   Restaurant can be loud, but you can still talk, so that is good.  The food was excellent, although the service was slow for our table of 6.  The restaurant was busy, but our server seemed overloaded.  All the food we ordered was great, though and everything we saw that went by looked yummy.





I love Brio! We come here all the time and are never disappointed. The happy hour is amazing, great options for food and drinks. The other night we had the brushetta Quattro, an all time favorite, minestrone soup, Caesar salad and tomato caprese. The bartenders are great, Larry and Brendan always take care of us. Chef Mike and the manager Kayla stopped by to see how everything was, definitely appreciated. Rarely does the manager AND chef stop by the table at other restaurants! The customer service is on point here and the food always exceeds expectations. I will be a Brio fan for life!





Happy hour is a killer time here at Brio.  Not only do they have happy hour, but they have reverse happy hour!  I came in for 50% Ravioli, and I found out about some awesome Happy Hour prices of grand total of $3 per appetizer.  1 or 2 appetizers, you are good to go.  I highly recommend the Lobster Ravioli.  It had a spicy flavor with the right amount of sauce and cream.  The lobster inside felt like I was in heaven!

My only complaint of the night that does not give this great place a 5 star is that service was quite slow.  It could have been because of the many patrons during happy hour, but there was not as much detail and attention.

If you are looking for authentic tasting food as though you were in Tuscany, Brio is the place to go.





I have eaten hear previously and the food was good except for the last two times. 

We had reservations for dinner as it was Mother's Day. Our waiter was great . Appetizers were good we had brochette sampler . We ordered two orders of the fettuccine with shrimp and lobster and shrimp and lobster risotto. Also the six ounce filet. 
The Pasta in one of the entree's had been left sitting and was cold and rubbery looking ,as the person eating it is a manager in a restaurant she was not happy.The lobster in all three pasta dishes was mushy . Therefore none of us ate the pasta. Mothers day dinner was bread and appetizers. The steak was also burnt. 
The manager took all off the pasta dishes and apologized but that did not make up for not having  dinner.





We got in here without a 50 minute wait that was the option at True Food, which is our go-to place in the Q.
The service was excellent and the waitress got me a nice cushioned chair from inside that made me comfortable.
The starter was very good, Bruschetta Quattro, or something like that. But I had the Mediterranean Pasta which was just blah! My wife had Salmon salad which was OK but nothing special. I was tasting my dish and just thought that nothing stood out at all. I do not use dressing or flavoring so it was just not tasty food.
I guess we will stick to True Food, it has a long wait for a reason.





Outstanding service by Chase. Truly exception for our group of six adults and 2 tired kids. 

The atmosphere is comfortable and food was tasty, as always at Brio. We had the Gorgonzola beef medallions, 5oz filet, pasta far diabolical with chicken and chicken Milanese. Several substitutions (fries for mashed, etc) and no problems at all. 

Service was quick and friendly. Food was hot. Overall a great experience for a family on vacation. It was my sister in law's birthday and it was the perfect place for a nice evening. The free app with Yelp check in is also a nice perk. 

With the free app, Chase made several recommendations and adjusted it to our needs. We ended up with the bruschetta sampler with 4 steak and 4 roasted red pepper. Omitting the ones with bacon. 

I highly recommend this location.





The Risotto duo was GREAT...one was lobster one was scallops....beautiful presentation and both were delicious





My review is for the Happy Hour. This place is packed for happy hour basically every day. Recently, my wife and I were lucky enough to score a table on the patio. The restaurant, bar and patio are beautiful. The patio has plenty of umbrellas to keep the sun out of the eyes while you sip on some cold beverages. The service was courteous and prompt. I actually felt like a guest.

They have raised the prices on the happy hour bites from $3 to $4. We ordered a Brio Burger with cheese which was cut into fourths and it was huge. Not a bad tasting burger. The Picante Shrimp was excellent as well. The sausage and pepperoni flat bread was just ok for me. But last time, we only spent about 12 bucks for food plus whatever the drinks cost. And of course taxes and tip.

This is a great chill place with a lot of ambiance to hang out with friends for Happy Hour.





We came here on the 4th of July for dinner..  There were not many patrons which was great!   We sat right down and had Ashley as our server.  She was excellent. We had the burrata & ciabatta ap w/ a side of balsamic (free w/ Yelp checkin), double pork chop (beyond tender and moist), Milanese (great size), and the pasta pesto.  All of our food was very good, made exactly how we ordered w/ a few changes. I would definitely come back.





Cody was our waiter and we had amazing table side service. The meals were perfectly cooked and the bread was warm. We only wished we had room for dessert. Highly recommended as always. The "go to" for a great family dinner.





Brio Tuscan Grille is one of my favorite restaurants. So much so that I drive from Tucson to Scottsdale to go there. Their service is great, setting is fancy and food is perfect. They serve a loaf of bread and chips before the meal. I'm an east coaster who values good seafood and they have one of the best Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine I've had in Arizona. Their Lobster Bisque is also a favorite. Paired with their new zesty Watermelon Margarita. For dessert I order the chocolate cake that has fudge in the middle.





Tasty brunch / lunch of shrimp & grits with a perfectly poached egg. Our waiter Kelvin was very nice. He did great at keeping drinks full & was present as often as possible without being obnoxious. Overall great visit.





Brio has catered a few events that I have gone to in the last few years. Always fantastic food. But, I had never been in the restaurant itself before.
I came here with my  daughter for lunch. I was not hungry till the next morning.
There is lots of covered parking in the garage. Which is really nice for starters.
The restaurant itself is beautiful inside. You can eat on the patio or inside .
The hostess greeted us immediately  and gave us a wonderful booth.
I was drinking hot tea, but my daughter had a few cocktails. A Bellini which was frozen (a little different) but,she said it was good. Also a Basil gimlet, which she said was OK.
The food was really the best! I got Lobster Bisque soup which that alone was a full meal. Then I got crab cakes they came with vegetables. Wow, very tasty and more than I could eat. My daughter got a salad, and Pasta Pompadour with Eggplant.
Again way too much and she took most  of it to go.
Food was fantastic, service was very good.
Too bad it is so far away from me. But, I never mind driving. It is a win win day or night out here. Plus they play fabulous Italian music!





Very delicious food and the pricing is great too. We order their family bundles for delivery and there is always leftovers. It's really a great value considering the amount of food you get. The salads that come with are always fresh and never soggy. I also use the leftover bread that wasn't eaten at dinner and make French toast in the oven with it. Awesome service too.





Food was excellent!  Decor was fabulous! Would have given 5 stars but was a little bit noisy.  Will absolutely be going back.  Soon I hope!





Well it was off to Brio last night for "date" night!!!  

The last time we were at Brio was in September to celebrate our 16th Anniversary...yes consecutive years, and it was a great evening!  Last night, no so much.  In all the years we've been going to Brio, we have NEVER had such HORRIBLE service....ever!
The food was as amazing as it always is, but the terrible service completely overshadowed the tasty treats from the kitchen.  Our server stood and waited for us to finish sitting and before we could even open our napkins was asking for our drink order, not a good sign of things to come.  So I opted for water to come while we contemplated our cocktails.  So the water came, then nothing....nothing....no one....nada.  After about 10 minutes the server returned for our cocktail order.  The longest 10 minutes in history I'll admit.  So off to get the drinks....15 minutes later they arrived with the bread for the table...now mind you we'd been sitting alone at the table with no attention for 25 minutes now.  That is a lifetime for a restaurant that makes their money by turning tables.  When the drinks and bread arrived we opted to put in our dinner order, thinking we'd be in for a long bumpy night.  So we ordered, I ordered the Campanelle Carbonara, but with the Spicy Pepper Sauce from the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant Appetizer, as opposed to the traditional sauce.  The server said no problem, you want the Angel Hair Pasta with the Spicy Sauce, do you want to add Shrimp or Chicken???  Well the Campanelle Carbonara comes with Chicken, Spinach, Bacon, and Parmesan Cheese.  So I explained it is NOT Angel hair Pasta as the Campanelle is a 'trumpet' shaped pasta with curled edges.  He said "Oh you want the Lasagna Noodles".....!  Of course I just said ask the chef to prepare the entree as he usually would, BUT, substitute the sauces.  Glenn ordered the same, but with the traditional sauce.  We both opted for the wedge salad, and asked that our entrees not be fired until we were completed with our salad.  After all, we all know all the ingredients are pre-made, and just needed to be assembled and heated..  Whew...I felt...that was exhausting!  Then the salads arrived.  Ice cold, yummy...!  Now we are back on track.  Boy that salad does hit all the notes that take you back to your childhood.  Nothing is better than Ice Cold Iceberg Lettuce w/blue cheese dressing, bacon crumbles, and fresh shaved Parmesan cheese!!!  
Then it happened.....yes just as we thought, in order to speed up the process that started so slowly............our entrees arrive BEFORE we were even 1/2 way through our salads.  So there they sit...all beautiful, completed just as ordered...and no Lasagna Noodles, no Angel Hair Pasta...just the wonderfulness awaiting our forks.  But...yes...But, we'd not finished our salads.  By the time we did, our pasta was sad, cold, and looked like it had let us down.  It didn't, OUR SERVER DID....oh by the way were we EVER asked if we wanted anything else to drink???  You guessed it NO....were we EVER asked how our dinner was???  You guessed it NO... Now you're probably saying, 'why didn't you do something about it'?  We'd have loved to, but there was no one around...not even someone to fill our water glasses.  Only after we were finished with our sad, cold, entrees and had stacked all the dirty dishes in a pile on the edge of the table, did our server make an appearance to ask how our dinner is going??? Are you kidding me???  We just asked for the check.  Upon his return we presented him with the discount that Brio had sent us for being frequent diners, he took that and never returned.  After sitting there at an empty table, empty water glasses and nothing to look at but the crumbs left behind from the wonderful flat bread.  We placed cash on the table and left to try to reclaim our evening.  On the way out, Glenn finally spotted a manager and explained our evening and that it would be a VERY LONG time before we tried Brio again.  He, the manager, just stumbled over his words and said he wished he's known about our evening so he could have done something about it.  Well maybe if he'd been circulating on the floor as opposed to hanging out with the ever so cute hostess' he'd have known.  Do we still like Brio...YES...are we extremely disappointed with our service last night...YES.....





I am one who actually believes that spending money on pasta is stupid. But this is amazing! The best pasta ever! Had the Pasta Alla Vodka, so delicious! Will definitely be back!





Had lunch at BRIO today. Food was good as always. Unfortunately it was freezing inside the restaurant. We noticed that three large double doors were open to the outside patio where two guests were having lunch under two large space heaters. We asked our waitress, then the hostess and then the manager if they could close some or all the doors. We were advised that the fire code REQUIRED that all three doors remain open if there were any guests on the patio. Seemed strange. After more guests inside complained about the temperature (61 degrees) in the restaurant they closed one of the doors. Still freezing. Seems that the manager lied to us about the fire code or he broke it when he shut one of the doors. Does anyone know?

By the way as we left we noticed another restaurant next door where people were eating outside on their patio under heaters and none of their doors were open.





I came here with my dad.  I got a side salad to start which was delicious.  And I got the Chicken Limone as my entree.  It was so delicious!  My dad got the Fish Limone Pasta dish.  It was ok.  I think it would have been better if the fish was grilled or baked.  It was fried fish which made the already heavy dish even more heavier.  The only thing I didn't care for was my drink.  I got the tropical cosmo that was on happy hour.  The happy hour prices are unbelievable.  This was my first time here and I will definitely be back!





Brio Tuscan Grille is a chain of formula restaurants serving Northern Italian  inspired food, much like Maggianno's Little Italy  is a chain that serves more Southern Italian inspired food.

It has about 30 locations and is HQ in Ohio. There is another one in Gilbert, AZ.

The decor is sumptious and large, with high ceilings, dark woods, draped white cotton materials in archways and to the center of the dining room, with Tuscan marble color inspired motif in beiges and terra cota, and faux terra cota wall textures in golden orange hues.. 

The bar is a classic marble top with dark wood storage canopy overhead, and several booths where there is no wait. The dining room is very large, almost ballroom size. There is also a large patio for snowbirds to enjoy the Scottsdale winter weather. 

I-Pop plays incessently on the speakers. (I-Pop is Italian top 40s music, not the latest music player from Apple!)

The food is Tuscan inspired but has an American slant to many dishes and ingredients. And like Maggiano's, the dishes are HUGE!

I sat at the bar for lunch and ordered from the Primi portion of the menu (meaning first, or appetizers) a Beef Carpaccio ($9.95) and Spicy Pepper Shrimp on Grilled Eggplant ($9.95).  

They were served in long narrow oval dishes. The Carpaccio was in a plate about 18 inches long! Nice raw beef, covered with olive oil, capers, and a streak of Aioli. In the center was a stack of arugula in a nice, sweet, but light dressing, and served with 2 triangles of brittle cheese infused bread crackers.

The Shrimp came in a rich cream sauce, with each shrimp laying atop a breaded and grilled Melanzone, or eggplant wedge, with a healthy dose of black pepper throughout to spice it up. The flavors were great, but a little overdone in richness and peppers, and too oily in the eggplant. 

They serve fresh warm bread and herb seasoned cracker wedges with butter, complimentary. Iced tea was $2.50.

Service was very friendly, and professional. All staff wear white shirts and Ties, like you would find in most restaurants in Firenze, Italia..

This is a great place to bring family and friends in the beautiful new Scottsdale Quarter mall, which is still under construction and right across from the higher end Kierland Commons on North Scottsdale Road.





It was my first and last time at Brio. The service was disappointing and the waiter was not personable or attentive at all until he presented us with the bill. 
When I made the reservations, I notated it was my daughters 25th birthday. Obviously, no one read it so why bother putting down extra instructions?  No one said Happy birthday or offered a house dessert to celebrate the occasion. 
It took 15-20 minutes before we received water or bread on the table.
Drew, the waiter basically ignored us and spent a majority of his time telling the patrons in the booth next to us his life story. 
They ran out of fettuccine noodles and substituted spaghetti in the pasta dish we ordered at the same price. How does an Italian Resturant run out of pasta?
I choose to spend my money at the Mission in Scottsdale where the food is great and server Simone is superb!!





Ate at Brio last night for dinner and was very pleased with the meal.  We sat in the bar area and the atmosphere was comfortable, absolutely nothing to complain about the service, and the food was delicious.  I had the Lasagna which was served with a mixture of alfredo and red sauce.  It was seriously one of the best lasagna dishes I have had in a long time.  Loved the bread plate before the meal.  One thing that stood out on the service: I dropped a knife while eating, and by the time I was able to pick it up, a waiter was already at the table with a new knife and took the one I dropped.  It's the little things that make tipping feel like it was worth it!  The only thing keeping it from getting a higher rating is it did feel like a corporate restaurant.  In this case, that's probably not a bad thing because I would imagine the food and service remains very consistent.  Brio is definitely above average in both categories.





I have eaten at this wonderful and beautiful restaurant many times. Every time has been great! The service was fast, helpful and friendly. The atmosphere is comfortable and upscale. The food is well portioned, plated perfectly and tastes delectable. There is many selections and will have something for any ones taste buds. I would strongly recommend the bruchetta combination for an appetizer.





Consumption of Italian food is one of my favorite pastimes, and I've found Brio to be a pretty good spot to do that.  It's location within Scottsdale Quarter, which does not have the best parking situation, is really the only negative here.

I'm usually coming here for dinner, and most recently we treated ourselves to a bruschetta sampler plate as an appetizer.  It came with three different variations, three pieces each, and all were spectacular.  I especially like the mozzarella and red pepper.  The bread was crunchy and the mozzarella was pure deliciousness!

For my entree I went with the Lasagna Bolognese.  Portion size was great.  I find a lot of places usually skimp on the meat with these dishes, but this one had a lot, which was fantastic.  There was a little too much cream based sauce topped over it for me, but that is a relatively minor complaint.

All in all I've enjoyed every meal I've had here, and I'm sure I'll be back for more!





What a wonderful night we had at the Yelp event!  Fantastic food, bruschettas, homemade cocktails and delicious pastas and desserts.  We enjoyed ourselves to no end chatting with our friends and taking in the ambiance of such a unique place.





Came here for my brother's birthday last night. It was my first time and I heard good reviews so I was excited. The sourdough bread and crackers they brought out first were delicious. There's a Yelp check in offer for a free appetizer with purchase, so I ordered the roasted garlic artichoke and spinach dip. So yummy! It comes with a Parmesan flatbread. For my entree I got a Caesar salad and the Fettuccine Campania (fettuccine with spicy marinara, capers, kalamata olives, basil and parmesan). Really good! I normally don't like pasta but this was an exception. I didn't like the salad, too much dressing and cheese. My brother got a mini dessert, key lime pie. Yum. It was great overall. I loved the nice decor and the bathrooms are swanky and smelled good. They have a private dining area and a type of sunroom with a fireplace.





Great calamari & lava cake!  Mediocre service, entrees were served cool-warm.  Think our server couldn't handle all of clientele.





Normally Brio is great, you know what your getting but the time I went to this location it was sloppy. Everything was thrown together as if the staff was anxiously waiting to get off and had checked out for the day.

The food was fine but no one was paying attention. We waited forever for a refill on the water, our burger came out at the wrong temp, we asked for sauce and small things on the side and they never came. Dissapointing Brio, step up your game !





Tonight was an utter failure. A Monday night - not a busy time for them.

I've held off on updating my review for several sub-par visits. But, tonight was the tipping point.

So, here's the deal:
Newer server: 3 stars - clearly a bit overwhelmed; took several minutes to greet us; was very polite; took the orders accurately; very slow to fulfill drink orders; one glass came with a huge lipstick stain on it; didn't put the entree orders in to the kitchen until after the appetizer was consumed; was slow to check back but was very visibly trying to handle his workload with other tables.

Kitchen staff: 0 stars - the steak appetizer was the shining star of the night; lasagna was brutally overcooked; chicken milenase was just average; creme brulee was curdled! Was the Monday Night Football game a distraction? The restaurant was not busy and I counted at least 8 staff on the kitchen side of the pass.

Prior, recent, visits: the crab cakes were a majority breading not crab meat. The flat bread pizza was disappointing. I had come to expect higher quality for the price that Brio commands.

Overall, I'm going with the 2 stars as the floor manager was, at least, apologetic. And, I think the server deserves a chance to get things figured out.

My final frustration was that it appeared that the management and staff wanted to place all the blame for this very sub-par experience on the (newer) server. It was his fault that he was slow to greet and slow to get beverages served. It wasn't his fault that the crew charged with getting serving ware clean let a glass with a huge lipstick stain get through unchecked. It wasn't his fault that the pasta in the lasagna was as hard as tanned leather. It wasn't his fault that the creme brulee had curdled (a comp'd item and still a blow-it!).

Folks, it's going to be a while before I think to come back. A shame, really. Brio was on my frequent dine-out list. Now, we'll take a pass until our out-of-town friends come back and just "have to" come here.





This place is one of the best places to hang out in North Scottsdale. Great wine, an awesome happy hour, and lots of tasty, healthy food to choose from. It has a classy, dressed up vibe, while being casual at the same time and not too expensive. Great value here and service is pretty darn good too





My family and I came here during brunch time so the menu was a little different than dinner and not as many options. We got the fish and chips, lobster bisque, pesto chicken club, bruschetta sampler, and calamari appetizer (this was free for checking in). The inside of the restaurant is really beautiful and the staff are all clean and professional looking. They give you bread and butter to start which is always nice! the calamari we got was pretty bland and disappointing because the calamari itself wasn't seasoned and came with marinara sauce on one side and a mayo based sauce on the other side which had a plastic taste to it for some reason. The bruschetta didn't seem to be too popular with the family and the size seemed a bit small for what it was. The pesto chicken club was pretty tasty, the chicken is pounded out thin and well seasoned. The fish and chips were pretty good too, decent size fish filets and crispy French fries. Our server was attentive and really good with filling our waters and clearing the crumbs off our table. Overall this place is just A-ok, but not a place I'd come back to for brunch/lunch.





We like Brio for lunch, dinner, or happy hour. We have more of a 4.5* rating, but are just a little reluctant to move it up to a 5*. We went tonight for Happy Hour. It was very crowded, in the middle of summer in Scottsdale. That alone says it is a very good place. The crispy shrimp is very good. We aren't a fan of fried foods, but make an exception for this dish. The buffalo chicken nachos are good. Brio uses their own cooked potato chips, which are very good, The potato skins are not traditional, they are quite different with a cream sauce and a minimal amount of bacon on them. We were very disappointed in the amount of bacon on the skins. The dishes are a nice small plate, but still ample enough for two people to effectively split. Perhaps the best feature of the Happy Hour menu is that it is not your standard bar offerings.  Well, the $5 good house wine ranks highly as does the Peach Sangria and Manhattan. For us sports fans, we wish they had larger and more TV's. But, they have to decide the crowd they want to attract.





Best happy hour in north Scottsdale! Get there early to beat the crowd. Amazing cuisine and atmosphere.





Edited review.  Long story short, I had an overall disappointing experience with Brio and thought that it may have just been an off night. The parent company contacted me in regard to my previous review and asked for a second chance. My wife and I took them up on their offer and enjoyed a wonderful meal, professional and friendly service, and an overall excellent experience.  If you have problem with your meal or service, bring it up with the manager (as I should have at the time) and I'm sure they will correct it. I'll definitely visit Brio again and now recommend it.





I am shocked to see any negative reviews. it is a beautiful restaurant in a great location with a to kill for happy hour. Food choices are creative, portions generous and delicious. service is friendly and attentive....they really have things together here!





Excellent service, AWESOME food, AMAZING Marian and Chef Gustavo! Very impressed with the hospitality and great food. 

My children loved this place. I would definitely come here again and highly recommend this restaurant!





The food here was good. I had the pork chops and vegetables. The chops were well done. My date had the lamb, which was excellent according to her. The noise level was a bit too much for an effective conversation. The restaurant is lovely but needs to be a more conversation-friendly.





The waiter that served us on a july 4 was the ideal person for the job ,they should be proud of him working there. Sorry for not knowing to mention his name.We got there late but he still made sure everything to be on the level . 
The food was realy good to. Starting from the tomato soup to the dishes that they had each theyre own different flavors and juicy not dry. The desserts where homemade and delicious also.
I will go back again.





Met a girlfriend for dinner here last night and had a great meal! I had the risotto with shrimp and lobster tail. Delish! It also had asparagus, mushrooms and red peppers. Service was spot on. My friend had grilled chicken with charred cauliflower. Also great. We skipped dessert but they all looked yummy.





Called and spoke to Crystal who was going to have her manager Brian contact me. I was looking for a place to do my co-workers retirement party. Never received a phone call back. This was going to be a party for 15+ people. Makes me laugh that they have all this money that they don't care enough to pick up the phone and call. Thank gosh for Maggiano's, they were awesome and excited to accommodate us. So if your looking for a professional place that can handle a big party. Maggiano's is your place.





My husband and I went in there for dinner this evening! We have dined into Brio a few times in the past. We love their food. The pasta vodka is my favorite! We had a wonderful experience, and great service too! We appreciated the manager stopping at our table to see how everything was. Very friendly environment! We will definitely be back to try the layer cake!





This place has a nice ambience and has a classy feel to it. We started our meal with a Calamari Fritto Misto which was delicious fried Calamari! They're bread was pretty special, one was made like a "pizza" shaped fried bread with spices on it.  We ordered a Lobster Bisque that was very tasty as well. My girlfriend ordered the Campanelle Carbonara which had grilled chicken, bacon, Parmesan cheese, spinach and Alfredo, it was done very well. I ordered the Pasta Mediterranean which had grilled chicken, mushrooms, feta cheese, spinach and tomatoes in it. So good! Definitely recommend this place!





Dear Brio,

After giving you such rave reviews back in 2009, you have kindly let me down in the most unexpected way. See I do understand that you do not take reservations for happy hour, and I totally respect that. However the fact that I came to give you a courtesy head's up that I was bringing around 40+ people over the three hour time spam for my birthday happy hour a week in advance and you kindly but adamantly let me know that you could not accommodate me left me speechless. Your friendly manager kindly explained that he did not want a "rowdy" group and that he wanted to keep everything orderly.  He let me know that no I could not hold two tables once I arrived and that my party would be seated separately as they came in to keep everything orderly. So no standing around and being unorderly, et al. Again the look on my face was priceless. Last I check I was almost 40 and my friends don't get "rowdy" but ok whatever. However I still had a friendly smile and thanked your manager for letting me know that in so many words he did not want my business and that I needed to find a new venue.

Yea hmm wow. No worries. I found another place that welcomed me with open arms for my birthday happy hour and they don't mind if we stand around and get a little "rowdy".  

Love,
Ebs





Brio has a great happy hour. It is only valid in the bar and patio area, but the weather is perfect to sit outside right now and it makes for great people watching. You can't go wrong with the Tuscan Tasters for $3.95 each. My favorite is the shrimp and eggplant. Best part of the meal was our waitress, Kimberly. She was so personable and had great recommendations on everything from which Sangria to chose to dipping the hamburger in the sauce that comes with the shrimp and eggplant. We will definitely be back.. And will request Kimberly.





I must admit, I had high hopes for this place... and given the posh, upscale atmosphere, I was ready to be wowed. The only "wow" I had, however, was at how disappointed I was.

The food was far from spectacular; my Caesar salad had very little flavor (even for a Caesar salad,) and my eggplant pomodoro had just barely enough sauce to get some with each bite. The flavor on this, as well, was somewhat lacking. The spaghettini which came with it, however, was well presented and had a nice fresh flavor.

Then, of course, there was the service. I would highly recommend NOT going here for a quick lunch. We ended up being there for nearly two hours, 30 minutes of which was waiting for our check. In addition, the server was rather brusque when my friend asked for recommendations.

Overall, definitely not impressed. For as lavish as the decor is, and given the prices on the menu, I was expecting far better. Most certainly not recommended.





Fantastic Happy Hour! The Caprese salad is to die for. I've only been here for happy hour but what I've experienced service-wise is top notch. Will definitely be bringing friends so they can be wowed too!





My boyfriend and I came here for the first time for our anniversary, and I was definitely impressed. Coming from New York, I've always been really picky about Italian food. But Brio nailed it! I got the pasta with vodka sauce, and I couldn't get enough of it. For dessert we got a creme brle, which was also delicious, and our drinks were great as well. I wish we still had a Brio in Tucson! Will definitely be back :)





Just went there tonight, it was great, chic restaurant, great service.
The Veal was really good but the dessert part was the best, had the Tiramisu, just wished the portion was a bit bigger but it was probably the best Tiramisu I've ever had.

Also, if you're planning to get the whole roasted chicken, beware, it is a WHOLE chicken but very good though.





We wanted to like this place but sadly could not.  Although customer service was good, the food was not.  I had the Pesto Pasta, which was more soup like.  I was later told that the pesto sauce is made with chicken broth.  My husband had the carbonara, which was bland, like bacon bits boiled in a cream sauce. Needless to say, we will not be back.  The place was the "Applebees" of italian cuisine.





Have been to a Brio before and remembered it to be very good but no such luck last night. I had the Chicken Limon and we also had a double Pork Chop. The Chicken was dry, did not have any of the saut sauce as would be usual, and had very little flavor. The vegetables it was served with were inedible. No idea what was wrong with them but bitter and terrible tasting. My partner only ate 1 of the 2 pork chops as he said that was not good either. Disappointing. The bread was good, the server was very nice and attentive ... only positives ... ahh well.





had a drink at the bar. fairly priced.  dinner was very good.  ate here last year when we were in town and enjoyed that visit too.  highly recommend





Understated Classy for a corporate chain. Menu is meat heavy but at least they have calorie counts to let you know and a sub-600 section.  Chicken limone was a standout,  especially with angel hair instead of potato.  Desserts were very reasonable in price and size.  Wine list is very accessible with the sustainable IL putto a bargain. Service was great and the Table fly-by chef Jimmy was a nice touch.  Recommend





I really love brio and have been coming here mug too often lately. Their food is always good.. lunch, dinner or weekend. Ranch.. yes they served brunch, who would have thought. My favorite is their happy hour, you can be sealed anywhere and don't have to fight over a chair in the bar like typical places, you can actually bring the whole family and enjoy the great food at reasonable prices.





Brio Tuscan Grill offers great food selections which are very tasty and is itself a fun place to eat!

We have come here many times and have really grown to enjoy their late-Lunch menu, along with their Happy Hour in the bar area.  We have found that they come by often and refill glasses without being asking and will give you a brief update on how long it will be before your main item is served.  It is these little things which make me give them Five Stars; that and the great tasting food.

Brio has recently updated their Lunch menu to included most items for $7.95, while the HH is a flat $2.95 per item, all very good.

Like most restaurants their Wait staff is very attentive mostly until it starts to get crowded.   I'm sure most restaurants do poorly at 6pm on a Friday night, but I've learned either to go slightly early or go late so to avoid the nonsense of the dinner rush.

Enjoy!





What a great experience we had at lunch today at Brio Tuscan Grill at Scottsdale Quarter. Our server Scott was very professional and service was great. It was extra special when the Executive Chef Joe Milbert came to see if we were satisfied with our meal and if we needed anything. Bravo for Brio. Recommending to my friends to frequent this establishment.





Good was very average . Mines was actually cold but this is not the reason for the 3 stars only . I just don't see the hype at all for this place . Wasn't bad at all . Wouldn't return though . Just my opinion





The bartenders rock!! Brandon, Mike, and Christine rules. They always remember their customers. That's best of the best.  Also those flax crackers are unreal. One of the waitstaff always keeps me loaded.





My golfing buddies and I were starving when we arrived.  The waitress was bright and cheery.  We ordered the calamari appetizer and surveyed the wine list.  We ordered the wine and our entrees.   The waitress returned with our wine.  She said the calamari was coming and left.  Then, the servers brought our entrees.  Still no appetizer.  The waitress apologized and offered to get it, but we told her not to.  I had the Pasta Brio--excellent.  More than I could eat.  The other guys were very pleased with their meals as well.  We finished our meals and received the check.  We were charged for the appetizer.  

Summary:  Nice decor.  Good dining atmosphere.  Cheery but poor service.  Very good food.  I've eaten at Brio a number of times (in Birmingham) and have never been disappointed.  Highly recommended





LOVE THIS PLACE! I was introduced to them because of a Yelp event held there recently but I loved it. The patio front and side are awesome. Now that the weather is getting a little cooler here - I can't wait to go there and participate in one of my all-time favorite pastimes ... drinks on the patio! It's a perfect venue. The parking garage is right across from the entrance. So easy! Oh, and the food was wonderful as well :)





My husband and I first ate at brio Tuscan grille in Las Vegas for our wedding reception. Today we are celebrating our wedding anniversary at the scottsdale brio Tuscan grille. The food was great as usual but the service was even better. Our server was Aaron. He was very attentive, answered all our questions and was constantly checking up on our needs. Aaron at brio Tuscan grille was awesome made the whole experience even better. ..





This is a sad story of a restaurant that when first open had great food, service and prices.  Unfortunately, I have seen the prices go up and everything else go down hill.  I hadn't been there in some time because I was not impressed with the last few times I had been.  But, as someone who goes out to dinner several times a week, I thought I would give it a try.  I ordered the salmon and could not believe what a small portion it was, but even sadder was when you flipped it over it was char BLACK on one side!!!  The waiter did take it back but it should have never been served and how awkward is it for the other people at the table to eat their food???  Don't think they will see me again!





We went to this location on Christmas Eve we were celebrating our anniversary. Everything was good but later that evening I got really sick! Violently sick! My husband called and told them but we have not got any kind of response back! I would not recommend going there!





Had a nice lunch there--love the bread basket, as so few places do that anymore. Had the chicken and wild rice orzo salad. It was a huge portion and was like something I could make at home. The service was a bit slow. They gave my salad to someone else, so I had to wait. Should have comped my iced tea for the extra wait. I would go back again, but I think it is pricey for what you get. The salad is about $13--$11 would be more fair.





Salmon dish is fantastic!  Every time I've been there the service is great and the food excellent. Decided to have a bridal shower there and the service was the best . Have not experienced that friendliness and help in a long time. The manager was great and very accommodating.  Would definitely do it there again.





Yuck!    Yet another corporate crap restaurant comes to Scottsdale.   

No better than any other chain joint, where it seems the primary ingrediant in any dish is salt.

Save your money and fix a nice dinner for yourself at home with a good bottle of wine and you'll be happier for it.





We frequently come here for happy hours. Not exactly healthy, but very tasty and a terrific deal. Not one to rest on the laurels, they rotate their menu frequently and we are always pleasantly surprised to see their new offerings. The black pepper shrimp and eggplant is a must have -- we usually order two of them!





I had a fabulous time bringing my mother here for the first time for lunch. She absolutely loved the ricotta filled pasta. I ended up eating off her plate it was so delicious! The service was great, we didn't have to wait long at all for our food. The second time I took my boss here we ended up sitting in the bar area because it was crowded. Unfortunately the service was sub par and irritatingly slow. The very very tan gentleman just.... didn't.... get... it. He took forever and a day to get items we asked for and he took even longer to get our bill. He only had to handle 3 tables. Luckily the food was great or I would have to knock the place down another star.





Absolutely my new favorite place! Just had my bridal shower there! Matthew was  great and also was Kimberly!!! Outstanding service! Exceeded my expectations!! Food was also out of the world!! Everyone was so pleased and they were beyond accommodating! Thanks guys! You're the best!!





WOW, they sat us on time and  the food was very fresh, cooked perfectly  and tasted great and the decor made us feel like we were in Tuscany. 
My wife and I called them Saturday around noon and made a reservation for 7:45 as we were taking some friends out for their birthday. we showed up at 7:15 to try their wine before hand. When we got there they were telling people that there was over an hour wait. However, they sat us right on time.  The wine selection was limited however, everything we tasted was excellent. The two slight negatives for us personally are that they serve Pepsi instead of Coke and I don't like Pepsi and because it was so busy, it was rather noisy which made it hard to carrying a conversation. I RECOMMEND THIS PLACE and cant wait to go back.





I thought I would try Brio again during Arizona Restaurant Week to see if anything improved from my first visit.  Again,  the service was not what one would expect for this establishment.  Our drink glasses went empty and nobody noticed. I had to ask for more.  Usually, restaurants with these price points are more concerned about keeping drink glasses full. Some of the time it felt like we were on auto pilot.  I was trying to get some balsamic and olive oil for my bread.  It took awhile for the server to come back to check on out table.  The kitchen runners just drop and run.  Also, I noticed some flies in the dining room and a lady at the nearby table stood up to swat at flies.  She asked me if I noticed the flies and if I was having any trouble with flies.  There is nothing like swating flies and trying to keep them out of your dinner.  There were some very frustrating circumstances about dining here tonight.





This was our first time trying brio and it was exceptional. The service and the food was amazing! Our server Jessica was very sweet and was able to recommend great dishes. We had a little bit of everything! The lobster bisque, spicy shrimp and eggplant, and lump crab cakes were delicious and the chocolate lava and cheese cake desserts were to die for! Definitely going back!





I work nearby and this restaurant never disappoints!! Also quick service, great quality meals and reasonably priced!! Staff is always friendly and professional!! Favorite is the Kale Salad or the Lobster Bisque!! It's a wonderful place to enjoy a relaxing meal as your shopping at the Quarter!!





This is one of my usual happy hour spots when I need a good drink and some good food. Came tonight expecting their $2.95 small bites menu and found a brand new HH menu :/ the prices are a bit higher but some portions are bigger than before. I ordered two strawberry mojitos (Yum! One of the few places that carries Cruzan Strawberry Rum) and toasted Ravioli. The BF got a Keylime mojito, a Manhattan (aka Bourbon on the rocks, or that's how it tasted lol) and the Brio Burger. Food and drinks were great and service was quick since we sat at the bar. Only downside was the higher prices - our bill came out to around $36 for happy hour - for two apps and four drinks....might not seem so bad, but I think we were just used to the old menu and prices. Oh well that's Scottsdale for you! :)





A very nice restaurant. If you ever wonder about a good appetizer you've got to try the Spicy Shrimp & Eggplant is hands down the best appetizer there!!!
It is a little spicy because if the pepper, but it is delicious! I think that the eggplant just adds an amazing flavor to it and your palate will thank you. Try it and thank me later





The food here is fantastic. My wife and I eat here on a regular basis because the quality of the experience has always been so high.

The atmosphere is comfortable, and family friendly even though there is a bar off of the entrance. I would never come here with out a reservation though in the evenings because the wait times are always at least 30 minutes.

The restaurant seems to train their help well since the service levels are high being attentive to its patrons without being annoying.

I highly recommend.





We came here to celebrate my "last fling before the ring!"  Not only was the food fanastic, but without us even requesting, they put us in a private area away from the rest of the diners and gave us a wonderful server, Danny, who took care of everything we could possibly need.  It was a great way to spend my bachelorette weekend with all my of closest friends!





Visiting Scottsdale with my girlfriend and went to Brio for dinner. Had the pleasure of meeting Chef Jeffrey Perin, who gave us some fantastic recommendations. We started with the Bruschetta Quattro, a nice sample of their house-made bruschetta. We then moved onto the Fennel Sausage & Roasted Tomato Trecce Pasta, which was very flavorful and satisfying. Next, we enjoyed the 14 oz Gorgonzola crusted Bistecca, which was outstanding. The meal ended on a sweet note with a petite, peanut butter & chocolate mousse. All in all, it was a great experience and a delicious meal! Next time we're in town, we will definitely return.





This was my first time at Brio. Came with a few friends and Ashley was my server! She recommended the Strawberry Fresca and it is my new favorite drink! She was so knowledgeable about the menu. She recommended a few items for me and I decided on the Gorgonzola crusted beef medallions. It was DELICIOUS! Ashley was so warm and welcoming and really made my experience at Brio special. I will definitely be coming back!





What a great experience we had at lunch today at Brio Tuscan Grill at Scottsdale Quarter. Our server Scott was very professional and service was great. It was extra special when the Executive Chef Joe Milbert came to see if we were satisfied with our meal and if we needed anything. Bravo for Brio. Recommending to my friends to frequent this establishment.





Jessica made our 8 person party so comfortable with the fine menu items we had.  Pork chops were excellent, appetizers superb in a beautiful setting.  Cream spinach/kale were fab.  Will do again and highly recommend.





This is one of my favorite places for Happy Hour. I have tried everything on the menu and it is fabulous! I love sitting outside on the patio too so it has a great ambience too! Love this place and have brought friends here that enjoyed themselves too!





What has happened to this place? My husband and I went there Sunday afternoon...no  body greeted us or told be right there. I wish I would of left then...the place was dirty...no covers on electrical outlets, no tablecloth on our table...but other tables had them. The cooks looked so unprofessional with their backwards baseball caps on. The filters above the kitchen were laden with grease and dust. The food was lukewarm, but cold in spots. No flavor at all. Had to ask over and over for cream for lukewarm coffee. We used to really enjoy this place, the food was amazing...I should of went to Denny's...better food, service and quality





My girlfriends continue to like the happy hour expecially the black pepper shrimp. Just awesome! My husband likes the special lasagna night when its half price. But, if you want to know my favorite, it's Thomas K!!! He knows how to treat a woman like a princess! ! Food can take you only so far. Am I right?





This review is about the service and not the food. Today, I took 2 out of town (business) guests to the Brio for lunch. On arrival , we (three older ladies) were seated promptly; the restaurant was not very busy and perhaps, this  is why our male server turned out to be a bit overbearing as he did not have enough tables to attend to. 
As soon as we sat down and, without a second to spare, were asked what drinks we wanted. We ordered our drinks and during our conversation browsed the menu. He asked if we had been there before and explained the menu?  He must have mentioned 'desserts' at least 5 - 6  times before, during and after placing our orders so much so, I asked towards the end of the meal, if he likes desserts. He said yes he likes sweet things! Meals were brought out promptly - perhaps too quickly as, before we had time to finish our appetizers our entrees were brought to the table; however, I continued to enjoy my first course (Brio salad - which was nice.) My guests, as well, continued to eat their appetizers. But then, the server came to the table and said: "eat your entree now as it would get cold. The salad is already cold so you  can eat it afterwards."  Really?  I told him I was enjoying my salad and, will have my entree afterwards. My guests were taken aback by his comment and tone.  I should have added that our 2nd courses should not have been brought out so quickly but did not; and, he mentioned 'desserts' again. Yes, tour entrees were not as warm but, we ate it without complaints. Then, whilst I was still eating, he came over to my guests, asked if she were finished and took her  plate away and said: I see you enjoyed your meal as you cleaned your plate. (Not good.) I, and my other guest continued to eat, then, he came back wanting to clear the the table - I was still trying to enjoy my wine and eat - we were not quite finished but, he took the plates away anyway and, mentioned desserts again. We skipped dessert! I should add that, on the other side of the room, there were two diners who clearly had finished eating before we arrived and they were still there when we left.  One of my pet peeves is having servers rush to take away cutlery/plates/bring the bill when one is still eating. The restaurant was not busy so, they were not short of tables; he brought the bill, I gave my cc , he brought it back for my signature. Then, less than 2 minutes he came over and said, can I take this whilst reaching over to grab the (payment) folder. I was still trying to enjoy my glass of wine by the way. I am the one - not the server - who had to ask the ladies if they wanted anything  else to drink/coffee Overall, the experience was not relaxed as we felt rushed - as if they wanted to close shop. This server acted too familiar and was a bit too intrusive . This was meant to be a leisurely (business) lunch, and not a sit down, order, and eat up quickly - but order desserts- and pay up...quickly. This review is from a well traveled individual who as dined at (too) many restaurants here in the US and internationally and, has only given 1 other negative review in over 30 plus years. Today, I  met these guests  for the first time, and suggested Brio for lunch; but, after leaving the restaurant, they said they felt uncomfortable as if " they wanted us out of there" quickly. I had to apologize to these ladies and said that I had been to this restaurant before but service was better.





NOTE: This is  not a 'walk to' restaurant if you are cruising Kierland....hopefully someone will think of building a pedestrian bridge from Kierland.
A Tuscan feel upon entering - to me if smelled of crusty bread too!!

I think the restaurant had only been opened a few days - so everything was quite new - including the service staff. No worries there.

We stopped in for a quick lunch - they had a great selection of salads - good portion sizes!.
Will be back.





I work nearby and this restaurant never disappoints!! Also quick service, great quality meals and reasonably priced!! Staff is always friendly and professional!! Favorite is the Kale Salad or the Lobster Bisque!! It's a wonderful place to enjoy a relaxing meal as your shopping at the Quarter!!





I work nearby and this restaurant never disappoints!! Also quick service, great quality meals and reasonably priced!! Staff is always friendly and professional!! Favorite is the Kale Salad or the Lobster Bisque!! It's a wonderful place to enjoy a relaxing meal as your shopping at the Quarter!!





Great location, reasonable prices and impressive decor BUT mediocre food. We celebrated our anniversary there and are fortunately still married. A typical chain...won't be on our revisit list.

Update (9/20): met a friend there for Happy Hour because it was convenient...how bad could their appetizers be...they were! In fact, when the waiter acknowledge that receiving only 2 out of the 3 appetizers that we ordered was "not bad", we knew that our expectations (fair at best)  were met. 

NEVER AGAIN!





Ate here for the first time. The 3 of us had the salad with steak on top and it was fantastic. The lettuce was fresh and the steak was a nice cut and cooked med-rare. The portion was large enough for 2 but I pigged out. All in all a great stop for lunch and not very crowded on a Tuesday afternoon.





I had high hopes of decent Italian food here.  The decor is beutiful, easy parking etc.   But OMG,  this is garbage.  I had Veal Marsala with a side of linguini in aurora(pink) sauce.  So awful, I returned the dinner for a refund.
I eat this same dish made by Italians in my small town and I have eaten this same dish worldwide.   Unedible.  Marsal sauce tasted like the brown sauce on a beef dish from the age of hot airplane food.  the linguini sauce was so awful.  I am not sure this corporate restaurant chain even has a clue about italian food.





I've been to Brio 2x in the last month.  My first time was because I had a gift card.  The second time was on my but obviously enjoyed it enough the first time to return!

This place is busy right up until 10PM on weekends so call ahead and make a reservation.

Very neat ambiance.  Reminds me of the Venetian in Vegas.  Upscale and wide open so the noise level is slightly above average.

The food....  Yummy as can be!  I'm one who counts carbs so why am I going to an Italian restaurant?  The salmon is to die for.  The steaks are to die for.  Even the salads are yummy.

Service is average to a bit above.  Bottom line is that this is not the place to go to if in a hurry.  Great for a group.





went there for dinner last night, Feb 27. Definitely wasn't bad, but for the price, wasn't great either. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and in a great location of Scottsdale, nice for walking around after dinner. Waitress came to the table and offered us drinks. I asked about the beer and whether it came in 12 and or 16 oz glasses, she said only one size, a pint, OK fine and how much are the beers, she didn't know, really? I ordered the chicken pesto, presentation was very nice, chicken was dry. There are tons of restaurants in the Phoenix area and this is not one I would go back to





Oh goodness, where to start! We had an amazing waiter, Adrian, who started with wonderful manners and suggestions. Now the food-10/10!! My mother and I shared a pasta alla vodka (best pasta I've ever had, I promise), and my brother and father had 14 oz steaks that were not only perfectly charred, juicy and medium, but the veggies and potatoes were also seasoned quite well! I am so absolutely happy to have come to this place with my family; trs bonne!





Walking into Brio is like walking into some kind of palace. 
Its highly ornate decor, combined with the well dressed staff make me feel like royalty.

Princely, I order, with a quick hand gesture shooing my waiter when finished. I'm in full character now. 
All further communication with my server will be hand gestures, either kissing the fingers on one hand to signal bravo, or the back of my palm in a waving, dismissive manner.

I do neither.
Instead, I enter into a vegetative state, still in shock from seeing the shallow little bowl of Pasta E Fagioli they just served up. 
Then I taste it. 
That's when I wish they would have assigned me a royal taste tester to make certain an unruly chef wasn't trying to poison his magnate. 

I get through the soup, but I'm still unable to speak for fear the next thing out of my mouth will be "Off with his head!"

I've learned the hard way it's not pc to invoke the term 'head' when on a date, and in such palatial surroundings.





Still a solid 4 star performer.

I forgot to check in the last 2 times I was here. Silly me. I checked in last night and discovered an awesome check in deal. A free app! I don't know how long they've had this offer but it is a great deal and the app - steak bruschetta was excellently prepared, nicely plated and yummy.

Service was excellent, as always.

Crab cakes were very well done. The quantity is a bit lacking for the price.

Special for the night was sea bass. Again, nicely plated. Quantity was decent for the price. The fish was cooked well. Maybe just a touch over cooked. I wouldn't order again as there was a bit too much of a fishy-taste to it for my liking. Yes, I know it's fish. But, very fresh fish, prepared correctly - unless it's an oily fish (salmon) - doesn't usually leave one with a fish after-taste.

Dessert was their flourless chocolate cake. Oh yeah! Not cheap at around $7 per serving but it was a chocolate lover's dream.





I was pleasantly surprised by brio and found most everything there to be above my expectations. We went on a Monday night during restaurant week a little later in the evening, around 8 o'clock as I didn't get off work as early as I would have liked. So brio was close to home and felt a bit on the safe side. I guess my expectations were somewhat low because it's Italian food and most Italian chains aren't known for their quality.  We sat in the dining room because it felt like there was more atmosphere than there was on the patio. Our table was great, like a private booth with barrier walls on each side. The ceilings are high and chad and I were both reminded of Vegas when we sat down. Our server, Jonathan, was wonderful. Funny and attentive without being intrusive. We both had the bruschetta samplers to start and chad really enjoyed it but to be honest I was less than impressed. I mean, I ate it all and it was by no means bad, I just didn't love it. The bread wasn't crispy as is customary with bruschetta, it was just cold, but I just assumed this is how it's done here. Also I had no idea what I was eating. I should have held onto the paper. For entrees, chad had the filet and I had the lobster and shrimp ravioli. Chads filet was wonderful, even though he omitted the Gorgonzola cheese. Cooked to perfection and tasted fresh. I thoroughly enjoyed my pasta dish. And it was huge! Once again we both gobbled our entire meal right up. On board for dessert was a creme brle for me and caramel cheesecake for chad. Once again those were gone in a matter on minutes. 
Brio really has the feel of a grand ballroom and I enjoyed the atmosphere immensely. Overall the food was good and tasted fresh, which isn't often the case with Italian food. Even the bread at the beginning of the meal was good. And for restaurant week they offered a glass of house wine with the meal that was a nice added, and appreciated, touch. However, no Vegas style Italian restaurant would be complete without a little bit of tacky. The paper on top of the table clothes? Saves on laundering costs I supposed. And the way the plates say "brio!" across the top...? Just in case we forgot where we were. 
I would definitely come back again for restaurant week or some other offer, but I honestly can't see myself going out of my way to come here. Good experience but nothing super special.





Ordered the Mezza Chicken Limone, and it basically was coated with an omelette. It was supposed to be a piccata, but instead of an egg wash and flour dipped chicken, it was coated in a thick layer of scrambled egg. Sent it back but was given the same again. 

I'm a big fan of piccata, and have ordered the same dish here before, but sadly they've forgotten how to make it. 

I googled an image of this dish to verify how it should be made, and there are loads of Brio images that don't include the coating of omelette. 

I'm now left disappointed and with a rumbly tumbly.





Have eaten here many times for several years with my lunch group and always a good experience. No one has ever been unhappy with the food. Service can be spotty from excellent to slow even when the restaurant has few patrons it can be very slow. Parking is the one stumbling block so we all tend to avoid when the snowbirds are here. Shopping at the Quarter is difficult if you will need to go back and forth to your car since there is only garage parking, one way in and out.





Just ate at Brio at the Scottsdale Quarter location. We love the food - my favorite is the steak salad - but the service is slow. Turnover seems to be high - we've had a different wait staff each time we've been here - and the training is lacking. My waiter tried to take my plate away before I was done eating and didn't even ask if I was done. We waited forever for our food and forever to get our check. On the way out, our waiter actually cut me off and stood in the way to pour a glass of wine for someone else. It was quite a disappointing evening.





Went here with the family while checking out Scottsdale Quarter. Food was great. Service was good. Only thing lacking was selection of draft beer.





Before heading off to the iPIC theater, we decided to have dinner there because it was 6 PM on a Saturday and it was busy, but we were able to get a table for 4. 
The place reminds you have Cheesecake Factory or Cafe Lux, but the prices are a tad bit higher.
From the time we sat down to the time we left, it was a great dining experience. The waiter made us feel at home. he made sure our water glasses were full. 
As for the food, my wife had the crab and shrimp cakes and said it was the BEST she has EVER had.  I had the Grilled Shrimp with Orzo which was excellent. Presentation was beautiful and the dish had lots of flavor with the right amount of heat. Our friends shared the Grilled Salmon dish which was wonderful. 
The manager stopped by to see how everything was and chatted with us for a few minutes.
When we departed at 7:15 PM, there was a crowd at the door waiting for tables. I definitely will be back.





BEST. ITALIAN. FOOD. HANDS. DOWN. Had a delightful experience of Brio catering to my club's recent luncheon. The food arrived on time and the presentation exceeded our expectations. Yummy yummy. We will be sure to have it again. Shout out to Brian for helping with our needs and being so accommodating on a short notice.





I cannot believe I haven't done a review on this place. I have been to this location as well as the one out in San Tan Village.  I came to an happy hour here and let me tell you, there $2.95 happy hour appetizers were yummy. The portions were huge as well. There were about 7 of us and we ordered the calamari, the crabcakes, spinach and artichoke dip and the Beef Carpaccio. All of them were quite good. I love me some calamari and when it is made just right like this order was, it takes everything in me not to eat it all! We also ordered a few bottles of wine and for the life of me, I cannot remember what they were but they were good bottles of red. A friend of ours picked up our tab which was especially sweet. (Thanks Frankie!)





Finally went to Brio today, for lunch.

First thing I said when we walked in, "are they owned by Cheesecake Factory?"  The atmosphere is Cheesecake Factory-esque, with a Tuscan flare.

The menu is pretty big, nothing really stood out to me on it though.  Their brunch menu items looked like they had some potential but I was not in a brunch mood unfortunately.  Had the Lobster bisque to start, pretty good, but I've had better.  (The Lobster Bisque at Ocean Club REALLY spoils you.....lol)  Sister had the Beef Carpaccio appetizer...which was HUGE.  It's a huge, long plate of thinly sliced carpaccio with a small bunch of mixed greens in the center...it was pretty good, but nothing that I went crazy over.

Had the Pasta alla Vodka for entree and again, pretty good but nothing amazing.  They are little ricotta filled pasta purses (don't know the technical pasta name for them, so that's how I'd best describe them!), in a delicious tomato/parmesan/vodka sauce with smoked bacon.  Very tasty, but not life changing.

Food wise, it kinda reminded me of an Olive Garden, but a little more upmarket.  Maybe if Olive Garden made love to a Cheescake Factory....you'd end up with a Brio Tuscan Grille?





Been there twice for dinner and both times were good. Big open room which gets kind of noisy, but it's a fun place. This is a chain, somewhere between Carabas and Maggianos. I tend to get the veal piccata type of dish at Italian places as a measure, and the veal here was very good. the wines were reasonable, waitstaff attentive, food was good. I looked over at my friend's lasagna and it looked gooey, sloppy, whatever to me. He enjoyed it. The prices were reasonable enough to put Brio on the list for a night out during the week.





Just had another great meal at Brio Tuscan Grille in North Scottsdale. My wife is recovering from recent foot surgery and I wanted to pick up her spirits a little and I hit a home run tonight by taking her to her favorite restaurant; Brio. The food was outstanding, the pace was perfect and the service was exceptional. Hats off to Steve and Vinnie and Monique for making our evening perfect. We will definitely be back.





We visited Brio Tuscan Grille about 20 times. I always enjoy the steak salad, lamb chops and my 6 year old grandson  loves the lobster bisque soup.





Best Tuscan restaurant I have ever been to! I had the gluten free pasta and it was very good. I normally can't eat pasta at restaurants due to my gluten and dairy allergies but the Brio staff were very accommodating and knew exactly what I could have. I didn't have to sacrifice flavor for a stomach ache, and that is a rare occurrence. Not only was the food excellent but the staff were delightful and very fast. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Scottsdale!





This place is probably one our (new) favorite Italian food places. Prices are a little high, but the service, food, and atmosphere are terrific. Last time we went, my wife's steak was overdone, and they cooked us a new one no problem, and the manager came by and apologized and bought us desert. Overall they were very friendly, and the food (and chocolate cake) were amazing!





Love the environment and set-up. Trendy with a bit of class. I had there egg plant apetizer and it was amazing! The sauce was great!





I have eaten at Brio's on several occasions in the past and have always found the food and service to be very good. On our visit last week, however, I found the experience to be exceptional.  I ordered the Carbonara  and it had to be one of the best I have had.  The dish included fresh spinach and chicken, delicious.  In addition, the service provided by Ashley was excellent.





I don't usually like to rate chain restaurants but Brio was pretty darn good.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The pasta dishes were very good with large poritons.  I really don't have anything bad to say about this place.  Everyone seems to be mentioning the happy hour.  I'll have to come back to try that!





This has now become my favorite place for happy hour! The food choices are amazing and affordable, and the portion size does not go smaller due to happy hour. We shared an amazing shrimp and eggplant dish, margarita cheesy dip with beef salad. I enjoyed the French Gimlet cocktail that consisted of pineapple infused vodka (made on site), St. Germaine, lime juice, and simple syrup infused cucumber = $6.00. A very refreshing drink for a summer day in Scottsdale! Our waiter was wonderful and I am sorry I forgot his name! Happy hour begins at 3 pm! Cozy decor! I have also experienced this restaurant for a large graduation party and they did an amazing job! Keep up the great work Brio--- I will be back!





Came for friend's 21st birthday. Caesar salad was so garlicky that it was inedible and left a terrible taste to start off the evening. Carbonara "lightly salted" was delicious, but it appears the portions have gotten smaller. Our server was very attentive and kind. Offered a complimentary chocolate dessert for the birthday boy.





Hmmmm. I would say our visit was a 6/10. We had a party of 10 with two waiters. Food was a 8/10. Decor and setting 8/10. Problem was food was missing from different orders and my husbands lamb dish never made it to the table until everyone else was finished eating their meal. (We were eventually told it would be a little bit before it would be out, so he asked everyone to eat while their food was warm.) The staff was polite and helpful, offering to comp my husbands dish. That is nice, but he came to dine with his party. We will pass and try somewhere else next time. There is a lot of establishment competition out there to make mistakes like forgetting someone's entire meal.





I decided to take a friend here for her birthday.  The service was not that great. I have experienced better service.  I ordered a chips and dip appetizer.  The kitchen runner dropped and ran as he spilled some of the chips off the plate onto the table.  We pointed this out to him and asked for more chips but, he did not seem to care one way or another.  I ordered Cesar salad and steak medallions for dinner.  The salad was delivered and the server did not check to see that we had everything we needed.  The table did not have a pepper grinder or salt shaker. I wanted some pepper and lemons for my salad.  It took longer than what would be expected to receive these items.  I ordered my steak medium plus and it arrived well done with a dark center.  The food was presented well but not prepared according to the order.  Plus, the entre arrived when I just started eating my salad.  It was too fast to receive the entre and the food was clustered together.  Later, the server splattered food all over my birthday guest's white blouse.  It was a mess.  The server offered her some club soda water but, she had to scrub her blouse with water at her birthday.  That is not the type of experience I had in mind for her birthday when I selected this restaurant.  Furthermore, this dining experience is not what I would expect from a place with the type of atmosphere and menu prices I was looking at.  When I see premium prices on the menu I expect premium service.  I don't understand why they were initially trying to charge me full price for this type of food and service.  We mentioned some things to the server and we ended up addressing these issues with a manager.  There should have been more consideration earlier regarding the circumstances.  I think there is some room for improvement here.  I have to say, I have had far better service at Olive Garden Restaurant.  It is a long drive to get to Brio and this place is not located in the most convenient and accessible area for the majority of the city.  There is nothing more disappointing than driving far to a restaurant and getting this type of service.





The crab crusted salmon special was fantastic. The portions were just right. The sourdough bread was an excellent compliment to our meal.  The atmosphere is very nice like an Italian courtyard. Will definitely come back here the next time we visit.





Wonderful atmosphere and food.  Yes the lemonade is as good as they say!!   Great service. Reasonable prices for such great food.





Had a lovely lunch here with my husband recently. I enjoyed the crab and shrimp cakes with roasted vegetables ... very tasty particularly when paired with the Santa Ema Sauvignon Blanc. My husband was very happy with his Pasta Pomodoro and the service was wonderful.





A favorite for happy hour.   Great food, service, atmosphere and cost.   Love the energy here.





Great potential here with a nicely decorated interior. As you walk in you cannot help but feel like you're in for a treat. In the end you'll need to lower your expectations as this place is just a chain. The food is just okay and competes nicely with other Italian chain restaurants. I can tell you from experience this place comes nowhere close to the food I had in Tuscany. 

Fun fact - the prices are 10% higher here than there location in SoCal.





Came in for lunch with some friends and everything was great. Had a couple appetizers. Food was amazing as well as the service. Perfect place for any outing.
