The Happy Hour at Brio is extremely jolly!  We love the offerings at the Brio at Town Square in Las Vegas, and thought we would try the Phoenix version of the same restaurant.  We dropped in on a Wednesday for Happy Hour  before going to a film, and were astonished by the size of the portions.  Some of the items were similar to Vegas" menu, but the servings of the Shrimp and Eggplant and the Pizza Margarita were twice if not three times as big!  Delicious spicy shrimp and crispy flatbread pizza accompanied by two large Margaritas made for a great preview to coming attractions.
The space at this restaurant is also more generous, and we were able to eat inside in unhurried luxury!





I have dinned here a few times, as a girls night out having some app's, dinner with another couple, lunch for a employee's birthday and then as a family for lunch with grandparent's would say that the service has varied in....when is was girls night and we had some wine and app's at the bar, our server was okay...when it was lunch it was just okay....dinner was better. Food I would say is good, it just seems like the typical big box franchise Italian restaurant that looses that special touch you find in the mom and pop type of places....





Oh my goodness.  Happy Hour.  So good, so inexpensive!!  We took a group of 10 for happy hour to celebrate my birthday.  Not only that, but there are Brio gift cards at Costco.  So it was quite the deal.  Between all of us, we tried everything on the happy hour menu.  Everything was really good.  My fav, beef carapaccio  was terrific and so plentiful.  There are lots of decent wines on the 5$ list.  The favorite mixed drink of our group was the Italian lemonade (vodka).





I've been here a few times for happy hour and am never disappointed. The appetizers are amazing and the drink specials are very well priced. I recommend the spicy shrimp!





Amazing service, fantastic food. Manager stopped by and was so pleased with how happy we were he comped our drinks as a thanks. Will definitely be back!





First visit~ We loved everything about Brio~!!! The service, food, ambiance~!!   Great HHour, etc. .





This is my favorite Tuscan Grille I have ever been to! Laurence was absolutely amazing as a bartender I could not say enough good things go about him! So amazing and kind knowledgeable and patient. Then for Steve the GM he was wonderful! Thank you so so much for everything to the both of you. This experience was amazing and more than anything I have ever experienced! Thank you brio team! Especially Laurence and Steve.





My wife and I went out to dinner at Brios with my parents on Thusrday night and every one of us was very happy with our meals. The presentation and atmospher was equal to or better than any "5 star" rated restaurant in the valley. This was our thisrd time there and as usual the night out , the service and the food were supberb. It's always fun to go out to the Kierland area and this night was no exception. Great Italian/ Continental at reasonable prices. Try it you will love it!





Delicious dinner options

Excellent service and attentive wait staff

Had the salmon on breaded tomatoes - excellent
Would recommend getting the side salad as there is not much in the way of greens with the dinner

PAsta dishes were delicious and well presented

Attentive to the children attending with us





Great time!! Our waiter, Max was amazing!! He gave great suggestions on the full meal and helped with the happy hour menu. We will be back because of the crazy good food but also because of the great service!!





We have gone here twice now and love it!!  It is a HUGE restaurant so you probably won't have to wait for a table.  It is just beautiful! High ceilings and big booths. I love the dcor. it makes you feel like you are in Italy!

The staff is always great and dressed very professionally.

We got the warm bread to start, then spinach artichoke dip which was great!!

For meals, I got a salad and it was huge!! Enough to take home for a second meal.  My boyfriend got a pasta dish and he loved his as well.

We went back a second time when we had family in town and they were all pleased with their meals as well. So overall, it is a great experience!





Lovely people and amazing food! My family and I went here for my sister's 18th birthday, and it was the best birthday dinner so far! I'm allergic to quite a few things and the staff went out of their way to give me something perfect and off-menu. I was so overjoyed and surprised! Our server's name was Omida and he was amazing! This was a perfect experience for all of us! Thank you so much, Brio! Highly reccomend





Brio is a great option for a medium-higher end Italian food where you can take the family. It's a bit loud but with little kids, that's fine with me. The carpaccio rivals that next door at Eddie V's and the lobster bisque soup is buttery and superb. I get the lasagna every time. Great bchamel sauce and plenty of food. Sit out front on the patio if you can, great people watching.





Came here for my cousins rehersal dinner and the first dish out was the lobster bisque and it was one of the best things ive ever ate !!!!!! AMAZING, I could have ate 10 more bowls of this and forget the main dish.
the main dish i got some chicken dish that i dont remember that well. I do remember that it was over pasta and the pasta was great, 
I also had 2 GREAT dirty martinis ,





I read all the reviews and a lot of them hated the service but I had a girlfriend visiting from PA that loves Italian food so I decided to take a chance. When I made the reservation I mentioned the bad service reviews and asked for their best wait person. I have to tell you the food and ambience were superb and Ashley our waitress was excellent. She Was extremely attentive and knew the menu well. I can't say enough about how we were treated and the food was delicious - we will take visitors back but will be certain to ask for Ashley.





Food is not that great, Service very slow, I ordered a  Steak (medium) they brought it  medium rear, Steak had a funny taste (burned  taste, is like your eating the grill steel. I eat 1/4 of the steak and the server asked me if somethings wrong with the steak I told him that it tastes like is burned  and also is not cooked the way I want it. (Yes I we paid the full bill, and no i didn't took the steak with me. I only eat the veggies). BTW I visited this place 3 times. 1'st time steak was ok, 2'nd time we dine on the patyo it was in December, The server was very Dirty and Nasty. His mucus dropped in our plate when he put the plate on the table. My wife almost throw up. We just left the restaurant and never came back until I got invited to a B-day and I had to go and ordered the NY Steak.
 NO I will not go there again. 
IF YOU ASK FOR MORE BREAD STICKS ... They will bring you cold ones and broken, not that good like the first ones, so you don't ask for more bread sticks. I never wanted to leave a feedback for this restaurant. But I really didn't enjoy the steak. So I had to leave the feedback. If you like steak, go down the plaza and there is a steak house, You can't go wrong..





Best Italian food I have experienced in Arizona and I was surprised because it's a chain. My guy and I were ooing and ahhing throughout the meal. I had the Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli with Crab insalata and it was a perfect portion, perfect flavoring and al dente! AMAZING. The only thing this place needs is Spumoni (minus the candied fruit)!!! Our server didn't even know what it was! What? i know!





I've eaten here twice now for dinner about 6 months apart and my experiences have been similar (not bad, not outstanding, and I would go here again but it is not at the top of my list). The place is expansive, loud, and has an upscale chain-like feel to it and it is very busy around the Happy and Dinner hours. My group scored some seats in the bar on my last visit while waiting for our table and I will give them good marks for some straight forward and affordable adult beverages. 

The luster decreases a bit in the dining room. The decor is upscale in appearance but the service and volume detracted from that. Servers were not always around when you were looking for them and the noise level was so high that our table of 4 could barely hear each other and had to keep leaning in throughout the evening to ask the person speaking to repeat themselves. It was my impression that the servers were short-staffed (I literally saw 2 of them at close to full sprints on a few occasions trying to get back to the kitchen to pick up ready meals at the pass) while our table sat unattended to. The noise level was accentuated by the lead chef who was expediting by occasionally yelling (literally screaming) at the kitchen crew. It was entertaining at first as I like to watch chaotic kitchens get their rhythm but this did not occur throughout our meal and the outbursts became a little distracting after a while. 

The menu is a bit unfocused in my opinion and seems like it tries to offer something for everyone as American chain restaurants like to do. Portion size is good and the food was tasty but not over the top great. One gripe is that their $6 side of Brussels sprouts was pretty measly and it took about 45 min for food to hit our table. That sort of confirmed for me that the kitchen did not have its act together on my last visit.  

In the end, I think an "A-OK" rating of 3 stars is right on. I've had better and worse meals in my life and I like enough aspects of Brio to go back but it is not the place that I think of first when searching out dinner in Scottsdale.





There are way better original italian places to go...I promise





Went there last night and had a better experience than prior.   We started off with the Roasted Garlic, Spinach & Artichoke Dip with parmesan flatbread.   YUMMMM!   Not too much of a garlic taste to feel as thought I would have garlic breath but just enough to taste it.   Correct combination of spinach and artichoke hearts.   Chunks of artichoke that I appreciated.  My companion had the Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine  and I had the Shrimp Mediterranean.   Both dishes were delish!    I had the shrimp dish prior and enjoyed it; therefore, I had it again since I had basically pigged out on the warm sour dough bread and flatbread and the dip and parmesan flatbread.   The fettuccine had the smaller shrimp than mine and lobster and the correct combination of cheeses and spices.   I would order that next time.

Our server was Jonathan in the bar since we would have had to wait for seating in the dining room and there were plenty of booths and tables in the bar with no wait.   Jonathan was very competent, efficient and friendly.

I definitely will be going back, that's for sure!





I should have written this earlier as it has been over a month but the poor service was memorable enough to have me writing this a month late.  I chose to go to Brio for my birthday dinner after having had lunch their with my mom.  So here are my two reviews:

Lunch: Service was slow to get started but once our waiter started he was great.  My mom and I shared the bruschetta quattro and the Insalata Roma.  The Bruschetta's were good and the salad was excellent.  We also shared some mini chocolate dessert that was as good as those little shot glass desserts get.  We really enjoyed sharing the bruschetta and experiencing the different flavors.  The atmosphere  was wonderful so I wanted to try dinner.

Birhday Dinner: My husband had called ahead of time to make reservations and let them know it was my birthday and that we would want some sort of birthday dessert.  When we arrived we were seated right away.  As I was reviewing the menu I watched the table across from us as they seemed to be having some trouble and the manager was getting involved.  10 minutes later, after no service, we asked that waiter of the table across from us if he could find our waiter.  Turns out, it was him.  Great.  He finally came over and got us started.  
Most of our food was good.  Let me point out what wasn't.  My daughter ordered a side caesar salad with her meal.  When it came, there was no dressing.  Let me clarify.  It wasn't lightly dressed, it had no dressing at all.  Just a bowl of lettuce with a couple of croutons.  My mom ordered the Penne Mediterranean which was completely flavor-less.  My husbands "surf and terf" was supposed to come with crispy potatoes, but they were missing from his plate when we were served.  Upon asking the waiter had no clue that they should have been included with the meal.  I will say that when they did arrive, they were our favorite part of our meal.  They forgot to note my birthday so we ordered the Dessert Trio to share and all of those were quite excellent.





My review is for the Happy Hour.  We were lucky enough to score a table as we got to Brio at exactly 4pm, had we waited 15 minutes and we would have been out of luck.

I'm usually skepticl when it comes to HH menus but this place is amazing.  The food was $3 or $4 bucks a plate and the drinks around $5 depending on what you got. 

The selection was fantastic and even better was the service.  There was 6 in our party and we ordered quite heavily on both the food and drink menus.  Our server was on top of it.  He was pleasant and friendly and really added to the experience.

The food was out-friggin-standing.  We got the pepperoni/sausage flatbread and it was defnitely a favorite amongst everyone.

The deep fried raviolis were top notch too.  We got the lettuce wrap cups and sliders.  

We also did dessert, I did the marscapone cheesecake and it was amazing.  

I am now confident I will return many, many times.





A group of us went for AZ Restaurant Week. I am not sure if it was all the large graduation parties or lack of experience with the Restaurant Week menu but service was a disaster. We waited 15 min for a first drink and it only got worse from there, finally after our dinner was served before our appetizer and we refused it, a manager stepped in and things got a bit better. We really appreciated his help.
The food was really good which made it extra disappointing that things were so disorganized. Additionally on both of the plates that included vegetables, the veggies were cold. By then we had given up trying to get things right. 
We were there just under 2 hours for a very basic meal. The waiter was very apologetic once he caught up but I am not sure if I would try it again.





I came here for lunch right after Christmas.  The building is beautiful.  You feel like you're eating somewhere in Vegas.  I ordered the lobster bisque soup and the caesar salad.  The table bread was great.  The taste of the lobster bisque was good but it didn't have any lobster chunks.  My friend ordered the vodka pasta - it had bacon in it which we weren't expecting although it was good.  We ordered the molten chocolate cake - very good - and two cappuccinos, also good.  Because it was my birthday, they brought us a free mini tiramisu.  Except for the amazing interior decor, this place is your standard italian restaurant with standard fare.  I would return again for lunch.





I've been here a few times, and we've had issues before but this takes the cake!  We sat in the private area due to the amount of people already dining.  Totally fine, Brio does have a nice private/patio area with a fireplace. After sitting for awhile, my friend found feathers in my hair which was really odd.  But then, a bird pooped on my arm- it is good luck and we were in an Italian restaurant.  The dove was stuck up in the rafters and could not leave the area.  The server did know the bird was in the rafters, but didn't seem to care either way.  I didn't make a big deal out of it, just odd.   I moved to another chair and below the chair was a woman's feminine product-wrapped.  Again, odd.  Then we got our food.  The roasted chicken was pretty dry and over cooked.  This is the second time, I've ordered a meat entree and both times, the meats were under cooked or overcooked.  To top the night, I chip a tooth.   I'm not sure if I will go there again, never really a great experience.





We have been here twice now, but a year apart. The first time we went it was excellent, we had an amazing server, and the food was spot on. This time it seemed a little off. We all seriously ordered the same things as last time, it took us a few moments to realize it. I was excited as their Pesto Chicken Salad was amazing the first time I had it. 

SO the run down..
Mother in Law ordered the crab cakes, and they were excellent. The roasted veggies that came with it had me jealous. 
Son ordered the pesto pasta and really enjoyed it as well.
Husband ordered the salmon salad and it was a little over done and charred. I would have said something, but he isn't the type to complain. 
I ordered the pesto chicken salad, The chicken was a whole chicken breast thinly sliced into two, which is more than enough meat for me. The only issue is, by doing this it made the chicken VERY DRY and VERY TOUGH. I was really disappointed as it was perfect the time before. 

It was a 50/50% split on food. There are too many other great places, I think we will try somewhere new next time.





I love Brio!
I eat here several times a month, sometimes lunch, sometimes happy hour and often dinner. The staff is always friendly and efficient. I voted for Executive Chef, Joe Milbert's fabulous Autumn pasta dish and he won a trip to Italy over all the other chefs who entered. He is now the acting General Manager and is doing an excellent job in an extremely busy position. 
The food is always delicious. Today I am wolfing down my favorite wedge salad anywhere, the Bistecca, but at happy hour, my choice is often the super good burger. All the servers are upbeat, and give us extra good service!
I will be looking for you, join us at this lovely restaurant.





Arrived Thursday Dec, 22, 2011 without reservations at 6:45pm, which may be a bit early for this place. The bar was packed, the dining room had lots of empty but reserved tables.

We got decent service, about 10 minutes till our salads arrived and 32 minutes until our meals arrived. 

Easy parking in the garage across the street.

I would go back anytime, it was a good meal and good service.





Resonable price 

Service team was challenged being short handed

Food was good for the $$

Not bad 


yelp requires a novel for a review to get posted - Its like yelp is a frustrated former English teacher make you write a 10k word term paper when a one pager covers the topic





I came here with a big group from work for lunch last week. There were 3 servers assigned to our table, and they were all friendly. They were also pretty good about keeping all of our drinks filled, especially considering there was 12 of us.

I was trying to be healthy, so I ordered the tilapia and roasted vegetables. It was surprisingly good and had a little spicy kick to it. Plus, the portion size was very generous. Everyone else seemed to be pretty happy with their food too.

Although I had a good experience, I don't think it was anything special, especially considering the prices. If I had to actually pay, I think I would have been a little disappointed. All in all, it's not a bad place, it's just missing that certain something to push it up to 4 stars.





Love to come here for HH and all their great appi's. Tonight was first time coming for dinner and we were not disappointed.  Our waiter, Danny was personable and attentive and only here to make everything to our pleasing. The spicy shrimp and eggplant appetizer is our favorite and what keeps bringing us back. And we love to bring our out of town guests in to enjoy it as well. Enjoyed Danny and the whole staff!  Thank you.





I shouldn't give this away because I hurt my chances to get a good table, but I'm a good person and not too selfish so I'll let you in on the best happy hour in town. You can get wine for $5 and hold on...angus beef hamburger for $5. So delicious. Make sure you share with a really good friend or special someone in your life. A truly great time. Thanks brio!!!





Cross Macaroni Grill food with the Cheesecake Factory ambiance and you have Brio.  Went on a Friday night at 8:00 and about 10 of the 60 plus tables were occupied.  Bad sign.  Service was spotty...about on par with an Appleby's (no disrespect to Appleby's). If there were any specials or specialties, we weren't told about 'em.  Lobster bisque was below average...too thick.  Caesar salad was good.  Roasted lamb chops were terrible for $29.  Asked for medium rare, came out medium.  Also gamey.  Shrimp and lobster fettuccini was flavorful...I'd give it a 6.5.  Great location but will not return.  Too many better choices close by in the price range.





Love the upscale feeling...and the outdoor seating for great people watching. Great after work happy hour spot, with happy hour specials on appetizers and drinks. Food tastes very fresh and homemade.





I've been to Brio for both dinner and happy hour, and enjoyed both experiences.  The happy hour tasting menu has a bunch of items for just $2.95!  We had the burger, margharita flatbread, shrimp and eggplant and the steak bruschetta....all were really good and decent sized portions.  But make sure to get there early to snag a table, it is first come, first serve seating in the bar area and only goes until 6 pm!

The only thing that I have had a Brio so far that I would not suggest is the lobster bisque.  I absolutely adore lobster bisque, but this version was so thick...you almost had to chew it!  Other than the bisque, the food has been perfect, seafood risotto, Gorgonzola lamb chops....all excellent.  And if you still have room for dessert...you must try the caramel creme brulee....it is amazing!





I want to love this place, but I just don't.
Everytime I eat here, I wish I were eating at Olive Garden....
For a chain, I just don't have any memorable items that I'd come back for (as opposed to Olive Garden's crack like breadsticks)

Meh





Compared to most restaurants in Kierland Commons, Brio Tuscan Grille continues to offer a good value and a nice time for Happy Hour!  The other restaurant that is good for HH is Tommy Bahama's.

We come here probably once a week or so before a movie and the Happy Hour is great!  Wine is reasonably  priced around $10.00 while all the appetizers are $2.95.  Carpaccio, Ravioli Caprese, Flat bread sausage and peperoni and sirloin sliders, et cetera all for $2.95!  Nice!

Brio recently began offering $5.00 Martini's on Wednesdays.  The only problem with the Brio is the bar area has limited seating.  What they really need to do is give some thought to expansion because the outdoor seating just doesn't always work well.  So get their early!

Our most recent tab came to $35.63 before tip.  Good food, good drinks, good value!

Enjoy!





Alfredo sauce was awesome, they use parmigiano reggiano!
I had them make me a custom pasta, rigatoni with alfredo and crumbled sausage.
My girlfriend and I shared a single entree which was huge for both of us and cost.......$12!
Cheaper than any entree there!
Service was good, she took a while to get our initial drink order. But after that she was great. Hooked us up on some free alfredo bread dipping sauce and a cheap entree, so she got a good tip!

i will go back and hopefully it will be just as awesome.





My experience last night was one of the worst dining experiences I've had. My friend and I showed up at 7 for a mutual friends birthday dinner. #1. We were not greeted when we walked in. #2. While it was a large party we waited nearly an hour to order food. #3. We had to ask our waitress three times for bread and waited twenty minutes for that. #4. Four of us got the three for 27.95 meal, two others at the end of the table got appetizers. Those of us that got the deal ordered salads. Our salads sat in the window for almost 45 minutes before they were brought to us. At that point they were soggy because of the dressing sitting so long on the salad. #5. Our entrees took another about 40 minutes to come. And some people got their sides and some didn't. One girl didn't get hers until she's finished her meal. My friends Brussels sprouts were burnt. #6. I asked for our check before dessert. At this point it was about 9:15 and we hadn't even gotten a water refill. We finally left at 1015. Because two of us had moved down one seat the waitress had trouble with who got what drink, although she had asked us for clarification. I finally got up and got a manager, shorter, balding man. Who when I asked if he was a manager, did not immediately ask me how he could help me. Which I found a weird response to a customer who has gotten out of THEIR SEAT TO COME FIND YOU Nor did he ever come to our table and apologize for the slow/poor service. I couldn't believe it took so long to get our checks, or the amount of time it took to get our food. We had a waiter and waitress working our table and it still took forever. While the food was good I am big on customer service and felt the lack of it isn't worth my return to the restaurant. Horrible experience.





Brio was the perfect choice for our goodbye dinner before my husband traveled to Italy. The casual atmosphere was great for our kids and we loved the free appetizer with the Yelp check in. My daughter loved the Chicken Milanese and I enjoyed the light Shrimp Verduta. The Bisteca Insalade was a meal unto itself, but I would not include Brio in the category of Italian restaurants that gives you portions far too large for anyone to finish. They were busy and a few times we waited for our server, but overall we would recommend it.





We hosted an event in Brio's banquet hall last night and it was wonderful! From the start, Adam (one of the Banquet Managers) was thorough and dedicated to making our event just what we wanted. Excellent service by servers Marion and Samantha. They were truly dedicated and went above and beyond...Marion was there early and jumped right in to help us in every way, and Samantha was great at ensuring the food/beverages were at par and served timely. Brian (another manager), was great at checking in throughout the event.

We hosted over 30 faculty/staff members from our school and couldn't be more pleased. They had a great time! For delicious food, great service, and an excellent price...definitely look into Brio for your next event!!

Great work, Brio Staff!





Our last night in the Phoenix area and this was our last stop! I had already eaten a trillion times that day and the whole week--needless to say I wasn't as hungry as I normally am. On  tjhis certain Friday night after 7pm, the restaurant was very busy and there was a wait. What I did like about this restaurant is they take your phone number and they will notify you via text when you table is ready. We had a 40 minute wait so this gave us plenty of time to shop! The hostess was very nice! After about 35 minutes of waiting/shopping at the mall, a text was sent to let me know my table would be ready soon and to start heading back. My husband grabbed the table before I made it back but the hostess kindly directed me to our table. Once seated it took our waiter a moment to get there---hey were busy so I understand. He finally came and took our drink orders while we looked over the menu. I tried their pink lemonade (not sure what the lemonade was mixed with) which was delicious! One thing that I did not like was our waiter waited until we waited for a while, placed our drink order, had a our drinks refilled, and placed our food order before he brought bread to our table. For the most part he was very nice. Our food arrived and I ordered a Brio Chopped salad and added a side of grilled chicken to go with it (only three dollars or so to add chicken to a salad). My salad, the chicken, and the restaurant dressing was very good! My daughter got the kids pizza which was the size of an adult pizza that could feed two people--at least! Her pizza also had fresh ingredients and tasted good. My husband ordered a Strawberry Balsamic Chicken Salad--which was soooooo good! My mother in law ordered a Caesar salad and barely received any salad in her bowl. The waiter was nice enough to take the salad back and have them add more salad to her bowl. The original salad she received ordered was very skimpy on the portion--I am not even sure if it was a joke or not. Although we didn't order any of their major menu items, the items we did ordered were really good. I am not a major Italian restaurant eater, but when I return to the Phoenix area and have a larger appetite for Italian, I will be sure to give them another try.





Firstly, I will say that our server Austin did a great job, and our lunch was very good.  

Unfortunately, what would have been a great experience turned negative quickly.  I watched a waitress REPEATEDLY go to the banquet side of restaurant and play with her eyeball in the mirror.  I don't know what her issue was, but it didn't stop her from bringing bread and tea to her tables without washing her hands.  So gross.  I considered speaking to a Manager after to let him know how grossed out I was.  Right before we left, I saw what I later learned was the floor manager go to the same banquet room, remover his shoe play with his laces, put his shoe back on, and then put his hands in the window to kitchen to pull food to be run.  How fricking nasty??!





Went to brio for a nice dinner. it had great service (as to be expected). Server knew his "script" well, but didn't know much else about the dishes. I ordered the Shrimp Verduta and my girlfriend ordered the sweet potato something risotto. we also had the quattro appetizer of bruschetta.

The bruschetta was ehhh, nothing special it, was all really standard dishes. The steak one had a nasty smokey tanginess to it that i didn't like. Overall i was not impressed by any of the four types of bruschetta.

My dish was alright, i could have made something a lot better on my own. I would eat it again, but i would not order it (if that makes sense to anyone). Shrimp was cooked nicely, the sauce was just there.. it wasn't anything to tell anyone about at all.

My girlfriend's dish was wack. I didn't like it at first. It tasted a lot better as a leftover the next day. I don't think it is something i would order again or even eat if i got it for free.

This place is nice to go, but not for a romantic date. It is too loud, i would call it a step up from carraba's. It was really busy there, 20-30 minute wait for a table for 2. Next time i am going to do italian food in that area i'm going to maggiano's.

At least i had a free appetizer's ticket from the yelp event earlier this year! sweet...





I am gluten free and had the most amazing pasta lunch here for my birthday. I honestly never thought I'd taste anything that delicious again after I got diagnosed as having celiac disease. I literally day dream about my last meal at Brio and can't wait to go back.





I met a friend for a bite to eat and a shopping day. I got a brunch item a poached egg with a shrimp/crab cake on the side with some potatoes. A mixed berry lemonade. This place was really nice, and the food was really good. I heard from a friend that their dinner menu is good as well, can't wait to try it next time.





Really pretty interior! It was all decorated for Christmas when I went today.

I went with a friend because we were in the Scottsdale Quarter and were craving bread. We went in around 4:30 and it was pretty slow (awkward time). We got a bread basket and it had a half loaf of white bread and some crispy flax/rosemary crackers. The bread loaf was warm and good to satisfy our craving. It wasn't crusty bread, but it was good enough. We asked were oil and vinegar and they brought it out promptly!

We ordered the Strawberry Balsamic salad ($15) to split. It was good, but standard. Came with strawberries, gorgonzola cheese, balsamic dressing, grapes, and candied pecans. Definitely overpriced, but it's all we ordered so whatever. Service was good, we had Ethan.

Might go back for happy hour, but it probably won't be my first choice restaurant--more of an "in the area so it's convenient" type.





Went to Brio for Happy Hour.  We arrive early because of the crowds.  However in the summer, the Grille has ample seats.  We ordered carpaccio, spicy shrimp and tomato flatbread.  Everything came quickly and looked great.  The carpaccio comes with greens and is pleasing to the eye.  We loved the shrimp dish.  Pieces of fried eggplant sat below the shrimp.  The sauce that accompanied the shrimp is out of this world.  There is a plateful of flatbread that was good as well.  The three dishes were more than ample for a dinner. My only slight complaint was I had to ask for another glass of water but this was minor.





Happen to show up during happy hour and was pleasantly surprised with the great deals they were offering! Our server was nice and it was not crowded at 3pm on a weekday. The food was delish too!





I have enjoyed lunches here and decided to take my Aunt and Uncle for a special dinner. The ambience is beautiful, the server was cheerful and seemed attentive.

What was disappointing was the cold food. Everyone in the party had cold food, except for my pasta meal. My Aunt's grilled chicken was very dry and seemed over cooked and cold. how does that happen. Was it the server? Was it the cook? 

The Alfredo fettuccini was a side dish and we know why. It tastes like an Applebee's sauce. It's good, but not enough Parmesan cheese flavor. Worse...it was cold. 

My favorite part of the meal was the sourdough bread, special crackers, and butter served while waiting.

I guess we will stick to lunches. The lobster bisque is amazing.





This was my third time at Brio in Scottsdale. The quality of the food has taken a nose dive. 
We were a party of 5. My pasta dish was served warm - not hot. The side kale salad was mediocre - at best, One of my friends ordered a pasta dish with chicken. It was served without the chicken (Hello). My guess is that the chef has never had real Italian food. They seated us a the only table in the (fairly empty) restaurant on which the sun continued to shine. So my friend had to keep shifting her chair around the table to avoid being blinded by the glare. Sadly, I was the one who recommended Brio, as it was my birthday. I must say that the dessert was delicious. The waiter was attentive, but he should have moved us to another table. Disappointed BIG TIME.





Went for birthday dinner with my daughter, along with wife and mother-in-law.  Had been here before for happy hour and it was pretty decent but we only ate appetizers that time. Decided to give it a try for dinner.

Since it was a special day, we went all out.  Drinks, appetizers, salad, entrees, and one dessert.  All in all, the food was only fair (except the shrimp and eggplant appetizer-wonderful!) and we were pretty disappointed.  Over $200 with the tip left me with sticker shock as well.

Bottom line - if you want Olive Garden quality food, go to Olive Garden and save yourself a bunch of money.  Or...stick with happy hour and some appetizers.





I go here regularly for their salmon salads and steak salads, so good!, never have any issues. I had a little situation last time with my food (my half empty lobster and shrimp bisque had no shrimp, and my steak salad came out with cold steak, half the salad drenched with sauce, the other half dry), and I asked our waiter (who was very nice and a good waiter) if he could get a manager over to us. Being a regular, I was curious if they had switched chefs or something since I was having so many issues. She saw my salad, apologized, and brought me back a new fresh one immediately (waiting there the whole time while it was being made). She also took care of our lobster bisque. Great food, and great customer service, gives then 5stars. Every restaurant has an off day here and there, but the way the situation was handled will keep me a regular at this place!





Brio Tuscan continues to offer the best tasting, best value Happy Hour in and around the Kierland/Quad area of Scottsdale. The other Happy Hour restaurant we would recommend would be Tommy Bahama's.

Happy Hour at Brio run from 3 to 6, Monday thru Friday. 

They have for $4.00 Bruschetta and Margherita Flatbread (photo); for $5.00 they have a fabulous tasting Beef Carpaccio with capers and aioli mustard (photo), Tomato Mozzarella Salad, Potato Skins (photo), Buffalo Chicken Nachos and a whole lot more. See menu photo. 

Brio continues to offering $5.00 Martini's on Wednesdays and Wine on Thursdays.  Their only shortcoming continues to be their minuscule bar area with limited seating.  What they really need is to consider is an expansion, because the outdoor seating just doesn't work well in the winter, when our snow bird friends arrive. 

Our most recent tab came to $23.75 including taxes, but before gratuities.  Good food, good drinks, good value!

Enjoy!





Accommodating hostess Kylie and the most wonderful and helpful server, Jessica, we've ever had!  She made a suggestion for just a little more food knowing we were already full on appetizers, which were already out of this world, to try the lobster bisque soup. Yum. We will definitely come back to this location again.





Very disappointed by Brio last night. Had horrible service from the get-go when entertaining clients. 2 different parties of 4 who came in after us got served drinks long before we did. After we brought this to the attention of our waitress she was extremely unapologetic and in fact showed a markedly soured attitude towards us after that. We flagged down an also unapologetic seem-to-be manager, who first pointed to our waters joking that we "did have our drinks" and then got very busy describing how he kept glancing over at us during his walk thrus and everything seemed okay... weird that he was so defensive. His (wrong) "impression" is besides the point. .. He offered to "buy us the round" but never checked on us again. In fact,  we had to ask that the drinks be taken off when the increasingly snarky waitress didn't know a thing about it when presenting us with the check. All in all bad, unfriendly, non-empathic and disrespectful customer service. No fun to encounter flippant staff with an attitude. I will be telling my friends about this experience.





We came here for happy hour and the place is superb. Our server Nikki is top notch and was very attentive. This place is lucky to have her as she is a valuable asset to their team. The food was exceptional and the price was great. The atmosphere was good and we had a great time. We will be back.





I've had great food from Brio. I guess I can't comment on the atmosphere because I always get my food to go, but it's similar to (the decor, table size, general layout) a Cheesecake Factory on the inside (I'm being an asshole-specifically because some guy was all 'I'd pass, Cheesecake Factory atmosphere' am I the only one who thinks Cheesecake Factory isn't so bad? I mean yeah they're a chain, but they're always pretty well kept? Whatever.) - clean, all of the wait staff are friendly. I always deal with the bartender and he's a nice guy. All of the food I've had had been delicious. The desserts have been a personal favorite, but the quinoa chicken pesto salad for lunch was also delicious and decently priced for the area.





My wife had a friend visiting from out of town so last night we decided to go out to eat at Brio.  My wife had eaten there once several years ago and my wife had purchased some Brio gift cards at Costco.

We were very disappointed in the food.  For a fancy restaurant we expected a lot better.

I ordered the Chicken Milanese, which is basically Chicken Parmesan.  The chicken is sliced very thin and then breaded and fried until it is quite tough.  It's probably over-fried.  3 weeks ago I had a root canal with a permanent crown attached 10 days ago.  I was seriously scared that chewing this chicken would knock my crown off.

My wife got the Balsamic Braised Short Rib.  She liked her meal and because she liked it, this rating is 2 stars and not 1 star.

My wife's friend got one of the pasta dishes.  I'm not sure which one.  But much of the pasta was all stuck together. into a solid lump.  She only ate part of the meal.  She complained to the waiter who told her that that's how the pasta should be because the sauce forces the pasta to stick together.  But after he cleared the plates, we could see the waiter showing the plate of pasta to someone from the kitchen.  Soon the manager came out to our table explaining that the pasta was over-cooked and offering to get her more pasta.  She declined as we had already finished our meal and had been in the restaurant an hour and a half by that point.  The manager wasn't offering to bring her the same dish prepared right, but  just some more pasta.  Like she wants to eat some pasta by itself.

The manager said he'd give us a discount on our bill for the bad pasta dish.  When we got the bill, it was an insult...  a $3 discount on a $79 bill.  When something bad is served and the manager admits it was prepared wrong,  it should have a greater discount.  With this insult, it would have been more respectful to have not offered any discount and just let us believe the quality of the food is bad.  Now we know the quality of the food is bad and the manager is disrespectful.

And I didn't even mention how bad my Chicken Milanese was.

But my wife was happy with her meal and one thing I've learned in my marriage is if my wife is happy, then I'm happy.





The Decor is NICE , staff was nice and attentive. Food is amazing . This is one of my favorite Resturant .





Happy hour: love the lounge and patio atmosphere. $5 cocktails and $2.95 appetizers! The shrimptini and spicy shrimp & eggplant appetizers were awesome as were the peach bellinis. The shrimptini was refreshing though a bit heavy on the dressing, and the spicy shrimp & eggplant was gooooood, as in I-want-to-dive-into-a-pool-filled-with-this-stuff-and-eat-my-way-out kind of good! Get the ravioli caprese if you dig Costco frozen meals and hate caprese - i.e. there was virtually no caprese. The formaggio was also kind of bland, which says a lot since I am an asiago lover. I still love you, Brio, and I suppose I can't really complain too much since $30 (including tip) got me a round of drinks and four appetizers. Still my numero uno at Scottsdale Quarter.





The worst service. Had a baptism gathering there n had about 40 people and they gave us two servers only n just asking for drinks it would take so long. Also the food they said it was a family size but it wasn't because it wasn't enough for half of the people we had!!! And when asked to bring more it took them more then 20 minutes to bring more food to the table when they should of been prepared!! I'm sorry but I know for next time to not bother coming here anymore!!





Brio is the perfect restaurant to visit after a long day of shopping! In fact, when the Quarter first opened up and H & M arrived, my sister and I made it a girl's night out and after several hours of shopping at H & M, enjoyed wine and dinner on the patio at Brio. It was such a fun night and the Brio patio was calm and relaxing. 

Fast forward a couple of years and now the Quarter is thriving with many more shops and restaurants, but Brio still remains a favorite to me. I think this is the perfect restaurant for families who have kids and want to have a nice dinner at a restaurant, but in an environment where the kids won't stand out if they get a little louder than normal. This is also a perfect restaurant for a date night on the patio or when you have friends in town or need a nice dinner spot for one with the parents. It's really a good all-around restaurant, especially the patio! 

The food here is hearty, filling and tasty Italian cuisine. My go-to favorite dish are the lobster raviolis. I don't know what they do to the sauce, but it's a perfect combination of creamy and sweet and goes perfectly with the ravioli. I really enjoy their chopped salad as well and it has a perfect blend of fresh veggies. For dessert, you must try the chocolate souffle. Oh my! I go into the evening planning on having one bite and find myself having 10!





I am so sick after eating here today. The plates and silverware were dirty. I tried to ignore it and just eat the food. The tomatoes were brown. I asked our server if they were meant to be that color and she replied surely yes. It is now 5 hours later and I am puking my meal up and have no appetite.  My boyfriend is just as sick and we will never go back.





I guess two stars says "Meh. I've experienced better." and that's exactly how I feel about this place. 
Pros: familiar chain restaurant that can be back-up plan in a new town, large food portions, descent happy hour, consistent service, good place for gift cards?
Cons: food is bland, definitely  inconsistent the 3 times I have been there!

I remember the first time we went there was the first month they had opened and for some reason, I recalled the food being amazing! I was excited for a new great italian restaurant, however, the next time I visited the quality of food had gone down dramatically! I went there again, for a birthday, hoping that the food would be as good as the first time and I was definitely disappointed!

I also tried the Brio in Tucson, Cleveland, Colorado, and I think it's a better  place than cheesecake factory, but not as good a maggiano's.... butt if you are in a new town for a meeting, you can trust that you will get mediocre food from a reputable place.





This was a pleasant surprise! We really enjoyed the food but did let the manager know the service was sub par. Thomas absolutely made things right. No excuses! We will for sure be back!  That is the way to run a business.





Love the food. The service is very good. So far one of the only places that prepare the Pasta just perfect. Down side is that its a bit pricy for pasta.
But I highly recommend it...dont forget the deserts are great..





Just thinking about the lobster bisque makes my mouth water.  My food was excellent, the service was great too.  Highly recommended.





Ok food. Ok service. I had the lobster bisque which was good but only one piece of lobster. My husband had the rotisserie chicken, good but dry. Our server was nice but every time she approach d the table she must have decided we were ok, so she turned and walked away before communicating. Food came out quickly but almost too quickly between courses. I will probably try out another place in Scottsdale before returning.





I have heard a lot of good things about this restaurant and felt so disappointed with our visit. I'll start with three positive things. The bartender was friendly and efficient. The young hostess was was also happy and friendly . And, my niece was offered a free dessert for her birthday.
I wish I could say the same things about the waiters as I did about the bartender and hostess. Initially we were told we would have two waiters as our group of 9 people was a large table. Good sign right? Wrong, we rarely saw one of the waiters. The waiter forgot to get drink orders from half the table and then forgot to bring out drinks that were ordered. Before dinner bread was placed on the table. A small plate with 4 pieces of bread...for 9 people. The waiter looked confused/angry when we asked for enough bread for everyone.
Then the food arrived. The food came out at various times, one meat dish undercooked,one pasta dish very overlooked and mushy and one of the salads hardly resembled what was listed in the menu. The rest of the food was mediocre. I don't know what was happening in the kitchen that night. We were there on a Sunday night and the place was packed.
I wish I had better things to say. Like I said, we heard good things about the restaurant. Maybe they were having a very off night.





Brio Tuscan Grille is one of my favorite restaurants. So much so that I drive from Tucson to Scottsdale to go there. Their service is great, setting is fancy and food is perfect. They serve a loaf of bread and chips before the meal. I'm an east coaster who values good seafood and they have one of the best Shrimp & Lobster Fettuccine I've had in Arizona. Their Lobster Bisque is also a favorite. Paired with their new zesty Watermelon Margarita. For dessert I order the chocolate cake that has fudge in the middle.





After the day I had dealing with lousy customer service reps, this was an oasis of awesome. Our server Michael was truly excellent. Funny, attentive and knew the menu. Made great recommendations. We loved our food. I had the lobster fettuccine and my husband had the pesce piccata. Love! Also try the raspberry monitor. A prefect experience start to finish.





My sister and I had passed this restaurant on the way to my job and decided to try it out. I had the calamari fritto and she had the salmon. Both were terrific with just the right portions and seasonings! I would strongly suggest eating here as it is well worth the try.





I had heard from several people the food here was good.  As I travel to Italy often I'm fairly picky about Italian food but am willing to make allowances for Italian-American restaurants.

I had the lobster bisque which wasn't terrible but not great either.  A little too peppery and some pieces of what seemed to be dried fish.  I had ordered what I thought was the crab/shrimp cake appetizer but was brought the meal.  Since I hadn't actually looked at that part of the menu I didn't realize it wasn't the appetizer until I got the bill.  The crab/shrimp cake was adequate but there was too much filler for my taste.  The grilled potatoes and vegetables that came with the crab/shrimp cake were not warm.  Completely over-priced.

The service was glacially slow.

I will not return.





Another solid meal and overall experience at Brio. The decor is amazing. Upscale with a wide open floor plan.

Service has always been friendly and timely, although today the hostess seemed a bit put off by us coming in for dinner at 4:45pm and wanting to sit in the dining room rather than the bar area (which she had suggested but we declined).

My favorite appetizer is the beef carpaccio. A massive plate of delicious raw beef. Excellent. I have had several main dishes in my visits to Brio, and there are a couple standouts. First, is the the lasagna. Second, the carbonara. Not the absolute best I've ever had, but certainly way up there. I have had a couple dishes that were a little off the mark, such as the lobster & shrimp fettucini, but it still found its way into my belly! So how bad could it have been, right?

Anyway, I can't quite give Brio 5 stars, but it definitely hits the mark if you are looking for a semi-upscale restaurant with consistently good food and service.





Stopped here for a late dinner and decided to eat in the bar.  The bartender, Brendan, was great!  Service was fantastic!  He makes the best peach bellini EVER!   During the summer they have a reverse happy hour for the last hour of business.  We had the tomato mozzarella salad, a flatbread on the HH menu, and lamb chops and dessert ... way more than enough to eat, it was served quickly, and everything was great!  The chocolate lava cake is the best dessert they have, and although it came out under-heated the first time, it was corrected right away!  The manager, Vinnie, came by to make sure we were satisfied with everything.  That's customer service!  Always clean and nice decor too.  Love it!





Lackluster pasta.  Was expecting great service but that  missed as well.  Not sure how they get the rating they have.  Seems like they are living off the greater chain ratings.





Happy Hour King & Scottsdale Quarter Gem! - Here's My Order:

On my most recent visit, I went for dinner with a close friend and we decided to try new dishes. I ordered the special of the day which was a Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli dish. Best. Ravioli. Ever.

Happy Hour: If I am in the area, this is one of my top choices. I can bring a date for lunch/dinner and get a few drinks without dropping more that $40

Great ambiance, friendly staff, 10/10.





Caprese was excellent. Delicious tomatoes and nicely portioned mozzarella. Had the frittata for brunch and although good, there were so many rich components.  Ask for the Alfredo sauce on the side. Service was okay. The general environment felt a little unorganized and off.





This was my very first experience at Brio and I had heard really good things about them.  We were promptly greeted and seated immediately. We did have reservations so I'm sure that helped because on a Saturday evening this place was busy.  Our waitress was great in explaining the specials and anything we had a question about on the menu. Prior to our meal we were served a bread basket which had a nice sized piece of warm sourdough bread and real butter. It was really good. We decided on Peach Bellini's and they were delicious. We also had lobster bisque, which had a bite of lobster in every spoonful. Next the entrees were served.  We had the Brio pasta, Salmon and asparagus with a crab cake, and the lasagna bolognese. All were delicious. We had a temperature problem with the crab cake but it was immediately corrected. An awesome dinner and a beautiful dinner area made for an amazing first time. I will return.





I ordered scallops on risotto because they had advertised it although I never saw the price. Shrimp risotto was $16 so I wasn't too worried. The scallops were burned black on both sides. I kept waiting for it to improve. It was like a charcoal sandwich with tasteless scallops in between.  The risotto tasted like a can of sauce was dumped on it.  I hated it but kept eating because I was so hungry.  I should have said something right away. When I got the check and saw that the scallops were $25, I felt I had been scammed.  I didn't want money back, just an answer. The waiter didn't help.  I will never go back..not happy hour or anything.   Brio chef's cooking stinks and they serve it anyway. Yuck.





Let me say this
Roasted Chicken Rissotto !!! So good!
My favorite item on the menu!
The flatbreads are very good as well. 
The service can be hit and miss depending on the night. 
Elevated Itailian Chain Food.





Good place, decent happy hour. Good food. I used to give this place 5 stars but every time i come here (which is monthly) Im always reminded of something that somehow seemed to slipped my mind when writing my earlier review (the most important tips often somehow manage to do that, but thats why they have an 'update review' option, thank you yelp for catering to us frequently distracted folk) and thats the extremely weak drinks. Ok people now the frequency of my drinking consists of maybe 3-4 drinks a week and during/with dinner and i weigh about 100 lbs. personally i wouldn't call myself a heavy drinker and NORMALLY at a restaurant a drink or 2 will do me just fine. Not this place. It takes about 4, yes thats 4, and no I'm not exaggerating. I've sent back drinks numerous times (something i freaking hate and would much rather avoid, but this place leaves me no choice really) and the next drink maybe, maybe might be enough to make a dent. But then obviously when i come back again i have to do the 'send the water and ice drink i just paid $6 back and hopefully they send a real drink out next time dance'. Its just kind of annoying and its how it goes ALMOST every time. note the almost is because more often than not when i come here i pay $6 for water, ice and some sugar juice stuff but in the past (but not anymore :( ) I've had a really good bar tender (he has a mustache you can't miss him!) who actually knew how to make a real drink. But for the past few months i keep getting stuck with some other bar tender. If you don't drink then sorry if you read this whole review. Like i stated earlier the food is great and the atmosphere is nice. Despite there overpriced water/ice/juice drinks (they call them alcoholic beverages on the menu) i still frequent here monthly. Definitely recommend it.





Thank you Brio Tuscon Grille for great lunch earlier this week.
Thank you fellow yelpers for your check in and reviews.  When fellow yelpers check in, I do look up and if it is something interesting for me, I book mark. I do enjoy reading reviews online, otherwise I would not have been able to experience so many yummy dishes. This place is no exception, when one of the yelpers checked in, it sounded so interesting, I had to try for myself.

We arrived here around noon, and it was about 80% full when we got there.

I glanced at the menu and almost decided on salmon when my friend kindly pointed out on today's special menu.   My eyes were glued to the pumpkin ravioli from the moment I saw the today's special menu.

I must tell you, if you haven't tried the pumpkin ravioli, try once. You will not regret it. First of all, it's fall, it's pumpkin season. Second, pumpkin is so good for you with vitamins.  Ravioli is served with many vegetables to make this dish more healthy.  And best of all, this was the best pumpkin ravioli I've ever had. I especially like the sauce used in the ravioli, nicely complemented the pasta dish.

Don't forget to check in on yelp for free appetizer with two orders of entrees. We ordered tomato salad (Caprese salad). I thought they used really good quality of mozzarella cheese, I enjoyed the salad very much.

For desert, I ordered mini-size tiramisu. It was so moist, I ate this small desert very quickly. I had to go jogging for 60 mins that night to burn all the calories from my desert, but it was so worth it.

Coffee was very good as well. I like when restaurant invest in good coffee, saves me a trip to coffee shop after my meal.

Service was very good as well. They were busy but they kept moving very efficiently.

Looks like I found my new favorite place to eat, I will definitely come back again.





Years ago I use to really like this place, but now I'm disappointed and amazed that this restaurant stays in business. Located in the Scottsdale Quarter, Brio should be standing right alongside many of the other good corporate owned restaurants in the area, but it falls behind in both food and service. On a quiet Sunday afternoon the place was not busy. I arrived before my friend and sat at a table in the bar area. I waited nearly 10 minutes before the Bar steward came over to greet me and give me water (in hot Phoenix August). My companion arrived but still it took 15 minutes before our waiter even brought over menus. The waiter seemed preoccupied, but eventually we ordered appetizers and a main course.......but still more waiting with nothing but water on the table...finally the waiter came over with some bread saying that he had been waiting for a fresh batch to be ready (well he could have told us that!) But the bread wasn't even warm just dry and unappealing. Our appetizer Brushetta Sampler finally arrived. There was no consistency or freshness about it, pieces of the Brushetta bread must have been cut from a stale loaf because they were really really hard, and the meat on the other pieces was unedible even though the bread on those was much softer. 

We kept waiting for our entree to arrive (45 mins) and it wasnt until after we flagged the waiter down that we found out for some reason he had not put in the order! Forgot to put in the order? Its not like it was a swamped busy Friday night! Finally after nearly fainting from starvation our one entree of Angel Hair pasta with Tomatos and Pesto arrived (we split it). After only a few bites we both realized the pasta was barely cooked! I know what Al Dente is and this was not it. If this was suppose to have a Pesto sauce on it it failed miserably, it was dry,  unflavorful and frankly I was embarrased for the cook.  Seriously? A restaurant of this caliber serving unedible food? Come on were in Scottsdale no less! And the waiter seemed to just disregard that we were there even though there was only one other couple in the bar area.  I was trying to be patient, I was trying to give the place the benefit of the doubt....maybe they only had one cook today, maybe they were short staffed?? I kept looking for a reason to like my experience there.

By this time we thought OK, lets have dessert and coffee since everything else was unedible and we're still hungry. We ordered the Carmalized Cheesecake with Strawberries. It arrived looking nothing like a normal cheescake slice. Upon sampling it we couldn't figure out if it was a cake or a cheescake.  It had a lone Strawberry on it but no sauce. The flavor or lack thereof was indescribable. We didn't finish it. It was also horrible. How can you offer a tasteless cheescake?

Eventually the manager came over realizing that there were problems and he tried to make amends but by this point there was no reason to order anything else, we'd spent over 2 hours in the place with each dish beingreally bad. Luckily, he comped most of the meal but I felt bad for him as well. As a manager he should have been aware of food quality, any problems that might be going on in the kitchen, overseeing staff and checking in with customers as they dine.... regardless, there was no excuse for this terrible food and unprofessional service. I'm normally a generous tipper but this waiter missed the mark completely. it gave me and my friend no reason to even want to return. The only highlight of the meal was the company, the water....and the friendly Valet parking attendant! He got a good tip from me.





Same compliments I sent to the restaurant as well:

This was our first visit to Brio and we were so impressed. Everyone was so friendly and warm and our server, Alicia was fantastic. She described the menu to us with great detail and almost making it hard to decide because everything sounded so good! We were so grateful Alicia told us about the Summer special (Chicken Milanese and Lasagne) helping make it easier to decide since it was such a good value. She was so knowledgable about everything the restaraunt offered, the menu and how the food was prepared. Way more than we could have asked for, but such a pleasant surprise. I don't usually expect spectacular service at restaraunts, but typically decent at least. She blew me away with her service skills. I am so happy about this awesome experience, excellent service and delicious food. I can't wait to tell my friends, post on Yelp and come back to visit! Thank you so much! Worth every penny I spent in your restaurant tonight!





It is rare that I have a dish that is unlike anything I have ever had...that makes me think I only wish I lived locally so I could have it again...but that is how I feel about the sweet potato and chicken risotto!.  It was extraordinary.  Fresh asparagus, pancetta, and pine nuts mixed in make it all just delicious- bite after bite.    And we dropped off our kids across the street at Safari Kid Care and all together it was a great vacation evening!!  Kids had fun, we ate well and had a nice short walk across the street to our car.  YUM.





Husband and I went here today on a whim. Hungry for any lunch and driving down Scottsdale Rd. we found this place by accident. Never heard of it before and if the menu wasn't appealing, we were going to go to Sol for Mexican food. The menu had Lobster Bisque and we were sold. 

The inside is vast and very open, with high ceilings, enormous "chandeliers", and draperies. Everything is burnt yellow and pale orange colors with simple artwork decorating the walls. It was nice, but not my favorite. Looking around, I think we were the only diners under 30 - except for the one baby. Everyone else was either in their 40s or much older. This didn't look like our typical lunch crowd, but we didn't feel out of place.

I ordered the crab and shrimp cakes with roasted vegetables and hubby ordered the soup and salad - lobster bisque and Caesar. A bread basket came out, with half a mini loaf of sourdough and 3 pizza slice sized crackers with miscellaneous spices on top. Sourdough was good - hot and fresh. Hubby liked the crackers, but I didn't try - too messy.

The food came quickly afterwards. Mine was really good - especially the crab cakes. Only two cakes came on the plate on top of sauce, but there was a heaping vegetable portion. The cakes were soft and moist - the crab and shrimp very apparent throughout and delicious. Hubby's bisque was good, with visable chunks of lobster. Certainly not his favorite, but he said he would eat again. 

Overall, the food was good, but it wasn't spectacular. Also, later we found out Brio is a chain restaurant and for the most part, we try to avoid those and eat locally. If in the area again and have a craving for lobster bisque, we'd eat there, but probably won't be back.





First of all, when I made reservations and asked WHERE in Scottsdale Quarter are you located, the sales staff said they did not know. When we called later that evening, we said we were on the south end of Scottsdale Quarter near such-n-such store, where are you in relation to that, the second clerk did not know. When we finally got there, all three in the front hostess station said they only know they are located in Scottsdale Quarter, Very knowledgeable staff -not. 
Secondly, the atmosphere was like a giant Olive Garden, and the food mediocre at best. My friend and I made a mental note to never return. Doesn't matter because they won't be in business very long, at least in North Scottsdale where there is a ton of competition.





The reviews are all over the map so far for this recent entry into the Kierland-area restaurant scene - and for good reason. It seems that for each pro there exists an equivalent con. 
On arrival, you will find a choice between extremely inconvenient parking or $6 valet service. Not unusual in this area, but nonetheless irritating.
I have visited twice now, both times for lunch, mixed results. Generally speaking, the food is constructed of quality ingredients, presented in an appealing way and won't leave you hungry. 
Service both in the dining area and the bar was amateurish, as is normal for a chain. Timing was way off.
Once seated, we were presented with a bread basket as we ordered drinks. The bread was fresh and warm, and a nice start. Drinks arrived correctly, but I have had better coffee at .... well, everywhere.
We placed our orders, each of our party of three finding something on the menu that we were interested in trying.
As we waited for our meals, we observed the operations throughout the dining room, as seperations between tables were low. While this made for interesting people-watching, conversation was nearly impossible, with nothing to buffet the cacophony of flatware meeting dishes. 
Salads arrived, and they were fairly large if uninteresting. Entrees followed: pastas were very good, hot, tasty and with no shortage of garlic. Pizza however was a flat, soggy mess. 
Dessert tray consisted of a collection of espresso cups filled with a variety of standard offerings. One of the two selected contained a little surprise - a piece of cardboard. I did not order a replacement.
They might have garnered another star, but then we got the check. At about $15 per person, not including tip, we were left feeling quite underwhelmed. 
Altogether, I am left with very little reason to return.





Lunch special was an angel hair pasta was really tasty and the shrimp was very fresh. I had the Eggplant Parmesan which was nice & crusty per the menu description with a very light marinara sauce but the buttered pasta on the side was not hot enough. Disappointing. Service is excellent, we got our food quickly.  We ordered the dessert sampler but they were out of the creme brulee and the server was very gracious and was offering us a good choice of substitution.  We ended up ordering the tiramisu which was very delightful!!!  A definite must try place!





been here many times and service always good.  Food amazing.  love the ravioli and the medalions.  atmosphere always spot on.  dessert of the warm chocolate cake yummy  we add an extra scoop of ice cream and devour away!!  Love this place





Service was great, the bruschetta was decent but rest of the food was so incredibly bad. We ordered two main entrees and a kids meal- all were not worth eating. I really hope we don't have to eat here again. Sorry brio!





First time eating at Brio.  A girlfriend invited me to lunch, great atmosphere, great menu choices and the food was delicious!!  I tried the Brio salad and added chicken, the spices were perfect and the chicken was a good size portion and very moist!  Our server was terrific, prompt, attentive and nice, her name was Kim!  I will be going back!





So okay.  You know Happy Hour at Brooklyn I'd just very awesome! Now I will tell you that lunch is very excellent also.  We had the steak salad.  I recommend it.  Max and Larry handled 2 demanding women and made them leave with smiling get faces. :) can't wait to return to Brooklyn with husbands to taste the delicious good Thank you!p





Decorated to feel like you are in a Tuscan Palace Ballroom.  Swathed in White Curtains attached to the high ceilings, balloon curtains in curved passageways.  
Hot fresh sourdough bread basket & flatbreads - Mmmmm
Salmon was fabby
Potatoes done mashed, pomme frite, shoe strings & chipped.
Brick Chicken grilled to perfection
Yummy Pork Chops fired in wood grille
Excellent Vokda Pasta purses - smack :-)
Most extensive childrens menu I've ever seen!
Great wine list by the bottle & glass - ck out thier partner vineyard with sketchbook.
Bar Bite menu for $2.95 
Cappuccinos done to perfection
Loved the atmosphere - I'll be back - YUM!





Went for happy hour with a  group of professionals.  Found a spot out on the porch and waited for our waiter!  Finally came.  
Rather than waste all of our time on the details.................We will not go back.  The service was terrible!  The food was good and you can't beat the happy hour prices. 
Some of group never received their order and we had to ask (waiter had forgotten to turn it in!!).  No apologies or compensation.  We spent over $100 and had to chase the waiter again to get our bill and pay. 
Not worth the great happy hour prices and treatment we got.  No thanks!





Happy Hour is the only time to go! Obviously my previous statement means this following review applies only to the happy hour menu and service. The food on the menu is $2.95 per item; this is as good as cheap gets! The food is great and the Brio Burger is definitely one of the best. The bruschetta is a another one of my favorites... oh, and the eggplant... and the beef carpaccio... and the--just kidding, they're all pretty freaking good! Unfortunately, they don't really have drinks on the happy hour menu. I usually still get a mojito and it's filled to the brim with ice, leaving very little room for actual alcohol in addition to the fact that they add too much club soda and not enough rum.

The desserts are not on the happy hour menu, but they are definitely delicious. The available desserts seem to vary according to a random and unknown schedule because there's always an old item from the past visit missing and always something new to try.

The service is great and the food comes out quite quickly.





Surprisingly uncrowded for Sunday afternoon.  Big portions, lunch prices for the win!  I wouldn't go for dinner because its overpriced IMO, but avoiding the crowds by going at off times and hitting it up for $14 lunch size pasta is a fair price in a non-chaotic environment.





Love this place. Food is exquisite and the service impeccable. Right away, as you enter, you notice this place is well lit, clean and crisp. I dislike going into a restaurant and it is dim and dingy.





I ate here with a few friends. I had a salmon dish and it tasted great. The service was awesome, we showed up about thirty minutes before closing and the server was patient with us and made us feel right at home. We were the last ones out of the restaurant. I definitely will come back.





Great birthday dinner at the Scottsdale Quarter Brio.  Enjoyed their bruschetta trio appetizer.  Half priced bottles of wine included some great Napa vineyards.  Dinner choices were all very good.  They accommodated our large party with very good service and honored our request for seating by an outlet for a guest with oxygen!





I came here for Valentine's Day with my boyfriend and we loved it. Food was great and our server was so friendly and energetic despite probably having worked a long shift for Valentine's Day. Food came out promptly. I had the Lamb and my boyfriend had the New York Strip. 

The Lamb was seasoned well with lots of flavor and they were big shanks. I got the Brio potatoes which were very big and had this white sauce drizzled in which our server was a mix of ranch and cheese. Would recommend these. 

My boyfriend got the New York strip which was cooked perfectly however was lacking flavor. It wasn't anything to rave about and could've used even just a bit more salt and pepper. This is the reason Brio doesn't get 5 stars.

Dessert was a chocolate lava cake and it was so darn good! Molten chocolate inside and the cake just fell apart and mixed in with the ice cream. Definitely recommend this as a great way to top off your meal. 

Brio was not as romantic as I had expected. Don't get me wrong it was a beautiful restaurant, but it was very open and big. I was hoping for something a little more dark lit and intimate, but Brio better represents a nicer Olive Garden. I would say Cheesecake Factory is a better choice for a romantic dinner.





The service is crisp and professional.  It is located in the hustling and bustling new Scottsdale quarter, right across the street from the parking deck.  Outdoor patio seating lets you observe and people watch.  This is our absolute favorite place for a fabulous tasty steak salad.





One of the best Italian restaurants I have ever been to. or shall I say "Tuscan". this place has AWESOME happy hour mon-thurs from 3:00-6:30 and 9-10 pm. and the menu is awesome for happy hour the brio burger is a MUST HAVE!.. also the diavlo pasta is excellent as well.!





I love this place. I've eaten here a few times now and there is not one thing that has not been above standard. When ever we are not sure where to go out to dinner this is our go to place. just love it!





Amazing happy hour! Great drinks at fair prices and their happy hour appetizers are delicious! Regular meals are a little overpriced in my opinion, but still tasty. Definitely would recommend for happy hour deals and for dinner if you don't mind paying $20-40 for simple, basic pasta dishes. Their portions are huge though so at least you get enough to bring home for next day's lunch.





Fabulous Happy Hour until 6pm. Try the Black Pepper Shrimp with romano crusted eggplant.





The happy hour is unquestionably the best in the valley of the sun.  the tuscan decor is great with the carpaccio topping the appetizer list for both flavor, size and aioli sauce.  The happy hour wines are valued accordingly.  the main dishes are excellent.





We visited Brio at the Scottsdale Quarter for my sister's bachelorette party.  The Staff at Brio were exceptionally accommodating.  They put us in a private room to celebrate the occasion.  Our server Danny was kind, friendly, and on point the whole evening!  And the food was delicious and authentic.  Thank you Brio for making this special occasion so memorable!!!!!





Celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary at this restaurant. The place reminded me of Cheesecake Factory, but on a higher level. The dining area is adjacent to the bar so you can see the three TV's. It's not a very romantic restaurant, used Open Table to make reservation and added a note about our celebration.
When we arrived, we had to wait about 10-15 minutes because they were backlogged. When we were seated, the table had two red napkins shaped as a rose. The manager came by and gave each of us a complimentary glass of champagne.
When I logged into Yelp, there was a coupon for a free appetizer which we used for the Spicy Shrimp and Eggplant. It was delicious and not that spicy. 
I ordered the Shrimp and Lobster Fettuccine and my wife had the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake dinner. The fettuccine was cooked al dente, excellent and the sauce was superb. My wife's crab cake was awesome with the tasty fingerling potatoes.
To top the dinner off, they offered us a free dessert to choose from three. We selected the Brio's Famous Cheesecake. That hit the spot. I ordered coffee which came half full.
The server needs to pay attention and ask additional questions: Do you take cream with your coffee, (so I can get a full cup) and when I ask for a knife, don't wait 20 minutes and get remind. 
With our check, we received a note from the manager congratulating us and offered us a free appetizer on our next visit.
Now this restaurant knows how to entice their patrons...customer service is what it's all about.





Olive Garden is better for way less money. The food is nothing special and the pasta is too well done. The bread was good however. The decor is good but I can't eat it.





Wow! What an amazing experience! Food was excellent and our bartender Brandon was incredible. Definitely will be back!





Mark our waiter was great! Joe the manager helped me taste white wines because I wanted to get a bottle. 

Our whole table enjoyed our meals, cocktails & appetizers. 

Great menu with choices to suit any palette. 

Two draw backs but we wont mention because they made up for them in spades! 

The only negative was hostess who rolled her eyes and was rude when we had to change our reservations. What happened to smile with service.





Here last night with friends. We had to wait a little longer to be seated than I would have liked but we were a party of five so I understand. Once we were seated service was quick and pleasant. We shared a couple of the flatbreads to start, so by the time we ordered entrees I was already pretty full and went with a salad, the strawberry balsamic, which was delicious and just made me feel all ready for summer. We were there quite a while talking and enjoying our meal, and the staff never made us feel hurried although it was a pretty busy night. We tipped well enough that I don't feel bad about taking up space for that long, that's something I always make sure to do in that situation.





Excellent dinner! The service was impeccable right up until we ordered desert and again when we wanted our check. Then it was as if the waiter forgot about us for 15-20 minutes....Other than that one negative, the food was absolutley amazing! Every one of our dinners was delicious. (We all sampled each others) The appetizers and deserts were incredible as well. I would recommend this place to everyone.





I've been here a couple time.  The atmosphere is nice, think Bellagio cafe and that is about what it looks like inside.  Food has always been good and it is a little expensive but not overly.  Perhaps the right level for North Scottsdale.  The only issue i have that every time i have gone i get 'JOHN PIERRE' or whatever his name is.
